eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Failed mini-rebuild due to no memory.
details.internalDescription: Failed mini-rebuild due to no memory.
details.formatString: failed mini-rebuild of %s - no memory

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The amf node [parentName] has been successfully inserted above [childName] in the containing amf tree. This event is issued on the master amg director only.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: inserted amf \"%s\" type %s above amf \"%s\"
details.internalDescription: A new device has been inserted into a device tree in response to a user request to do so.
details.formatString: inserted amf \"%s\" type %s above amf \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The amf node [parentName] has been successfully removed from an amf tree, from the position above amf node [childName]. This event is issued on the master amg director only.

details.customerDescription: removed amf \"%s\" above amf \"%s\"
details.internalDescription: A new device has been removed from a device tree in response to a user request to do so.
details.formatString: removed amf \"%s\" above amf \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The attempt to insert amf node [parentName] above [childName] in the amf tree has been cancelled because a group change occurred before the request could complete. A group change is when a director joins or leaves the group of running directors. This event is issued on the master amg director only.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Once the system has stabilized, so that directors are neither departing nor arriving, re-issue the request to insert the device.

details.customerDescription: Attempt to insert device \"%s\" above device or storage volume \"%s\" cancelled
details.internalDescription: While the system was attempting to insert a device into a device tree, a director either booted up or shut down. To preserve system integrity, all in-process requests to insert a device into a tree are cancelled when this happens.
details.formatString: Attempt to insert device \"%s\" above device or storage volume \"%s\" cancelled

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The attempt to remove amf node [parentName] from its place above [childName] in the amf tree has been cancelled because a group change occurred before the request could complete. A group change is when a director joins or leaves the group of running directors. This event is issued on the master amg director only.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Once the system has stabilized, so that directors are neither departing nor arriving, re-issue the request to insert the device.

details.customerDescription: Attempt to remove device \"%s\" above device or storage volume \"%s\" cancelled
details.internalDescription: While the system was attempting to remove a device from a device tree, a director either booted up or shut down. To preserve system integrity, all in-process requests to remove a device from a tree are cancelled when this happens.
details.formatString: Attempt to remove device \"%s\" above device or storage volume \"%s\" cancelled

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Cached data will be discarded - this is I/O from the host, which YY previously acknowledged, but which was never written to storage volume. Or, if it made it to storage volume temporarily, until the link came back and we realized this cluster is a loser, and then the data gets overwritten by data from the winning cluster(s).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Restore communication link or remote cluster.

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u detached wrt device or storage volume \"%s\" from command.
details.internalDescription: The administrator issued a command to detach the specified cluster from the specified device. If all missing clusters have been detached, then I/O can resume at the remaining clusters.
details.formatString: Cluster %u detached wrt device or storage volume \"%s\" from command.

details.customerDescription: Local cluster (%u) previously detached from device or storage volume \"%s\" by administrator at another cluster.
details.internalDescription: At some time in the past, an administrator at another cluster had declared this cluster as detached from the given device. This cluster has now come in contact with a cluster that knows that, and is learning about the detachment.
details.formatString: Local cluster (%u) previously detached from device or storage volume \"%s\" by administrator at another cluster.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No action, or attempt to restore communication to the specified cluster.

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u previously detached from device or storage volume \"%s\" by administrator at another cluster.
details.internalDescription: At some time in the past, an administrator at another cluster had declared the specified cluster as detached from the specified device. This cluster has now come in contact with a cluster that knows that, and is learning about that detachment.
details.formatString: Cluster %u previously detached from device or storage volume \"%s\" by administrator at another cluster.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the performance implications of this value are important, correct the configuration and restart the tower. Contact EMC Customer Support if you are not aware of setting this parameter.

details.customerDescription: ramfagg kw expected unsigned int, got %s
details.internalDescription: When the director is started up, it can be passed a series of parameters to alter its default behaviour. The value for one of those, "ramfagg", was not in the expected numeric format.
details.formatString: ramfagg kw expected unsigned int, got %s

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the performance implications of this value are important, correct the configuration and restart the tower. Contact EMC Customer Support if you are not aware of setting this parameter.

details.customerDescription: ramfagg kw too big: %s
details.internalDescription: When the director is started up, it can be passed a series of parameters to alter its default behaviour. The value for one of those, "ramfagg", was larger than is supported.
details.formatString: ramfagg kw too big: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amf component detected that two different virtual volume objects have the same name. The Amf component renamed the second virtual volume to prevent a conflict. This occurs because of either (1) a conflict in configuration information that cannot be resolved without manual intervention, or (2) a conflict that occurred because one virtual volume is cluster-local while the other is visible to all clusters. The renaming does not resolve the conflict, but it makes it possible for EMC Customer Support to manually resolve the conflict.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Manual intervention is required. Contact EMC Customer Support to resolve the conflict.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Resolve the conflict using the "amf rename volume" command.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Manual intervention is required. Contact EMC Customer Support to resolve the conflict.

details.arguments: virtualVolumeName vId amfName vId2 amfName2 virtualVolumeName2
details.customerDescription: Name conflict detected, renaming 2nd occurrence.
details.internalDescription: Two discovered virtual volumes reported the same name. This can occur if configuration changes are made when one or more storage volumes are unreachable, if storage devices from separate plexs with existing devices are merged into one system or if a device becomes visible to all clusters and happens to have the same name as a cluster-local device on one cluster.
details.formatString: name conflict: virtual volume \"%s\" id/device-or-storageVolumename 0x%llx/%s vs 0x%llx/%s - renaming 2nd occurrence to \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amf component has created an amf node (named [amfName]) in memory from on-disk config info. The amf was created by an older version of the tower that didn't have virtual volumes. The Amf component has upgraded the amf node by persistently creating a virtual volume for it, named [virtualVolumeName]. The user can override the Amf's choice of name with the "amf rename" command.

details.customerDescription: upgraded amf \"%s\": added virtual volume \"%s\"
details.formatString: upgraded amf \"%s\": added virtual volume \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Events cch/3, cch/4 and amf/21 occur if any user data is actually discarded. Note that writes made on losing clusters just as the link is going down may be discarded. This is based on whether or not the data made it to any of the clusters that end up being winners.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required, other than to beware of the consequences.

details.customerDescription: Created a setting for \"%s\" which may discard data at a losing cluster
details.internalDescription: The loser or majority setting which has just been made is one which may trigger the discarding of acknowledged user data. That will happen if, after an intercluster link outage, the setting fires and further host writes are performed. This means that data writes that the system acknowledges to the host may be discarded in some circumstances.
details.formatString: Created a setting for \"%s\" which may discard data at a losing cluster

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required, other than to beware of the consequences.

details.customerDescription: May have discarded written data for distributed raid 1 \"%s\" at clusters in conflict with cluster %u
details.internalDescription: This warning event is emitted when the user explicitly tells the system that one subset of a set of conflicting clusters is to be the winner. Data that has been accepted by the system at the now losing clusters will be discarded. This data is data written at the losing clusters during (and possibly just before) the link outage.
details.formatString: May have discarded written data for distributed raid 1 \"%s\" at clusters in conflict with cluster %u

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: When applications on the side chosen to be the loser are ready, issue the "amf datawin" command to pick a winner to start the process of undoing changes done on the resulting loser.

details.customerDescription: Conflicting detaches on distributed raid 1 \"%s\", \"amf datawin\" needed to pick a winner
details.internalDescription: During an intercluster link outage, conflicting detaches were issued. The link has now been restored, and a manual "amf datawin" command is needed to decide which side is the winner. When the command is issued, changes made on the losing side during (and possibly just before) the link outage will be undone. Typically, applications running on that losing side should be quiesed while this is done. A host-level backup at the losing side can be done, before declaring the other side the winner and accepting it's data.
details.formatString: Conflicting detaches on distributed raid 1 \"%s\", \"amf datawin\" needed to pick a winner

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If we are currently rebuilding the mirror, we will roll back the write only as far as the block in question. This is similar to the amf/141 event, except that this occurs when the write was directed to only the local mirror [mirrorName] of the distributed raid 1 [amfName].

details.customerDescription: Mirror \"%s\" of raid 1 \"%s\" has been marked fully out of date based on failed local-leg write to block %llu.
details.internalDescription: A write failed on the specified mirror of the given device, causing the mirror to be marked out of date.
details.formatString: Mirror \"%s\" of raid 1 \"%s\" has been marked fully out of date based on failed local-leg write to block %llu.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A director at a losing cluster has learned of its loser status, and the "auto-resume" flag is not set for this virtual volume. The virtual volume is suspended, thus preventing resumption of I/O when mini-rebuilds, etc. are complete. - replacement for almost obsolete event nmg/55 - this event occurs only on the the director exporting the virtual volume, not at all directors at a cluster - on a non-WOF device, there is no limit as to how old data has to be, before it might get deleted on the loser side. On a WOF device, there is a limit (depends on settings, typically about 20 seconds). - this event is easy to miss, because it appears WAY earlier than vdp/15, which happens for a virtual volume that resumes (no loser) - user cannot do a host-level backup of the image at the loser side, because the virtual volume is suspended and can't be seen from the host.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: When host applications are ready (e.g. restarted), issue the "amf losersresume" command to resume the virtual volume (and possibly all such suspended virtual volumes). Note that host reboots may hang until the "amf losersresume" command is issued (SPR 6912).

details.customerDescription: Volume \"%s\" ready to be resumed
details.internalDescription: The virtual volume became suspended because of a link outage. This cluster was declared a loser for the device, and now the clusters are back in touch. When host applications are ready for the new virtual volume data, and all clusters are back in touch, the virtual volume should be resumed using the "amf losersresume" command.
details.formatString: Volume \"%s\" ready to be resumed

details.customerDescription: raid 1 rebuild: %s: child node %u (%s) rebuild killed (%s rebuild)
details.internalDescription: The rebuild has stopped because the user has issued a command to disallow rebuilds on the device in question. The user can issue another command to allow rebuilds on the device, which will cause the rebuild to restart.
details.formatString: raid 1 rebuild: %s: child node %u (%s) rebuild killed (%s rebuild)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The automatic detach of the given cluster from the given device was disallowed, in order to preserve consistency on the device and avoid losing data. Cluster detach is disallowed when the sytem hasn't finished dealing with a previous detach, and the direction of the detach is changing. The only current reason for this event is that the given loser setting would create a contradictory detach, which is disallowed at the moment.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The automatic detach of the given cluster from the given device was disallowed, in order to preserve consistency on the device and avoid losing data.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: To resume I/O, all WAN links should be brought online.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: To resume I/O, all WAN links should be brought online.

details.customerDescription: Loser setting on a device failed to detach a cluster.
details.internalDescription: Loser setting on a device failed to detach a cluster.
details.formatString: Loser setting on device %s failed to detach cluster %u.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The automatic detach of missing clusters from the given device was disallowed based on majority rules, in order to preserve consistency on the device and avoid losing data. Cluster detach is disallowed when the sytem hasn't finished dealing with a previous detach, and the direction of the detach is changing. The only current reason for this event is that the given loser setting would create a contradictory detach, which is disallowed at the moment.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The automatic detach of missing clusters from the given device was disallowed based on majority rules, in order to preserve consistency on the device and avoid losing data.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: To resume I/O, all WAN links should be brought online.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: To resume I/O, all WAN links should be brought online.

details.customerDescription: Detach on device based on majority setting failed.
details.internalDescription: Detach on device based on majority setting failed.
details.formatString: Detach on device %s based on majority setting failed.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This error check added in internal version 2.1base. The earliest form of these settings allowed for 12 bitmap log settings - enough for a 4-way distributed Raid-1 with no protection for loss of local storage.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Verify the correct version of firmware is running on the system. Re-run or re-install if necessary. If the firmware was intentionally changed and will remain at this version, the log settings must be re-created. Contact EMC Customer Support or your installer for assistance.

details.customerDescription: Device \"%s\": too many log settings found - log settings cleared
details.internalDescription: More bitmap log settings than this version of the firmware can support were found in the device configuration. This may be a result of downgrading to an older version of the firmware. Bitmap logging during link outages cannot be performed for this device. Any I/O during a link outage will result in a full rebuild across clusters.
details.formatString: Device \"%s\": too many log settings found - log settings cleared

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A 1/10 second poll is used, in the director "shdn" thread, to wait for log I/O's to drain. If this is suspected, look for routine "detachAllLogs" associated with the "shdn" thread.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is necessary. This situation should not result in more than a second of delay, unless the system is large and has very busy or slow logging storage volumes.

details.customerDescription: waiting for log I
details.internalDescription: As part of shutting down this director, the firmware must drain all active I/O's. This includes I/O's that are related to maintaining the bitmap logs used to avoid full rebuilds. Such an I/O is pending when the shutdown has started. There will be a slight delay while any such I/O's flush out.
details.formatString: waiting for log I

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: For now, the choice of cluster is automatic (we choose the lowest numbered cluster that's in conflict). In the future, we will likely make this configurable.

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u has been logically joined to cluster %u on device %s in the" "presence of conflicting detaches."
details.internalDescription: Conflicting detaches have been detected on a distributed RAID-1. Clusters that are not part of that conflict cannot resume I/O without joining one of the conflicting sets of clusters. The system has automatically chosen one of the conflicting clusters for this purpose. Note that if required, the 'amf losersresume' command must still be issued in order for I/O to resume on the previously non-conflicting cluster.
details.formatString: Cluster %u has been logically joined to cluster %u on device %s in the" "presence of conflicting detaches."

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Issued on the master amg director only.

details.customerDescription: Successfully discarded mirror %lu of amf \"%s\"
details.internalDescription: One redundant copy of the data has been discarded.
details.formatString: Successfully discarded mirror %lu of amf \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The mirror number [mirrorNum] of device [parentName] could not be discarded because a group change has occurred before the request could complete. A group change is when a director joins or leaves the group of running directors. This event is issued on the master amg director only.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Once the system has stabilized, so that directors are neither departing nor arriving, re-issue the request to discard the mirror.

details.customerDescription: Attempt to discard mirror %u of device \"%s\" cancelled
details.internalDescription: While the system was attempting to discard a mirror, a director either booted up or shut down. To preserve system integrity, all in-process requests to discard mirrors are cancelled when this happens.
details.formatString: Attempt to discard mirror %u of device \"%s\" cancelled

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A write to the specified metadata volume has failed. The changes are preserved in memory, but if the entire cluster fails or is shut down before the access to the metadata volume is restored and the changes can be written successfully to disk, the changes will be lost. The system configuration information associated with those metadata writes not written to the disk may be lost.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A write to the specified metadata volume has failed. The changes are preserved in memory, but if the entire cluster fails or is shut down before the access to the metadata volume is restored and the changes can be written successfully to disk, the changes will be lost. The system configuration information associated with those metadata writes not written to the disk may be lost.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: 1. Fix the unhealthy or failed metadata volume, or underlying storage volumes by checking fabric connectivity and the storage array(s). 2. If metadata volume cannot be restored to an 'ok' state, create a new metadata volume using meta-volume create as soon as possible and use the 'meta-volume move' command to persist the in-memory metadata to the newly created metadata volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: 1. Fix the unhealthy or failed metadata volume, or underlying storage volumes by checking fabric connectivity and the storage array(s). 2. If metadata volume cannot be restored to an 'ok' state, create a new metadata volume using meta-volume create as soon as possible and use the 'meta-volume move' command to persist the in-memory metadata to the newly created metadata volume.

details.customerDescription: Metadata volume write failed on the underlying storage volume(s).
details.internalDescription: Metadata volume write failed on the underlying storage volume(s).
details.formatString: Metadata write (%s) failed on device or storage volume \"%s\". Check metadata device \"%s\"."

details.customerDescription: raid 1 rebuild: %s: child node %u (%s) rebuild killed (%s rebuild)
details.internalDescription: The rebuild has stopped because an external request (e.g a non-disruptive upgrade) has requested that all rebuilds stop. Rebuilds will restart when the external condition is removed (e.g. the non-disruptive upgrade succeeds or is cancelled).
details.formatString: raid 1 rebuild: %s: child node %u (%s) rebuild killed (%s rebuild)

details.customerDescription: Rebuild of %s stopped before it could start.
details.internalDescription: The system tried to start a rebuild on the specified device, but before the rebuild could start, an external request such as shutdown or non-disruptive upgrade forced all rebuilds to be stopped. Thus the rebuild was not started.
details.formatString: Rebuild of %s stopped before it could start.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Copy the metadata after all steps of the upgrade have been completed.

details.customerDescription: Could not copy metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - metadata writes are disallowed\n
details.internalDescription: The user issued a command to copy the metadata to a backup metadata device, but that attempt has failed. The reason for the failure is that configuration changes are currently disallowed because an upgrade is being performed.
details.formatString: Could not copy metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - metadata writes are disallowed\n

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Move the metadata after all steps of the upgrade have been completed.

details.customerDescription: Could not move metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - metadata writes are disallowed\n
details.internalDescription: The user issued a command to move the metadata to a backup metadata device, but that attempt has failed. The system has fallen back to using the metadata device that was active prior to the failed attempt to switch to a new metadata device. The reason for the failure is that configuration changes are currently disallowed because an upgrade is being performed.
details.formatString: Could not move metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - metadata writes are disallowed\n

details.customerDescription: Successfully copied metadata to metadata device \"%s\"\n
details.internalDescription: The user issued a command to copy the metadata to a backup metadata device, and that attempt has completed successfully.
details.formatString: Successfully copied metadata to metadata device \"%s\"\n

details.customerDescription: Successfully moved metadata to metadata device \"%s\"\n
details.internalDescription: The user issued a command to move the metadata to a new metadata device, and that attempt has completed successfully.
details.formatString: Successfully moved metadata to metadata device \"%s\"\n

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Copy the metadata to a different metadata device.

details.customerDescription: Could not copy metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - write failure(s)\n
details.internalDescription: The user issued a command to copy the metadata to a new metadata device. That command completed with a failure, because the new metadata device had one or more write errors.
details.formatString: Could not copy metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - write failure(s)\n

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Move the metadata to a different metadata device.

details.customerDescription: Could not move metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - write failure(s)\n
details.internalDescription: The user issued a command to move the metadata to a new metadata device. That command completed with a failure, because the new metadata device had one or more write errors. The system has fallen back to using the metadata device that was active prior to the failed attempt to switch to a new metadata device.
details.formatString: Could not move metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - write failure(s)\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Cached data will be discarded - this is I/O from the host, which YY previously acknowledged, but which was never written to storage volume. Or, if it made it to storage volume temporarily, until the link came back and we realized this cluster is a loser, and then the data gets overwritten by data from the winning cluster(s).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Restore communication link or remote cluster.

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u detached wrt device or storage volume \"%s\" by active detach.
details.internalDescription: The "active detach" mechanism has detached the specified cluster from the specified device. If all missing clusters have been detached, then I/O can resume at the remaining clusters.
details.formatString: Cluster %u detached wrt device or storage volume \"%s\" by active detach.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The flash files corresponding to the active metadata amf on all directors at the local cluster will have to be made consistent, and then the cluster should be rebooted. Alternatively, the flash files can be removed, and then the correct metadata amf activated when the cluster is rebooted.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A conflict has been detected between the views of two or more directors as to which metadata amf should be marked active at a cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If the wrong metadata device has been used to build up devices at the local cluster, steps need to be taken to ensure that the right metadata device is used at the cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the wrong metadata device has been used to build up devices at the local cluster, steps need to be taken to ensure that the right metadata device is used at the cluster. Contact EMC Customer Support for assistance with this procedure.

details.customerDescription: Metadata device version supersedes active metadata device.
details.internalDescription: Metadata device version supersedes active metadata device.
details.formatString: Metadata device \"%s\" version %llu is more recent than currently active metadata device \"%s\" version %llu.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If directors can't be booted at a cluster, it should be possible to simply copy the flash file "activeMetadataInfo" from a director that did receive the update to the ones that didn't.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Boot any missing directors at the relevant cluster, so that their flashes can be updated. If this is not possible, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Not all directors at cluster %u present for change of active metadata device.
details.internalDescription: A new metadata device has been activated. In order to avoid incorrect decisions as to which metadata device should be active, identification of the new active metadata device is stored in the flash of the directors at the same cluster. In this case, not all directors are present, and thus there is the possibility of conflict if the cluster were to be rebooted before this inconsistency is fixed.
details.formatString: Not all directors at cluster %u present for change of active metadata device.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When the disk header is read to see if it is a spare disk, it was found that the disk header size is not a multiple of the disk block size.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: System ignored a disk because it has an invalid block size.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If possible, change the block size of the disk. Otherwise, remove it from the system.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Please contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: A disk has been ignored by the system as the disk has an invalid block size.
details.internalDescription: The system has decided to ignore the specified disk, because it has an invalid block size (i.e. the metadata header size is not a multiple of the block size).
details.formatString: Ignoring disk %s with block size %u.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The firmware believes that the size of a disk or raid has shrunk below the size with which it was created, which puts user data at risk. We treat this condition the same way we treat a failed disk.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The firmware believes that the size of a disk or raid has shrunk below the size with which it was created.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Examine the health and capacity of the backend devices. If they are OK, there may be a software bug. If they appear to have legitimately shrunk, then help the customer resize as required.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: 1. Examine the back-end arrays to determine why the storage has shrunk. 2. Resize the required back-end device to its original size. 3. Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Capacity of device shrank below its configured capacity.
details.internalDescription: Capacity of device shrank below its configured capacity.
details.formatString: Capacity of device \"%s\" has shrunk to %llu blocks, below configured capacity of %llu blocks.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Examine the backend arrays to determine why the storage has increased in capacity.

details.customerDescription: Capacity of a device has increased to at least its original configured value.
details.internalDescription: The capacity of the given raid or disk has increased to at least the size at which the raid or disk was originally configured. We clear the failed-disk-like status in this case.
details.formatString: Capacity of device \"%s\" has increased to at least the configured value of %llu blocks.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The user issued a command to copy the metadata to a new metadata device. That command completed with a failure, because the new metadata device had one or more write errors.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Retry the command once nvol is ready.

details.customerDescription: Could not copy metadata to metadata device [device] - nvol not ready
details.internalDescription: Could not copy metadata to metadata device [device] - nvol not ready
details.formatString: Could not copy metadata to metadata device "%s" - nvol not ready

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The user issued a command to move the metadata to a new metadata device. That command completed with a failure, because nvol was not ready. The system has fallen back to using the metadata device that was active prior to the failed attempt to switch to a new metadata device.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Retry the command once nvol is ready. If nvol is not created yet, then the force option can be used to override this error.

details.customerDescription: Could not move metadata to metadata device [device] - nvol not ready
details.internalDescription: Could not move metadata to metadata device [device] - nvol not ready
details.formatString: Could not move metadata to metadata device "%s" - nvol not ready

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The same disk has been not only presented to multiple clusters, but claimed at those clusters as well. If more than one cluster is doing I/O to the disk, data corruption is extremely likely.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The same disk has been not only presented to multiple clusters, but claimed at those clusters as well. If more than one cluster is doing I/O to the disk, data corruption is extremely likely.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The same disk has been presented to multiple clusters, and also claimed at those clusters. If more than one cluster is sending I/O to the disk, data corruption is extremely likely. Perform these steps: 1. Choose one cluster at which the disk should be used. 2. Tear down all configurations involving the disk at the other cluster. 3. Remove visibility to the disk from the other cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The same disk has been presented to multiple clusters, and also claimed at those clusters. If more than one cluster is sending I/O to the disk, data corruption is extremely likely. Perform these steps: 1. Choose one cluster at which the disk should be used. 2. Tear down all configurations involving the disk at the other cluster. 3. Remove visibility to the disk from the other cluster.

details.customerDescription: A disk has been claimed at more than one cluster.
details.internalDescription: A disk has been claimed at more than one cluster.
details.formatString: Disk %s is claimed at local cluster (%u) and at cluster %u.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A disk in a metadata volume has become unreachable or unhealthy, thereby reducing the redundancy of the metadata volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A disk in a metadata volume has become unreachable or unhealthy, thereby reducing the redundancy of the metadata volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Identify the problem disk, and either fix the problem, or replace the disk.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Identify the problem disk, and either fix the problem, or replace the disk.

details.customerDescription: A metadata volume has experienced a disk problem.
details.internalDescription: A disk problem has reduced the redundancy of a metadata volume.
details.formatString: A disk problem has reduced the redundancy of metadata volume "%s".

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The administrator has removed a mirror from a metadata volume, thereby reducing the redundancy of the metadata volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The administrator has removed a mirror from a metadata volume, thereby reducing the redundancy of the metadata volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If the redundancy of the metadata volume is too low, add another mirror to the metadata volume using meta-volume attach-mirror.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the redundancy of the metadata volume is too low, add another mirror to the metadata volume using meta-volume attach-mirror.

details.customerDescription: The administrator has issued a command to reduce the redundancy of a metadata volume.
details.internalDescription: An administrative command has reduced the redundancy of a metadata volume.
details.formatString: An administrative command has reduced the redundancy of metadata volume "%s".

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: There is no setting in flash about which metadata volume should be active.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: There is no setting in flash about which metadata volume should be active.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Activate a new or a backup metadata volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Activate a new or a backup metadata volume.

details.customerDescription: The local cluster will not activate a metadata volume automatically - a new or backup metadata volume must be activated manually.
details.internalDescription: No active metadata setting in flash - a new or backup metadata volume must be activated.
details.formatString: No active metadata setting in flash - a new or backup metadata volume must be activated.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A fixed time has passed after the local cluster last booted, and the active metadata volume has not yet been detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A fixed time has passed after the local cluster last booted, and the active metadata volume has not yet been detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Fix the problem with the active metadata volume, or activate a backup if no configuration changes have taken place since the backup. If there have been configuration changes, contact EMC to restore from the backup.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Fix the problem with the active metadata volume, or activate a backup if no configuration changes have taken place since the backup. If there have been configuration changes, contact EMC to restore from the backup.

details.customerDescription: The local cluster has timed out after booting waiting for the active metadata volume to arrive.
details.internalDescription: The local cluster has timed out after booting waiting for the active metadata volume to arrive.
details.formatString: Timed out waiting for metadata volume "%s" - fix it or restore from backup.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This setting governs whether extra steps are taken during VPLEX's utilization of backend storage devices to account for their being thinly provisioned. If this setting is misconfigured as false for a particular device, it can lead to the waste of thin pool resources on the backend array. If it is misconfigured as true for a particular device, it can lead to degraded performance during some operations.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If set incorrectly, the setting can be checked and updated via the UI or tower console at any time.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If set incorrectly, the setting can be checked and updated via the UI at any time.

details.customerDescription: The backend storage volume is, or is not, set as a thinly provisioned device.
details.internalDescription: The backend storage volume is, or is not, set as a thinly provisioned device.
details.formatString: Updates thinProvisioned property of amf \"%s\" to be '%s'.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: While reading the configuration information for an amf node, the amf layer noticed that in the list of Raid C slots, there was found to be an invalid number of Raid C slots (too large). Because of this, the amf node in question has been marked unusable.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Invalid settings were read from the metadata.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the status of the devices to determine which device is not available. Fix the problem with the active metadata volume, or activate a backup.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the status of the devices to determine which device is not available. Fix the problem with the active metadata volume, or activate a backup. Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Invalid raidC setting read from metadata.
details.internalDescription: Read too many act_raidCChildConfiguredCapacity tags.
details.formatString: Read too many raidC slots (max %d).

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: While reading the configuration information for a pie amf node, the amf layer noticed that in the list of slices, there was found to be an invalid number of slices (too large). Because of this, the amf node in question has been marked unusable.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the status of the devices to determine which device is not available.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the status of the devices to determine which device is not available. Fix the problem with the active metadata volume, or activate a backup.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the status of the devices to determine which device is not available. Fix the problem with the active metadata volume, or activate a backup. Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Invalid slice setting read from metadata.
details.internalDescription: The value for act_numSlices was found to be too large.
details.formatString: Found (%d) slices which is greater than maximum (%d).

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: There was a structural or semantic problem with the data read from the metadata device that resulted in the failure of the parse operation. This is likely the result of incompatibility with older-version metadata, or a bug with how metadata is read or was previously written.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the status of the devices to determine which device is not available. Contact EMC Customer Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Fix the problem with the active metadata volume, or activate a backup if no configuration changes have taken place since the backup. If there have been configuration changes, contact EMC to restore from the backup.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Fix the problem with the active metadata volume, or activate a backup if no configuration changes have taken place since the backup. If there have been configuration changes, contact EMC to restore from the backup.

details.customerDescription: Parsing of a metadata buffer failed.
details.internalDescription: Parsing of a metadata buffer failed.
details.formatString: Metadata parse failure. (%s) (%s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A raid 1 was rebuilding one of its child nodes and a change in child's state caused the rebuild to abandon. The allowed values are: up-to-date, out-of-date, and disk replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Rebuild of one mirror of a raid-1 device was abandoned.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: No action required. A new rebuild, if needed, will be started automatically.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: No action required. A new rebuild, if needed, will be started automatically.

details.customerDescription: Rebuild of one mirror of a raid-1 device was abandoned.
details.internalDescription: Rebuild of one child of a raid-1 device was abandoned due to a change in child's state.
details.formatString: raid 1 rebuild: %s: child node %lu (%s) rebuild abandoned: child %s(%s rebuild)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Metavolume slots usage has reached warning threshold.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Metavolume is running out of available space.This event does not indicate an immediate metavolume failure.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Refer to the troubleshooting entry for the issue in the Generator.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Refer to the troubleshooting entry for the issue in the Generator.

details.customerDescription: Metavolume utilization has reached warning threshold.
details.internalDescription: Metavolume utilization has reached warning threshold.
details.formatString: Metadata volume %s has reached %u percent capacity.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The usable capacity of a device with an associated virtual volume was expanded via a user command. The usable capacity of the associated virtual volume was expanded by the same amount.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The usable capacity of a device with an associated virtual volume was expanded via a user command. The usable capacity of the associated virtual volume was expanded by the same amount.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: No action required.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: No action required.

details.customerDescription: The usable capacity of a device with an associated virtual volume was expanded.
details.internalDescription: The usable capacity of a device with an associated virtual volume was expanded.
details.formatString: The usable capacity of device \"%s\" has increased from %llu blocks to %llu blocks.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: No action required.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: No action required.

details.customerDescription: The operation to update the raid-1 mirror leg's state following an external change to its underlying data is completed.
details.internalDescription: The operation to update the raid-1 mirror leg's state following an external change to its underlying data is completed.
details.formatString: Data change operation for raid or disk \"%s\" has been forcibly cancelled. Raid-1 consistency may have been lost.

details.customerDescription: An operation to prepare the raid-1's mirror leg for an external change to its underlying data has completed.
details.internalDescription: An operation to prepare the raid-1's mirror leg for an external change to its underlying data has completed.
details.formatString: Data change operation for raid or disk \"%s\" is completed.\n

details.customerDescription: An operation to prepare the raid-1's mirror leg for an external change to its underlying data has started.
details.internalDescription: An operation to prepare the raid-1's mirror leg for an external change to its underlying data has started.
details.formatString: Data change operation for raid or disk \"%s\" has been started.

details.customerDescription: A data change has been applied to both sides of the named distributed raid-1. This distributed raid-1 is also in a state of conflicting detach. Manual resolution of the conflicting detach will also choose the data change winner and resolve conflict data change.
details.internalDescription: A data change has been applied to both sides of the named distributed raid-1. This distributed raid-1 is also in a state of conflicting detach. Manual resolution of the conflicting detach will also choose the data change winner and resolve conflict data change.
details.formatString: Conflicting data change (in addition to conflicting detach) on distributed raid 1 \"%s\". Waiting for manual resolution of conflicting detach to determine data change winner.

details.customerDescription: Initializing the newly added capacity as part of expansion.
details.internalDescription: Initializing the newly added capacity as part of expansion.
details.formatString: Starting writes to initialize expanded capacity on %s (first block %"FS64"u, count %"FS64"u).\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A multi-tiered raid-1, where at least one child is also a raid-1, is rebuilding at the top level, and has a rebuild marked on the lower-level raid-1 as well. The top-level rebuild was paused, causing the lower-level raid-1 to lose track of its marked rebuild. The top-level rebuild has been rolled back to ensure the the blocks that need be written to the lower-level rebuild target will be written by the top-level rebuild when it restarts.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A multi-tiered raid-1, where at least one child is also a raid-1, is rebuilding at the top level, and has a rebuild marked on the lower-level raid-1 as well. The top-level rebuild was paused, causing the lower-level raid-1 to lose track of its marked rebuild. The top-level rebuild has been rolled back to ensure the the blocks that need be written to the lower-level rebuild target will be written by the top-level rebuild when it restarts.

details.customerDescription: Rebuild flag on a device leg has been lost, so a higher-level rebuild is rolled back to ensure data consistency.
details.internalDescription: Rebuild flag on a device has been lost, so a higher-level rebuild is rolled back to ensure data consistency.
details.formatString: Rebuild on target device \"%s\" rolled back because a rebuild marked on a lower device is being forgotten.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A raid-1 is a child of a raid-1. The lower level raid-1 has had all its child nodes marked further out-of-date, most likely because each of those child nodes was unhealthy at some point. The rebuild targeting the lower level raid-1 has been rolled back to ensure data consistency. A current rebuild of the raid-1 will roll back to block zero; if there is no current rebuild, then a future rebuild will start at block zero.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A raid-1 is a child of a raid-1. The lower level raid-1 has had all its child nodes marked further out-of-date, most likely because each of those child nodes was unhealthy at some point. The rebuild targeting the lower level raid-1 has been rolled back to ensure data consistency. A current rebuild of the raid-1 will roll back to block zero; if there is no current rebuild, then a future rebuild will start at block zero.

details.customerDescription: All child devices of a raid-1 have become further out-of-date, so any current rebuild with that raid-1 as a target will roll back to block zero; if there is no current rebuild, any future rebuild will start at block zero.
details.internalDescription: All child devices of a raid-1 have become further out-of-date, so any current rebuild with that raid-1 as a target will roll back to block zero; if there is no current rebuild, any future rebuild will start at block zero.
details.formatString: Rebuild on raid 1 target device \"%s\" rolled back because all its child devices have become further out of date

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: All the storage-volume(s) supporting this mirror leg are performing very poorly, causing severe degradation in the RAID-1 performance. To improve the RAID-1 performance through the healthy legs, the IOs to the poorly performing child have been blocked.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: All the storage-volume(s) supporting this mirror leg are performing very poorly, causing severe degradation in the RAID-1 performance. To improve the RAID-1 performance through the healthy legs, the IOs to the poorly performing child have been blocked.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The cause of storage-volume's poor performance must be determined and fixed. If the underlying issues cannot be fixed in a timely manner, consider detaching the unhealthy mirror and attaching a healthy mirror.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Determine the cause of storage-volume's poor performance by referring to the troubleshooting entry related to degraded disks and isolated mirrors in the normal operation section of the Generator. If the underlying issues cannot be fixed in a timely manner, consider detaching the unhealthy mirror from the RAID-1 device and attaching a mirror based on healthy storage-volume(s) to reinstate redundancy. Contact EMC Support if the problem persists.

details.customerDescription: The IOs to a mirror leg of a RAID-1 has been blocked.
details.internalDescription: A mirror leg of a RAID-1 has been isolated.
details.formatString: mirror \"%s\" of raid-1 \"%s\" has been isolated due to severe performance degradation on disk \"%s\".

details.customerDescription: A mirror leg of a raid-1 was isolated as the underlying storage-volume(s) supporting the mirror were performing very poorly. The storage-volume(s) are no longer performing poorly, hence the mirror is being automatically un-isolated to allow IOs to be serviced by this mirror and redundancy reinstated.
details.internalDescription: A mirror leg of a raid-1 was isolated as the underlying storage-volume(s) supporting the mirror were performing very poorly. The storage-volume(s) are no longer performing poorly, hence the mirror is being automatically un-isolated to allow IOs to be serviced by this mirror and redundancy reinstated.
details.formatString: mirror \"%s\" of raid-1 \"%s\" has been automatically un-isolated because disk \"%s\" is no longer performance-degraded.

details.customerDescription: A user has manually un-isolated a mirror using a command.
details.internalDescription: A user has manually un-isolated a mirror using a command.
details.formatString: mirror \"%s\" of raid-1 \"%s\" has been manually un-isolated.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The log rebuild has stopped because an access request failure has happened. Full rebuilds will supercede log rebuild later when the leg becomes healthy again.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The rebuild has stopped because both the distributed volume leg and logging volume failed at the same time. Rebuild will re-start later when the leg becomes healthy again.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: No action required. VPLEX will recover itself once the distributed volume leg becomes healthy again.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: No action required. VPLEX will recover itself once the distributed volume leg becomes healthy again.

details.customerDescription: The rebuild has stopped because both the distributed volume leg and logging volume failed at the same time. Rebuild will re-start later when the leg becomes healthy again.
details.internalDescription: The log rebuild has stopped because an access request failure has happened. Full rebuilds will supercede log rebuild later when the leg becomes healthy again.
details.formatString: raid 1 rebuild: %s: child node %u (%s) rebuild killed (%s rebuild)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The capacity of a disk has changed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The capacity of a disk has changed.

details.customerDescription: The capacity of a disk has changed.
details.internalDescription: The capacity of a disk has changed.
details.formatString: Capacity of disk "%s" has changed from %"FS64"u to %"FS64"u.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The average I/O latency on a disk has exceeded the acceptable limit due to possible issues on the back-end.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The average I/O latency on a disk has exceeded the acceptable limit due to possible issues on the back-end.

details.customerDescription: The average I/O latency on a disk has exceeded the acceptable limit.
details.internalDescription: The average I/O latency on a disk has exceeded the acceptable limit.
details.formatString: Amf "%s" performance has degraded. Average %s I/O latency increased from %lu.%03lu milliseconds to %lu.%03lu milliseconds, which is above the acceptable limit of %u milliseconds.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The average I/O latency on a disk is now in acceptable range, either because the issue impacting the latency has been resolved or there are no I/Os being performed to the disk.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The average I/O latency on a disk is now in acceptable range, either because the issue impacting the latency has been resolved or there are no I/Os being performed to the disk.

details.customerDescription: The average I/O latency on a disk is now in acceptable range.
details.internalDescription: The average I/O latency on a disk is now in acceptable range.
details.formatString: Amf "%s" performance is now acceptable. Average %s I/O latency decreased from %lu.%03lu milliseconds to %lu.%03lu milliseconds, which is below the threshold of %u milliseconds.

Read latencies for %u disks and write latencies for %u disks increased above acceptable limits but were not reported. Read latencies for %u disks and write latencies for %u disks dropped below threshold but were not reported."

details.formatString: Can't find slice beneath extent %s, which is beneath pie amf %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amg prints this message when it first comes up on any director. It indicates that the Amg does not know any official state yet, and so will not be involved in sending such state to any other directors, and is more likely to receive state from elsewhere. NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components will follow the Amg in this startup activity.

details.customerDescription: AMG: I am a new controller.
details.formatString: AMG: I am a new controller.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When an new Amg decides that there are no other directors out there that can send it the initial state, it creates an empty initial state. This event accompanies that creation. NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components will follow the Amg in this startup activity.

details.customerDescription: AMG: Doing first-controller initialization.
details.formatString: AMG: Doing first-controller initialization.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When an Amg is not new, i.e. has either created or received initial state, it is a candidate for sending that state to a subsequent new director. This event indicates that this Amg has been chosen to send out the current state as the initial state for one or more new directors. NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components make the same decision about who will send state.

details.customerDescription: AMG: I will now send the current state.
details.formatString: AMG: I will now send the current state.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amg has noticed that the set of active directors has changed. However, the mechanism by which the Amg software determines which is the "master" director has resulted in this director, which was previously the "master", is still the "master". NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components make the same decision about mastership.

details.customerDescription: AMG: Nmg re-discovery, but I am still the master.
details.formatString: AMG: Nmg re-discovery, but I am still the master.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When the set of active directors changed, the director that used to be the "master" has gone away, and this director is now the "master". NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components make the same decision about mastership.

details.customerDescription: AMG: Controller group change, I am now the master.
details.formatString: AMG: Controller group change, I am now the master.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When the set of active directors changed, at least one new director appeared, and the Amg's mechanism for chosing the "master" has decided that one of those new directors should now be the "master". This director, which used to be the "master", is reporting that it is no longer the "master". NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components make the same decision about mastership.

details.customerDescription: AMG: Controller group change, I am no longer the master.
details.formatString: AMG: Controller group change, I am no longer the master.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amg logs this event when it is starting normal processing. This happens only when the director has not yet been in a state where it can do normal processing. The switch occurs when all of the directors (including this new one) have reported that they have received all of an initial state send. NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components will follow the Amg in this startup activity.

details.customerDescription: AMG: Commencing normal operation.
details.formatString: AMG: Commencing normal operation.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A new Amg director will log this event after it has received all of an initial state send. This director is now ready for normal operation, but will not commence such operation until all new directors have similarly received their initial state from some other director. NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components will follow the Amg in this startup activity.

details.customerDescription: AMG: Received all of initial state.
details.formatString: AMG: Received all of initial state.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: One of the jobs of the Amg, as it was initially conceived, is to filter out redundant notifications (originating with the back end Fibre Channel software) of the appearance and disappearance of storage volumes. This is because all directors find out about those happenings, and having all directors broadcast each to all other directors is too many messages. So, each sends a notification to the "master" Amg director, and that director filters them. This event will be produced whenever a director sees the appearance of a storage volume that it already knows about. Typically, this will be because it has found out about the storage volume because of the initial state given to it by some other Amg director. This is should not be a problem - just a small timing window. [storageVolumeId] is the logical unit identifier of the storage volume.

details.customerDescription: AMG: duplicate storage volume %s ignored
details.formatString: AMG: duplicate storage volume %s ignored

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When the Amg is informed of storage volumes by the Amf, the Amf will have read the header of the storage volume, and so knows the id of the spare pool associated with that storage volume. If that spare pool no longer exists, the Amg will attempt to re-create it. If it cannot do so, because its space for spare pools is exhausted, it will instead simply put the storage volume into the default spare pool. This event indicates that that has happened. [oldPoolId] is the id of the spare pool as indicated by the storage volume, [storageVolumeId] is the logical unit id of the storage volume, [newPoolName] is the name of the spare pool that the storage volume was actually put into, and [newPoolId] is the new pool's 64-bit unique id.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Ensure the spare pools required to support automatic storage volume replacement exist and contain storage volumes.

details.customerDescription: AMG: No room for pool with id 0x%016llx, storage volume %s moved to pool %s
details.internalDescription: The reported storage volume belonged to a spare pool that no longer exists. The system was unable to recreate the spare pool because the maximum number of spare pools already exists.
details.formatString: AMG: No room for pool with id 0x%016llx, storage volume %s moved to pool %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: In some circumstance I don't currently understand, the Amf is telling the Amg that it could not write out a set of storage volume headers. I don't know if it matters. Later: I believe our intent was that only one director in a system would actually go and write the storage volume headers. However, I believe that all directors currently go and do it. Thus, having the header update fail on one director is not necessarily important, as long as the write doesn't scramble the data, and there is no later write to fix it, and as long as at least one director succeeds in the write.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Configuration information for the device could not be persisted. This message is significant only if reported by every director.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If this message is reported by every director, check the cables and connections to the meta-volume and fix any issues. Use the "amf meta restore" command to save the in-memory configuration data to the meta-volume. Check the status of the devices to determine which device set is not available. Contact EMC Customer Support

details.customerDescription: failed to initialize device \"%s\" on storage volume.
details.internalDescription: If this message is reported by each director in the system, the device set did not initialize properly. If any director successfully writes out configuration information, the device set was successfully created.
details.formatString: failed to initialize device \"%s\" on storage volume.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amg has been asked to find a replacement storage volume for a storage volume that the Amf wants to replace. Unfortunately the spare pool associated with the request has no storage volumes left in it. So, the failed storage volume cannot be replaced, and the device it is in will continue to run in crippled mode. The name of the storage volume (should be equivalent to the hex form of its 64 bit numeric storage volume id) is given, and the id of the spare pool.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Ensure the spare pools required to support automatic storage volume replacement exist and contain storage volumes.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Manually replace the failed storage volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support to manually replace the failed storage volume.

details.customerDescription: No replacement storage volume found in pool.
details.internalDescription: The specified spare pool does not contain any storage volumes to replace the storage volume. The failed storage volume cannot be replaced.
details.formatString: AMG: No replacement storage volume for storage volume \"%s\" found in pool id 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amf has asked the Amg to coordinate a needed rebuild of a RAID-1. The Amg, however, has no rebuild records left to record that request, and so the rebuild will not happen immediately. As soon as the Amg detects that rebuild records are available, it will ask the Amg to scan the amf nodes and start waiting rebuilds. This means that eventually, this rebuild and all others that were delayed will be processed. [amfName] is the name of the Amf (RAID-1) concerned.

details.customerDescription: AMG: No rebuild record for rebuild of \"%s\". Rebuild will be done later.
details.internalDescription: The system will automatically rebuild the device when resources beome available.
details.formatString: AMG: No rebuild record for rebuild of \"%s\". Rebuild will be done later.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When a rebuild is requested, the Amg will chose a director to do the rebuild, based on where current rebuilds are happening. If that director does not have the resources to do the rebuild, the Amg will try another director. Eventually, the Amg will stop trying directors, and will generate this event. [amfName] is the name of the Amf (RAID-1) involved.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: AMG: No controller able to start rebuild on \"%s\" - try manual rebuild.
details.internalDescription: A storage volume failed and the system tried to repair the device set but was not successful.
details.formatString: AMG: No controller able to start rebuild on \"%s\" - try manual rebuild.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is created when the "amg padd" command is able to create a new spare pool. [poolName] is the user-given name for the new pool, and [poolId] is the Amg-given 64 bit numeric identifier for the new spare pool.

details.customerDescription: Spare pool \"%s\" created, id 0x%016llx.
details.formatString: Spare pool \"%s\" created, id 0x%016llx.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is generated when the "amg psub" command is able to destroy a spare pool. [poolName] is the current name of the spare pool as given by the user ("[unnamed]" if this is not known), and [poolId] is the 64-bit unique id associated with the spare pool.

details.customerDescription: Spare pool %s
details.formatString: Spare pool %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event confirms a user request to rename a spare pool. If [poolOldName] is unknown, "[unnamed]" will be used.

details.customerDescription: Spare pool %s
details.formatString: Spare pool %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is generated when the "amg movestorageVolume" command is able to move the storage volume with logical unit id [storageVolumeId] from the pool given by its name and id into the pool given by its name and id.

details.customerDescription: Moved storage volume %s from spare pool %s "pool %s/0x%016llx
details.formatString: Moved storage volume %s from spare pool %s "pool %s/0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is generated when the "amg movedisks" command is able to move [storageVolumeCount] storage volumes from the first spare pool (given by its name and id) to the second spare pool (also given by its name and id).

details.customerDescription: Moved %ld storage volumes from spare pool %s "%s/0x%016llx
details.formatString: Moved %ld storage volumes from spare pool %s "%s/0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The indicated storage volume pool has become empty. This could be because of automatic replacement of a failing storage volume, or due to the administrator moving storage volumes out of the pool, or due to the creation of a device from storage volumes in the pool, or due to the last storage volume in the pool being removed or becoming out of touch. Severity should really be ERR/CRIT, if the user has any RAID-1s with auto-replace on that are down to a single leg, and use this spare pool. Fixing JBOD events is low-priority today.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Add storage volumes to the reported pool.

details.customerDescription: Storage volume pool %s
details.internalDescription: The devices that rely on the reported storage volume pool are at risk. The system has no storage volumes available in the storage volume pool for auto replacement.
details.formatString: Storage volume pool %s

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the performance implications of this value are important, correct the configuration and restart the tower. Contact EMC Customer Support if you are not aware of setting this parameter.

details.customerDescription: evictAfterFlush kw expected bool, got \"%s\"
details.internalDescription: When the director is started up, it can be passed a series of parameters to alter its default behaviour. The value for one of those, "evictAfterFlush", was not in the expected boolean format.
details.formatString: evictAfterFlush kw expected bool, got \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Report this event to EMC Techincal Support. It likely does not indicate a problem, but the system configuration should be examined to see if the causes of the high concurrency can be addressed.

details.customerDescription: Very high concurrency detected on page 0x%"FS64"x of virtual volume %s.
details.internalDescription: Many operations are active on the specified page. The EMC cache coherency is able to handle this level of concurrency, but if the level increases too much further, problems may arise.
details.formatString: Very high concurrency detected on page 0x%"FS64"x of virtual volume %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: User-initiated cache invalidation of volume started. This is a preparatory step to recover the data from a backup storage-volume.

details.internalDescription: User-initiated operation to invalidate-cache of volume failed. \

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: RecoverPoint appliance has indicated that it should have exclusive access to a volume. Hosts will be unable to access RecoverPoint volumes while in exclusive use by an RPA.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: To access a volume which RecoverPoint is controlling, enable Image Access Mode from the RecoverPoint UI.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: To access a volume which RecoverPoint is controlling, enable Image Access Mode from the RecoverPoint UI.

details.customerDescription: director 0x%016llx is running a binary with different version (%s).

The system has detected that the reported director is running a version of firmware that is different than the director that sent this event. The reported director will not be allowed to join the system.
details.formatString: director 0x%016llx is running a binary with different version (%s).

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The director will be in a partially booted state, which allows a value to be set for cluster-id. Contact EMC Customer Support for assistance in setting this value.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check connections for poorly-performing wan-com or local-com links. Check number of RDMA operations going across CMI. Investigate the firmware.log for instances of IO timeouts/errors and link errors between the com connections to narrow down which are causing the latency.

details.customerDescription: Delaying the arrival of a director in the local or remote cluster.
details.internalDescription: Delaying the arrival of a director in the local or remote cluster.
details.formatString: delaying arrival of node 0x%016"FS64x" (Regular Domain) since it has a new instance ID and is still nmg-arrived.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The firmware version number between directors are different.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The firmware version number between directors are different.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: This can sometimes happen during NDUs. Check if NDU is in process. Contact VPLEX engineering otherwise.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: A director on the remote end of a communication path is running a different firmware version.
details.internalDescription: A director on the remote end of a communication path is running a different firmware version.
details.formatString: foreign binary \'%s\' discovered on path %s (expected \'%s\').

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: No firmware version number was reported by the remote director.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No firmware version number was reported by the remote director.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Contact VPLEX engineering.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: A director on the remote end of a communication path does not have a firmware version number.
details.internalDescription: A director on the remote end of a communication path does not have a firmware version number.
details.formatString: node 0x%"FS64x" on path %s has no version field (found %zu bytes, expected at least 4)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Remote director is running an incompatible version.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Remote director is running an incompatible version.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Contact VPLEX engineering.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: A director on the remote end of a communication path has an unexpected version mask.
details.internalDescription: A director on the remote end of a communication path has an unexpected version mask.
details.formatString: node 0x%"FS64x" on path %s only supports version mask 0x%08X (expected one of 0x%08X)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Remote director has a shorter client data field than expected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Remote director has a shorter client data field than expected.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Contact VPLEX engineering.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: A director on the remote end of a communication path has a client data field (contains version information) shorter than expected.
details.internalDescription: A director on the remote end of a communication path has a client data field (contains version information) shorter than expected.
details.formatString: node 0x%"FS64x" on path %s has short client data field (%zu bytes, expected at least %zu)

details.customerDescription: Setup for communication on the FC port has completed.
details.internalDescription: Setup for communication on the FC port has completed.
details.formatString: endpoint created on port %s

details.customerDescription: The communication setup on the FC port has been torn down.
details.internalDescription: The communication setup on the FC port has been torn down.
details.formatString: endpoint destroyed on port %s

details.customerDescription: An FC communication path has been created.
details.internalDescription: An FC communication path has been created.
details.formatString: path %s created

details.customerDescription: When a FC communication path is established between initiator and target, a probe is sent to determine if short-write is supported by the target. If supported and write-acceleration is disabled, short-write is enabled and is used whenever possible.
details.internalDescription: When a FC communication path is established between initiator and target, a probe is sent to determine if short-write is supported by the target. If supported and write-acceleration is disabled, short-write is enabled and is used whenever possible.
details.formatString: sending immediate data probe (%"FS64u" bytes) to 0x%"FS64x"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If the result is a failure, short-write capabilities are not supported on this communication path. The path will continue to work but may suffer degraded performance.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the result is a failure, short-write capabilities are not supported on this communication path. The path will continue to work but may suffer degraded performance.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If the result is a failure, check the switches and make sure (1) the target does have short-write capabilities, and (2) write-acceleration is disabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the result is a failure, check the switches and make sure (1) the target does have short-write capabilities, and (2) write-acceleration is disabled.

details.customerDescription: A short-write probe to a remote director completed with the specified size and result.
details.internalDescription: A short-write probe to a remote director completed with the specified size and result.
details.formatString: immediate data probe to 0x%"FS64x" completed, size: %u result: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Link went up on a communication port.

details.internalDescription: Link went up on a communication port.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A communication path is destroyed because the remote end of the path cannot be reached.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A communication path is destroyed because the remote end of the path cannot be reached.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the state of the COM port, make sure it is enabled; check the cable and the SFP, make sure they are properly plugged in; check the switch if applicable, make sure it is operational and the corresponding port is enabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the state of the COM port, make sure it is enabled; check the cable and the SFP, make sure they are properly plugged in; check the switch if applicable, make sure it is operational and the corresponding port is enabled. Contact EMC support if this event persists.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the state of the COM port, make sure it is enabled; check the cable and the SFP, make sure they are properly plugged in; check the switch if applicable, make sure it is operational and the corresponding port is enabled. Contact EMC support.

On a GSX 3000 tv0/1 corresponds to the port labeled IB1, tv0/2 corresponds to the port labeled IB2, tv1/1 corresponds to the port labeled IB3, and tv1/2 corresponds to the port labeled IB4.
details.formatString: %s

details.formatString: Path 0x%016"FS64x"-0x%016"FS64x" (uuid 0x%016"FS64x"): noted service arrival."

details.formatString: Path 0x%016"FS64x"-0x%016"FS64x" (uuid 0x%016"FS64x"): remote port will initiate connections."

details.formatString: Path 0x%016"FS64x"-0x%016"FS64x" (uuid 0x%016"FS64x"): initiating %d connections."

details.formatString: Path 0x%016"FS64x"-0x%016"FS64x" (uuid 0x%016"FS64x"): waiting for I/O to drain before initiating %d connections."

details.formatString: Path 0x%016"FS64x":%d-0x%016"FS64x":%d (uuid 0x%016"FS64x"): allocated a connection."

details.formatString: Path 0x%016"FS64x"-0x%016"FS64x" (uuid 0x%016"FS64x"): noted service departure.

details.formatString: Resetting connections to uuid 0x%016"FS64x".

details.formatString: Path 0x%016"FS64x":%d-0x%016"FS64x":%d (uuid 0x%016"FS64x"): connection request timed out."
