details.formatString: uuid 0x%016llx arrives

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The interface is found, the status is unknown.

details.customerDescription: found local interface (%d) (name: %s).
details.internalDescription: The system found an ethernet interface with index [index] and name [ifName].
details.formatString: found local interface (%d) (name: %s).

details.arguments: index ifname address mask netmask bandwidth
details.customerDescription: local interface (%d) (name: %s) address: %s:%s bandwidth %u just became up.
details.internalDescription: The local ethernet interface index [index] name [ifName] just became online with IP address [address] and network mask [netmask]. The first hop bandwidth is [bandwidth] bps (0 means unknown).
details.formatString: local interface (%d) (name: %s) address: %s/%s bandwidth %u just became up.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the ethernet cable and the directly attached switch/router.

details.arguments: index ifname address mask netmask bandwidth
details.customerDescription: local interface (%d) (name: %s) address: %s:%s bandwidth %u just went down.
details.internalDescription: The ethernet cable attached to the port may have been pulled; or the directly attached switch/router may be resetting.

details.arguments: index ifname address mask netmask bandwidth
details.customerDescription: local interface (%d) (name: %s) address: %s:%s bandwidth %u configuration changed.

details.formatString: local interface (%d) (name: %s) address: %s/%s bandwidth %u configuration changed.

details.arguments: index ifname address mask netmask bandwidth

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A director with [uuid1] just connected to local director, however, it has the same IP address / port number pair as a departed director with [uuid2].

details.customerDescription: a new director 0x%016llx service %s took the IP address and port number of obsolete director 0x%016llx.
details.formatString: a new director 0x%016llx service %s took the IP address and port number of obsolete director 0x%016llx.

details.arguments: uuid service r_minconn r_maxconn l_minconn l_maxconn u_minconn u_maxconn
details.customerDescription: director 0x%016llx service %s has different connection count setings (min %u, max %u) than local director (min %u, max %u), using (min %u, max %u)
details.internalDescription: Just established connection(s) to a remote director [uuid], however, the remote director and the local director have different minconn/maxconn settings. Using u_minconn and u_maxconn for minconn/maxconn values, which is the maximum of [r_minconn] and [l_minconn] for minconn, and the maximum of [r_maxconn] and [l_maxconn] for maxconn. Administrative action should be taken to eliminate this difference.
details.formatString: director 0x%016llx service %s has different connection count setings (min %u, max %u) than local director (min %u, max %u), using (min %u, max %u)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Service [service] started to listen on port [port].

details.customerDescription: Service %s listens on port %d."
details.internalDescription: Service [service] started to listen on port [port].
details.formatString: Service %s listens on port %d."

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event only show up when CTS_DEBUG_RECVSTALL is enabled to level 2 or higher (not part of a production build). It indicates that the connection [pointer] hasn't received any incoming byte for [seconds]. And com/tcp will try to rectify it by close the connection soon.

details.customerDescription: conn %p service %s lost activity for %u sec.
details.formatString: conn %p service %s lost activity for %u sec.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Select() indicates that there were something ready on connection [pointer] for receiving, but recv() returned zero byte. This is a good indication that the connection is broken.

details.customerDescription: ready conn %p service %s sent 0 byte?
details.formatString: ready conn %p service %s sent 0 byte?

details.customerDescription: Packet contents: %s
details.internalDescription: This event follows event 16, 17, 18 or 19, when a corrupted packet was received, dumping out the contents of the packet.
details.formatString: Packet contents: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: received a packet with wrong magic from %s at connection state %s service %s
details.internalDescription: There is an incoming packet contains a wrong leading marker. If this happens too often, that means there is likely somebody attacking the system.
details.formatString: received a packet with wrong magic from %s at connection state %s service %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: One incoming packet from IP address [addr] contains an unknown type [type]. Therefor the connection will be closed and the IO would continue on other avalable connections.

details.customerDescription: received a packet from %s with unknown type %d via service %s
details.formatString: received a packet from %s with unknown type %d via service %s

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: received a packet from %s with wrong checksum: %x %x" "via service %s
details.internalDescription: An incoming packet from [addr] contains a wrong checksum.
details.formatString: received a packet from %s with wrong checksum: %x %x" "via service %s

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: received a packet with wrong tail magic from %s via service %s
details.internalDescription: Received a packet with wrong tail marker.
details.formatString: received a packet with wrong tail magic from %s via service %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An IP network device is no longer present. The network device driver may have been unloaded by accident.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An IP network device is no longer present. The network device driver may have been unloaded by accident.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The CS Recovery Team must follow KBA 332052 to restart the firmware of the director. If that does not resolve the issue the CS Recovery Team must follow KBA 304328 to reboot the director OS.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An IP network device is no longer present.
details.internalDescription: An IP network device is no longer present.
details.formatString: IP network device %s (port %s) is no longer present.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An IP network device that was missing is now present.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An IP network device that was missing is now present.

details.customerDescription: An IP network device is now present.
details.internalDescription: An IP network device is now present.
details.formatString: An IP network device %s (port %s) is now present.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An IP network port that was down is now up.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An IP network port that was down is now up.

details.customerDescription: An IP network port is now up.
details.internalDescription: An IP network port is now up.
details.formatString: An IP network port %s (%s) just became up.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Link went down on a port, depending on the port role, a physical path to local or remote cluster has been lost.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Link went down on a port, depending on the port role, a physical path to local or remote cluster has been lost.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The link went down on a port. Depending on the port role, a physical path to the local or remote cluster has been lost. Perform the following steps: 1. Check the state of the port, and ensure that it is enabled. 2. Check the cable and the SFP, and ensure they are properly plugged in. 3. Check the switch if applicable, and ensure it is operational and the corresponding port is enabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The link went down on a port. Depending on the port role, a physical path to the local or remote cluster has been lost. Perform the following steps: 1. Check the state of the port, and ensure that it is enabled. 2. Check the cable and the SFP, and ensure they are properly plugged in. 3. Check the switch if applicable, and ensure it is operational and the corresponding port is enabled. 4. If the link remains down, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An IP network port has gone down.
details.internalDescription: An IP network port has gone down.
details.formatString: IP network port %s (%s) has gone down.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Interface settings are different from firmware configurations. Reapplying the firmware configuration.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Reapplying the firmware configuration for IP port.

details.customerDescription: Reapplying the firmware configuration for IP port.
details.internalDescription: Interface settings are different from firmware configurations, reapplying the configuration.
details.formatString: Interface %s (%s) settings are different from the firmware configuration, reapplying the configuration.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.internalDescription: Unexpected nvol read error.
details.formatString: Unexpected nvol read result: %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A connection is degraded. The link path between two directors is experiencing high packet loss, high latency or degraded bandwidth problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A connection is degraded. The link path between two directors is experiencing high packet loss, high latency or degraded bandwidth problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the network cable and SFP, make sure they are properly plugged in and clean the Fiber connectors along the link path.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the network cable and SFP, make sure they are properly plugged in and clean the Fiber connectors along the link path.

details.customerDescription: A connection is degraded.
details.internalDescription: A connection is degraded.
details.formatString: The connection %s from network port %s to IP %s is degraded.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A degraded connection is back to normal. This clears a previous connection degraded condition for this specific connection.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A degraded connection is back to normal. This clears a previous connection degraded condition for this specific connection.

details.customerDescription: A degraded connection is back to normal.
details.internalDescription: A degraded connection is back to normal.
details.formatString: The degraded connection %s from network port %s to IP %s is back to normal.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An SFP is missing, inserted incorrectly, or faulty.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An SFP is missing, inserted incorrectly, or faulty.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Apply the following measures until the issue has been resolved: 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event; 2. If the SFP is missing, insert a new SFP and attach the appropriate cable; 3. Re-seat the SFP; 4. Replace the SFP; 5. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An SFP on Ethernet port is not responding.
details.internalDescription: An SFP on Ethernet port is not responding.
details.formatString: SFP is not detected on port %s (dev %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An SFP that had previously been missing has now been detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An SFP that had previously been missing has now been detected.

details.customerDescription: An SFP that was previously not responding has been detected.
details.internalDescription: An SFP that was previously not responding has been detected.
details.formatString: SFP has been detected on port %s (dev %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The EMC part number of the SFP was not recognized. It is required to use EMC approved SFPs with the EMC products.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The EMC part number of the SFP was not recognized. It is required to use EMC approved SFPs with the EMC products.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Verify how this SFP end up in the shipped product and replace the SFP with an EMC approved SFP for the product.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The port is equipped with an SFP which is not approved by EMC. Please contact EMC Customer Support for replacement.

details.customerDescription: The port is equipped with an SFP which is not approved by EMC.
details.internalDescription: The port is equipped with an SFP which is not approved by EMC.
details.formatString: SFP on port %s (dev %s) is not an EMC approved part: manufacture \"%s\", part number \"%s\", serial number \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A port, previously detected equipped with an SFP not approved by EMC, has now been equipped with an SFP approved by EMC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A port, previously detected equipped with an SFP not approved by EMC, has now been equipped with an SFP approved by EMC.

details.customerDescription: An SFP not approved by EMC, has been replaced with an approved SFP.
details.internalDescription: An SFP not approved by EMC, has been replaced with an approved SFP.
details.formatString: SFP on port %s (dev %s) has been replaced with an EMC approved part: manufacture \"%s\" part number \"%s\" serial number \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Incoming laser is not detected on an optical Ethernet port.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Incoming laser is not detected on an optical Ethernet port.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Apply the following measures until the issue has been resolved: 1. Identify the physical port mentioned in this event. 2. Check if the optical cable had been inserted into the SFP, plug in cable if needed. 3. Reseat the SFP. 4. Follow the optical cable to the switch, write down the switch/port information. 5. Inspect the switch side cabling/SFP issues. 6. Verify the switch port configuration.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Apply the following measures until the issue has been resolved: 1. Identify the physical port mentioned in this event. 2. Check if the optical cable had been inserted into the SFP, plug in cable if needed. 3. Reseat the SFP. 4. Follow the optical cable to the switch, write down the switch/port information. 5. Inspect the switch side cabling/SFP issues. 6. Verify the switch port configuration.

details.customerDescription: No incoming laser had been detected on an Ethernet port.
details.internalDescription: No incoming laser had been detected on an Ethernet port.
details.formatString: port %s (dev %s) detects no receive power

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Incoming laser is detected on a port that previously detected no incoming laser..

details.internalDescription: Incoming laser is detected on a port previously without incoming laser.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC support to get replacement 10Gig Ethernet IO module.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Unable to remove the configured IP address of the port, possible due to the health of the corresponding port.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Attempts to establish the link is failing continuously. Possible due to improper switch MTU settings.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the MTU settings on the switch.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the MTU settings on the switch. Contact EMC Technical support for further help.

details.internalDescription: The expected packet was not received. Hence resetting the connection.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The last redundant IP path to the specified director is down. This could be due to problem with the IP WAN-COM switch. If the last available path is lost, there will be a site departure.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The last redundant IP path to the specified director is down. This could be due to problem with the IP WAN-COM switch. If the last available path is lost, there will be a site departure.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Investigate the IP WAN-COM switches and the links between them to determine why the link is down. Check the cables and the SFPs, make sure they are properly plugged in. Check the relevant switches (if any), and make sure they are operational and the corresponding switch ports are enabled. If the event is seen on the membership/management network, check the health of the ports.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Investigate the IP WAN-COM switches and the links between them to determine why the link is down. Check the cables and the SFPs, make sure they are properly plugged in. Check the relavant switches (if any), and make sure they are operational and the corresponding switch ports are enabled. If problem persists contact EMC Support.

details.customerDescription: The last redundant path to the specified director is down.
details.internalDescription: The last redundant path to the specified director is down.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer has been notified of the arrival of the storage volume with scsi target pointer [TargetPointer] and logical unit id [TargetId], and this is a storage volume that has been previously seen by the DISK layer.

details.customerDescription: target %p id %s already initialized
details.formatString: target %p id %s already initialized

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer has been notified of the arrival of the storage volume with logical unit id [ID], and it has repeatedly tried and failed to get its capacity with the scsi READ CAPACITY command. Because of this, the DISK layer will not notify the AMF layer of this storage volume. If the storage volume is part of a device group, this may prevent that device group from becoming online.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s: scsi_readCapacity failed
details.internalDescription: The reported storage volume did not respond as expected to a READ CAPACITY during storage volume discovery. This storage volume may require servicing or replacing.
details.formatString: storage volume %s: scsi_readCapacity failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer is ignoring the storage volume with logical unit [ID], because it failed to allocate memory to increase the size of the storage volume pool. If the storage volume is part of a device group, this may prevent that device group from becoming online.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Remove the latest storage volumes added to the system and remaining storage volumes will be recognized. Contact EMC Customer Support for advice on upgrading your system.

details.customerDescription: could not grow storage volume pool, storage volume %s ignored
details.internalDescription: The system discovered more storage volumes than it can currently handle, and failed to allocated more memory to handle those extra storage volumes. The extra storage volumes will be ignored.
details.formatString: could not grow storage volume pool, storage volume %s ignored

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer is re-trying an I/O on the storage volume with logical unit id [ID]. Specifically, it is re-trying an operation of type [op] (allowed values: read, write) on the block range from [ioStart] up to, but not including, [ioEnd]. A free-form short text description of the reason for the re-try is in [reason]. This reason is meant to help in debugging and post-mortem analysis. The [debugValue] field contains a value useful for debugging and post-mortem analysis.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Monitor the storage volume to see if retries become more frequent. If they become more frequent, replace the storage volume.

details.arguments: id op ioStart ioEnd reason debugValue
details.customerDescription: storage volume %s: re-trying %s [%lu, %lu) reason \"%s\" 0x%x
details.internalDescription: A transient error was detected while trying to read or write the given block range of the given storage volume. The operation will be re-tried. If it fails after many re-tries, then the failure will be escalated.
details.formatString: storage volume %s: re-trying %s [%lu, %lu) reason \"%s\" 0x%x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer has re-tried on I/O on the storage volume with logical unit id [ID] a number of times, and is now giving up and reporting an I/O failure to the AMF layer. The specific I/O was of type [op] (allowed values: read, write) on the block range from [ioStart] up to, but not including, [ioEnd]. A free-form short text description of the reason for the re-try is in [reason]. This reason is meant to help in debugging and post-mortem analysis. The [debugValue] field contains a value useful for debugging and post-mortem analysis.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Monitor the storage volume to see if retries become more frequent. If they become more frequent, replace the storage volume.

details.arguments: id op ioStart ioEnd reason debugValue
details.customerDescription: storage volume %s: communication problem, giving up on "" "%s [%lu, %lu) reason: \"%s\" 0x%x
details.internalDescription: A series of transient errors were detected while trying to read or write the given block range of the given storage volume. The failure has been escalated, and the operation will not be re-tried.
details.formatString: storage volume %s: communication problem, giving up on "" "%s [%lu, %lu) reason: \"%s\" 0x%x

details.customerDescription: can't create storageVolumeInit thread
details.formatString: can't create storageVolumeInit thread

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer has been notified of the arrival of the storage volume with logical unit [luid], and it has repeatedly tried and failed to get its inquiry data with the scsi INQUIRY command. Because of this, the DISK layer will not notify the AMF layer of this storage volume. If the storage volume is part of a device group, this may prevent that device group from becoming online.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s: scsi_inquiry failed
details.internalDescription: The reported storage volume did not respond as expected to an INQUIRY during storage volume discovery. This storage volume may require servicing or replacing.
details.formatString: storage volume %s: scsi_inquiry failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer is re-trying a scsi READ CAPACITY command on the storage volume with logical unit id [luid].

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s: re-trying INQUIRY
details.formatString: storage volume %s: re-trying INQUIRY

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The tower tried to set all mode pages for the storage volume with logical unit id [luid]. However, the action failed, because the SCSI mode select command failed with status [errCode]. The value [errCode] is not a standard SCSI error value; it is a value used internally in the tower. It is present here to aid in debugging.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support. The storage volume may require replacement.

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s could not set mode pages - mode select failed with status %lu
details.internalDescription: During initial storage volume setup, the writing of configuration data failed.
details.formatString: storage volume %s could not set mode pages - mode select failed with status %lu

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The tower wants to set all mode pages for the storage volume with logical unit id [luid]. However, the tower will only go ahead and set all mode pages if the storageVolume's model is among one of a known set. In this case, the storageVolume's vendor ID [vendorId] and product ID [productId] are not in that known set, so the mode pages have not been set. The tower will continue to use the storage volume, but the mode settings for the storage volume are not known to have reasonable and consistent values, so there is a small probability of unpredictable behaviour.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support for advice on upgrading your system.

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s \"unknown\" vendor "combination %s / %s - not setting mode pages
details.internalDescription: The reported storage volume type is not fully supported in this software release. Mode page settings cannot be applied to this storage volume.
details.formatString: storage volume %s \"unknown\" vendor "combination %s / %s - not setting mode pages

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The scsi layer is re-trying an attempt to set all the mode pages on the storage volume with logical unit id [luid].

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s: re-trying attempt to set mode pages
details.formatString: storage volume %s: re-trying attempt to set mode pages

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer has re-tried on I/O on the storage volume a number of times, and is now giving up and reporting an I/O failure to the AMF layer. The reason for the re-try is that less data was received by the tower than was expected for the operation, and when many of these errors occur, the problem is usually a bad cable or SFP.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A series of transient errors were detected while trying to read or write the given block range of the given storage volume. The failure has been escalated, and the operation will not be re-tried.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: 1. Check event logs to see if the retries have been frequent. 2. If they have been frequent, try cleaning or replacing cable(s) or replacing SFP(s) in the path to the storage volume. 3. Run the storage-volume resurrect command to make the storage volume usable.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: 1. Try cleaning or replacing cable(s) or replacing SFP(s) in the path to the storage volume. 2. Run the storage-volume resurrect command to make the storage volume usable. 3. If it does not resolve, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.arguments: id op ioStart ioEnd reason debugValue
details.customerDescription: Storage volume communication problem due to data underrun.
details.internalDescription: Storage volume communication problem due to data underrun
details.formatString: storage volume %s: communication problem, giving up on %s [%lu, %lu) reason: data underrun, check cables/SFPs

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the SCSI storage device where the problem storage volume comes from and try to clear the reservation from management interface of the storage device. Once the reservation is cleared, the user should run a 'disk renew' to re-initialize this storage volume

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s: reservation conflict detected, please clear the reservation on the storage volume
details.internalDescription: A storage volume that has been previously reserved by a third-party initiator is discovered. Because of the outstanding reservation, our firmware receives reservation conflict SCSI status code for certain scsi commands it sends.
details.formatString: storage volume %s: reservation conflict detected, please clear the reservation on the storage volume

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event tells what scsi implementation (its name is [name]) is being used.

details.customerDescription: using %s storage volume implementation
details.formatString: using %s storage volume implementation

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Increase GENERIC_DISK_MAX_DRIVERS.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Call EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Too many storage volume drivers, ignoring driver %s
details.internalDescription: The system has not enough room to store a storage volume driver, it will continue without this storage volume driver.
details.formatString: Too many storage volume drivers, ignoring driver %s

details.customerDescription: no memory for storage volume
details.internalDescription: A memory shortage has prevented the system from allocating a data structure to store information about a storage volume. The system will continue without this storage volume.
details.formatString: no memory for storage volume

details.customerDescription: found storage volume %s
details.internalDescription: The system has gained visibility to a storage volume.
details.formatString: found storage volume %s

details.customerDescription: lost storage volume %s
details.internalDescription: The system has lost visibility to a storage volume.
details.formatString: lost storage volume %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The capacity of the disk decreased since it was last checked. The underlying storage has likely been shrunk or swapped.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The capacity of the disk decreased since it was last checked. The underlying storage has likely been shrunk or swapped.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Examine the underlying devices to determine why the disk was shrunk. Resize the device to the expected capacity.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Examine the underlying devices to determine why the disk was shrunk. Resize the device to the expected capacity.

details.customerDescription: The disk's capacity decreased since it was last checked.
details.internalDescription: The disk's capacity decreased since it was last checked.
details.formatString: Disk %s has shrunk from %s to %s

details.customerDescription: no memory for scsi storage volume %s
details.internalDescription: A memory shortage has prevented the system from allocating a data structure to store information about a scsi storage volume. The system will continue without this storage volume.
details.formatString: no memory for scsi storage volume %s

details.customerDescription: no memory for '%s' command on scsi storage volume %s
details.internalDescription: A memory shortage has prevented the system from issuing a scsi command to a scsi storage volume. The system will retry the command.
details.formatString: no memory for '%s' command on scsi storage volume %s

details.customerDescription: scsi storage volume %s does not allow changing of '%s' mode parameter in '%s' mode page
details.internalDescription: The results from a mode sense indicate that the system would prefer to change a mode parameter in a mode page for a scsi storage volume but was not allowed to do so. The system will continue without changing the mode parameter.
details.formatString: scsi storage volume %s does not allow changing of '%s' mode parameter in '%s' mode page

details.customerDescription: scsi storage volume %s could not find pageCode %d in changeable values
details.internalDescription: The results from a mode sense indicate that the system would prefer to change a mode parameter in a mode page for a scsi storage volume but was not allowed to do so. The system will continue without changing the mode parameter.
details.formatString: scsi storage volume %s could not find pageCode %d in changeable values

details.customerDescription: scsi storage volume %s does not support saving mode pages
details.internalDescription: The system would like to save some mode parameters on a scsi storage volume but detected that the storage volume does not support saveable mode pages. The system will continue without saving mode parameters.
details.formatString: scsi storage volume %s does not support saving mode pages

details.customerDescription: scsi storage volume %s does not support changing mode pages
details.internalDescription: The system would like to change some mode parameters on a scsi storage volume but detected that the storage volume does not support changeable mode pages. The system will continue without changing mode parameters.
details.formatString: scsi storage volume %s does not support changing mode pages

details.customerDescription: read capacity 16 command retried too often on scsi storage volume %s
details.internalDescription: A scsi storage volume repeats giving unexpected responses to the Read Capacity 16 command. The system will continue without this storage volume.
details.formatString: read capacity 16 command retried too often on scsi storage volume %s

details.customerDescription: Storage volume is temporary unavailable for I/O because it is in the middle of an implicit ALUA transition.
details.internalDescription: VPLEX will continue operating without this storage volume.
details.formatString: Storage volume %s started implicit ALUA transition handling

details.customerDescription: Stop waiting for implicit ALUA transition to finish because the state of the storage volume changed to unknown.
details.internalDescription: Most likely the scsi layer detected that the implicit ALUA transition finished and is figuring out which paths are active optimized and non-optimized. The system will continue with this storage volume.
details.formatString: storage volume %s stopped ALUA transition handling

details.customerDescription: Finished waiting for implicit ALUA transition.
details.internalDescription: Reenable I/O for the affected storage volume. The system will continue with this storage volume.
details.formatString: storage volume %s finished implicit ALUA transition handling

details.customerDescription: The Implicit ALUA transition on a storage volume took too long.
details.internalDescription: Stop waiting for it. Resume I/O and stumble along.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Storage volume returned too many busies, and marked dead in VPLEX as busy threshold is reached. The device above the storage-volume may have only lost redundancy, or may now be inaccessible if there are no healthy mirrors.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Storage volume returned too many busies, and marked dead in VPLEX as busy threshold is reached. The device above the storage-volume may have only lost redundancy, or may now be inaccessible if there are no healthy mirrors.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Engage array vendor in determining the cause of returned SCSI busies. The storage-volume will be auto-resurrected by VPLEX once the array begins processing IO for the storage-volume again.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Engage array vendor in determining the cause of returned SCSI busies. The storage-volume will be auto-resurrected by VPLEX once the array begins processing IO for the storage-volume again.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: During failure recovery, another disruption occurred, and could not be handled. VPLEX integrity may be compromised.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: During failure recovery, another disruption occurred, and could not be handled. VPLEX integrity may be compromised.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support for assistance in determining the cause of the failure and appropriate recovery steps.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A spurious isr occurs when, by the time the mips responds to an interrupt, the interrupt request has been removed. Customer support will make a habit of taking copies of these logs whenever we have access to customer system.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The floor code which chooses what Fibre Channel WWN's to use for the back-end Fibre Channel chips, and the "hard" WWN pairs for the front-end Fibre Channel chips has noticed that the 48 bit IEEE Mac on an Aries card does not contain the original EMC OUID (0x000453). This is not fatal, but is an interesting occurrence.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support. The reported director should be returned to EMC for servicing.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Incorrect configuration in Gamla eeprom image. It is supposed to be configured to cause the Gamla to load its microcode and configuration from the driver over the pci bus but it has loaded automatically, potentially using the wrong code or configuration. You are strongly encouraged to run initboard and restart the tower.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: gamla microcode already loaded
details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: %s: gamla microcode already loaded

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The MIPS is expecting a download status of 1 (Gamla waiting for download) or 3 (download done). Any other status means that the Gamla microcode is in an unexpected state, likely due to old or corrupted eeprom images. Run initboard and restart the tower.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: init failed: unexpected download status: %d
details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: %s: init failed: unexpected download status: %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Any value other than 0xa0 or 0xa1 means that the Gamla state is corrupted or Mellanox created a new chip and didn't tell us. Very unlikely.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: init failed: unknown chip rev: 0x%x
details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: %s: init failed: unknown chip rev: 0x%x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Gamla eeprom image and the microcode stored in the tower are not compatible. Run initboard and restart tower.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: init failed: gamla fw loader incompatible
details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: %s: init failed: gamla fw loader incompatible

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The tower gave up waiting for the Gamla to download its microcode, likely due to the wrong contents on the eeprom (ie. A0 microcode for an A1 Gamla or vice versa). Run initboard and restart the tower.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: %s: unexpected idle event on EQ %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The ib driver read an unexpected value from DMAC.DMAEQ[eqNum].IBCSE. The failed descriptor is retried.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: unknown remote IB channel error 0x%x on EQ %d
details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: %s: unknown remote IB channel error 0x%x on EQ %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Gamla reported a local channel error. The system is either misconfigured or there was a transient failure. The failed descriptor is retried to deal with the latter. If it's a configuration problem then the descriptor will eventually exceed the maximum number of retries and the relevant QP will be moved into an error state. Please collect a Gamla register space dump and report the problem.

details.customerDescription: %s: descriptor channel error on EQ %d: TCAC.TCAPMEG.TCAEXKOZ 0x%x TCAC.TCAPMEG.KOZ 0x%x DMAC.DMALCCR.DESCCH.IBCSE 0x%x
details.formatString: %s: descriptor channel error on EQ %d: TCAC.TCAPMEG.TCAEXKOZ 0x%x TCAC.TCAPMEG.KOZ 0x%x DMAC.DMALCCR.DESCCH.IBCSE 0x%x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: See 25.

details.arguments: deviceName eqNum exkoz koz ibcse0 ibcse1 ibcse2 ibcse3
details.customerDescription: %s: gather channel error on EQ %d: TCAC.TCAPMEG.TCAEXKOZ 0x%x TCAC.TCAPMEG.KOZ 0x%x DMAC.DMALCCR.GATHCH*.IBCSE 0x%x 0x%x 0x%x 0x%x
details.formatString: %s: gather channel error on EQ %d: TCAC.TCAPMEG.TCAEXKOZ 0x%x TCAC.TCAPMEG.KOZ 0x%x DMAC.DMALCCR.GATHCH*.IBCSE 0x%x 0x%x 0x%x 0x%x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: See 25.

details.customerDescription: %s: scatter channel error on EQ %d: TCAC.TCAPMEG.TCAEXKOZ 0x%x TCAC.TCAPMEG.KOZ 0x%x DMAC.DMALCCR.SCATCH.IBCSE 0x%x
details.formatString: %s: scatter channel error on EQ %d: TCAC.TCAPMEG.TCAEXKOZ 0x%x TCAC.TCAPMEG.KOZ 0x%x DMAC.DMALCCR.SCATCH.IBCSE 0x%x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Gamla reported an invalid descriptor. The ib driver dumps invalid descriptors onto the console in this case. Please capture this output and report it to EMC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: descriptor contents error on EQ %d
details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: %s: descriptor contents error on EQ %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Port link states are probed every second; whenever a link state changes the appropriate event (30,31,32) is generated. A linkUp state doesn't necessarily mean that IB traffic is able to flow, the subnet manager must bring the port states to ACTIVE after assigning LIDs.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check IB cables and Contact EMC Customer Support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: %s: both ib links down
details.internalDescription: Both IB links are down.
details.formatString: %s: both ib links down

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: See discussion under event ib/30.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: ib link %d down
details.internalDescription: The mentioned IB link is down. The director has an IB connection to each switch, one of the connections is not functional. Link 0 is between the director and the lower switch, link 1 is to the upper. Note that there will be no further events until one or both link states change again, ie. the other link is lost or the lost link is re-established.
details.formatString: %s: ib link %d down

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: See discussion under event ib/30.

details.customerDescription: %s: both ib links up
details.internalDescription: Both IB links are up.
details.formatString: %s: both ib links up

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event will be followed by event 30. The purpose of this event is to help distinguish actual link failures from those brought about intentionally by the board manager as part of watchdog processing.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: ib port(s) powered off (0x%x)
details.internalDescription: One or both of the IB links have been powered off.
details.formatString: %s: ib port(s) powered off (0x%x)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The user or gamla driver initiated a reset of the chip.

details.customerDescription: %s: resetting gamla
details.formatString: %s: resetting gamla

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The gamla has successfully downloaded indicated firmware revision from the driver.

details.customerDescription: %s: fw %d.%d.%d successfully loaded
details.formatString: %s: fw %d.%d.%d successfully loaded

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A Tavor query has returned a non-success status. Ask Rolf.

details.customerDescription: ib_poll_cq: cq %d wrid 0x%llx status %d
details.formatString: ib_poll_cq: cq %d wrid 0x%llx status %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Tavor InfiniBand chip successfully initialized.

details.arguments: deviceName devVersion fwMajor fwMinor fwPatch pciBus pciDev irq crAddr uarAddr ddrAddr ddrSize
details.customerDescription: %s: MT23108-%X fw %d.%d.%d bus 0x%x dev 0x%x irq %u cr 0x%08llx uar 0x%08llx ddr 0x%08llx size %uMiB
details.formatString: %s: MT23108-%X fw %d.%d.%d bus 0x%x dev 0x%x irq %u cr 0x%08llx uar 0x%08llx ddr 0x%08llx size %uMiB

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A local IB port transitioned from an inactive to an active state. This is generally the result of the Subnet Manager assigning a LID to the port and activating it.

details.customerDescription: ib port 0x%llx is now active.
details.formatString: ib port 0x%llx is now active.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A local IB port transitioned from an active state to an inactive state. This is generally the result of the Subnet Manager disabling the port, of somebody disabling the switch port we are connected to or of somebody pulling the IB cable attached to this port.

details.customerDescription: ib port 0x%llx is now inactive.
details.formatString: ib port 0x%llx is now inactive.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A local IB port was able to complete its initial round of discovery after transitioning to an active state.

details.customerDescription: ib port 0x%llx completed discovery.
details.formatString: ib port 0x%llx completed discovery.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A local IB port is beginning its initial round of discovery after transitioning to an active state.

details.customerDescription: ib port 0x%llx starting discovery.
details.formatString: ib port 0x%llx starting discovery.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The physical link status is now up. This generally means that the ports on both sides of the physical link are now powered.

details.customerDescription: ib port 0x%llx link up.
details.formatString: ib port 0x%llx link up.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The physical link status is now down. This generally means the one of the ports on either side of the physical link has lost power or that an IB cable is no longer connected to the port.

details.customerDescription: ib port 0x%llx link down.
details.formatString: ib port 0x%llx link down.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The specified local port is in a direct-connect subnet with another director and has the higher port GUID. It is therefore starting a subnet manager instance.

details.customerDescription: ib port 0x%llx starting subnet manager.
details.formatString: ib port 0x%llx starting subnet manager.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The specified local port was the subnet manager for a direct-connect subnet between two directors, but the link has gone down. The subnet manager is therefore stopping.

details.customerDescription: ib port 0x%llx stopping subnet manager.
details.formatString: ib port 0x%llx stopping subnet manager.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The customer is using iblonghaul=1 on their system and their SM returned a large value for the timeout (>= 1 second) on a path record. We assume the timeout value to be correct, but since the timeout was so large warn the user of a possible misconfiguration.

details.customerDescription: Subnet manager returned a path a path timeout of %s for a PathRecord query. This may indicate an SM misconfiguration.
details.formatString: Subnet manager returned a path a path timeout of %s for a PathRecord query. This may indicate an SM misconfiguration.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The customer is not using iblonghaul=1 on their system and their SM returned a large value for the timeout (>= 1 second) on a path record. We assume the timeout value to be incorrect and override it with the specified value (which is a compile-time default of 524 us).

details.customerDescription: Subnet manager returned a path timeout of %s for a PathRecord query. Overriding with a timeout of %s.
details.formatString: Subnet manager returned a path timeout of %s for a PathRecord query. Overriding with a timeout of %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The ibdm component has commands to display the current cache of known services discovered on the fabric ("ibdm cache").

details.customerDescription: IB%d Arrival of service entry '0x%016llx "ioc 0x%016llx on IbPort guid 0x%016llx
details.internalDescription: Arrival of a discovered service entry on a DM-capable IbPort on the subnet.
details.formatString: IB%d Arrival of service entry '0x%016llx "ioc 0x%016llx on IbPort guid 0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The ibdm component has commands to display the current cache of known services discovered on the fabric ("ibdm cache").

details.customerDescription: IB%d Departure of service entry '0x%016llx "ioc 0x%016llx on IbPort guid 0x%016llx
details.internalDescription: Departure of a discovered service entry on a DM-capable IbPort on the subnet.
details.formatString: IB%d Departure of service entry '0x%016llx "ioc 0x%016llx on IbPort guid 0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The ibdm component has commands to display the current cache of known services discovered on the fabric ("ibdm cache"). It is also possible to trigger a rediscovery ("ibdm discover") before the next scheduled polling period.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Monitor subnet for packet loss or problems related to the IbPort identified.

details.customerDescription: IB%d reached error limit (%u) trying to discover remote IbPort guid 0x%016"FS64x" -- giving up until next round
details.internalDescription: Problems were encountered when attempting to communicate with DM-capable remote IbPort on the subnet. The DM cache may not be up to date.
details.formatString: IB%d reached error limit (%u) trying to discover remote IbPort guid 0x%016"FS64x" -- giving up until next round

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg has received an arrival notification from the COM layer about a director that it already knows about. The Nmg ignores the duplicate notification.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Arriving director 0x%llx already on visible list
details.internalDescription: The reported arriving director is already known. The duplicate notification is ignored and the system continues to function normally.
details.formatString: Arriving director 0x%llx already on visible list

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg has received a departure notification from the COM layer about a director that it doesn't know about. That can happen if the Nmg has already declared the director as gone for other reasons, such as failing to send a message to it. The Nmg ignores the notification.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Never saw arrival of departing director 0x%llx
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications. The system will retry and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occasional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
details.formatString: Never saw arrival of departing director 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The set of directors running together at the local cluster has increased.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The set of directors running together at the local cluster has increased.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If the number of directors is now larger than the originally configured count, the configuration of the cluster should be updated.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Using director count from newSet which exceeds expected count.
details.internalDescription: The system contains more directors than described in the on-board configuration information. The system may not operate correctly.
details.formatString: Local director count in newSet %u > expected count %lu: using newSet count %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is an expected message, which should occur once per boot. It indicates that enough directors (directors) have joined the Nmg group of directors, that the Nmg can be sure it is seeing a majority of the directors. It is only after this event that the Nmg will announce director arrivals to its clients, and hence full distributed operation will commence.

details.customerDescription: Quorum (%u) from %lu directors reached
details.formatString: Quorum (%u) from %lu directors reached

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This message is currently accompanyied by an abort of the director reporting it. It should only happen if more than one other director disappears at the same time, and the remaining number of directors is less than half of the total number. This director cannot be sure that a network partition has not happened, and so aborts so that it does not alter on-disk data in a way that might conflict with live directors that it cannot communicate with.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Quorum from %u directors lost - only have %u
details.internalDescription: The departure of a director reduced the number of active directors to an unacceptable number. If a director is in the process of rebooting it will rejoin the active set without user intervention. If the director repeatedly sends this message, contact EMC Customer Support.
details.formatString: Quorum from %u directors lost - only have %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director has received a remote command from some other director, but has no free Nmg message with which to send a reply. The command in question will have been executed, but the originating director will end up timing out waiting for the reply that it won't get.

details.customerDescription: No Nmg message to send command reply
details.formatString: No Nmg message to send command reply

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg has received a reply from a remote command, but it does not have a remote command outstanding to match it up with. This can happen if the remote director takes too long to execute the command and reply to it - the local director could have timed out waiting for the reply and given up on it.

details.customerDescription: Remote command reply discarded - no-one waiting for it
details.formatString: Remote command reply discarded - no-one waiting for it

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The indicated director is joining the system from the Nmg's point of view. There will have been a previous notification from the specific COM layer that has found the new director. This Nmg event does not indicate anything about whether or not we have reached quorum. See event 11.

details.customerDescription: Director %s joins official local group
details.formatString: Director %s joins official local group

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The reported director requires a reset. Check later in the event log for a message indicating failure recovery has completed for all virtual volumes. After that message is received it is safe to restart the director. Contact EMC Customer Support for further assistance.

details.customerDescription: Director %s leaves official local group
details.internalDescription: The system has determined the reported director failed. If configured for failover support, the system will reallocate resources and resume operation with a reduced number of directors.
details.formatString: Director %s leaves official local group

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The heart director has gone a number of ticks without hearing from the indicated director, and so is declaring it as dead.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: None, unless this is persistent and cannot be attributed to communication hardware problems.

details.customerDescription: Giving up on %s, hb %llu vs director %llu
details.formatString: Giving up on %s, hb %llu vs director %llu

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The first director with the given cluster id has arrived. This marks the arrival of that cluster, from the point of view of the reporting director.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required unless the reported cluster is not expected to be part of the system.

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u arrives
details.internalDescription: The director that originated this message has recognized the arrival of a director from the reported cluster. This event occurs during system initialization aross the network link.
details.formatString: Cluster %u arrives

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The directors at the indicated cluster are not responding to communications. This often indicates a network link failure, or could be caused by all directors at that cluster failing (e.g. a power outage). The system will recover when the link is restored. For any distributed device with a mirror at the missing cluster, I/O to the device will be suspended - either until the cluster returns, or until that cluster is detached.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The last director with the given cluster id has departed. This marks the loss of the indicated cluster from the point of view of the reporting director.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If the Cluster Witness Server is present and enabled, it should have provided guidance to continue IO on the winning cluster. If the Cluster Witness Server is not present, check that the distributed devices and consistency groups are running on the winning cluster. Check for problems with the network link to the indicated cluster. Check the detach settings of each distributed device to see the pre-configured action. To prevent the clusters joining logically, issue the command "cluster expel -c[cluster]" during the link outage, or "set /clusters/*::allow-auto-join false" before the outage.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The last director with the given cluster ID has departed. This marks the loss of the indicated cluster from the point of view of the reporting director. If the Cluster Witness Server is present and enabled, it should have provided guidance to continue IO on the winning cluster for all synchronous consistency-groups. Check the detach settings of any distributed-devices that are not in a consistency-group. If the Cluster Witness Server is not present or unreachable, check that the distributed-devices and consistency-groups are running on the winning cluster. A winner may need to be manually chosen. 1. Check for problems with the network link to the indicated cluster. 2. Check the equipment at the indicated cluster for malfunctions.

details.customerDescription: A cluster departed.
details.internalDescription: A cluster departed.
details.formatString: Cluster %u departs

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director has gone a number of ticks without hearing from the heart, and so is declaring it as dead.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: None, unless this is persistent and cannot be attributed to communication hardware problems.

details.customerDescription: Giving up on local heart %s, %u missed ticks
details.formatString: Giving up on local heart %s, %u missed ticks

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director is trying to kill the identified director, but the call to do that has failed. The STONITH may succeed on other directors at this cluster, but if not, this cluster's reliability may be compromised. This may affect the correctness of user data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This director is trying to kill the identified director, but the call to do that has failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the status of the reported director and all network connections to that director. Contact EMC Customer Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Failed to reset a problem director.
details.internalDescription: The system has determined the reported director requires a reset, however the system was unable to stop the director and perform the reset.
details.formatString: floor_stonith call failed for director %s/0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An internal call that is part of the mechanism for performing a STONITH operation has failed. The STONITH may succeed on other directors at this cluster, but if not, this cluster's reliability may be compromised. This may affect the correctness of user data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal call to reset another director has failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the status of the reported director and all network connections to that director. Contact EMC Customer Support
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support

details.customerDescription: Failed to reset a problem director.
details.internalDescription: The system has determined the reported director requires a reset, however the system was unable to stop the director and perform the reset.
details.formatString: No AppId for director %s/0x%016llx - Stopping director failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director is part of a group that has reached concensus that the identified director (by director-name and com-uuid) should no longer be part of the operating group at this cluster. This director is thus going to try to STONITH the identified director.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A reset of the director may take several minutes to complete. If the director does not rejoin the system automatically, it can be restarted. Refer to the Management Console Users Guide or contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Stopping director [director-name]/[com-uuid]
details.internalDescription: The reported director is not functioning correctly or has lost connectivity to some other directors in the system. It will be halted. If automatic restart is enabled, it will be restarted, and will rejoin the system when it is safe for it to do so.
details.formatString: Stopping director %s/0x%016llx

details.customerDescription: Forgetting about cluster %u
details.internalDescription: The operator has chosen to remove the specified cluster from the system.
details.formatString: Forgetting about cluster %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The write to flash of the configured cost values for the indicated cluster, relative to this cluster, failed. On a reboot, this director will not know those configured values, and so may not handle the intercluster link optimally. When this is noticed, the user can re-issue the "nmg setcost" command to re-set the values.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support and relay the information contained in the error message.

details.customerDescription: Save of costs for cluster %u to flash failed
details.internalDescription: The operator has just changed the configured values for the costs of communication from the local cluster to the reported cluster. This director was unable to write the new values to non-volatile memory. If this director is rebooted, it will have incorrect values, which may affect some system choices for remote I/O optimization.
details.formatString: Save of costs for cluster %u to flash failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An Nmg "heartbeat" message has been received from the specified other director (specified by name if available, else director COM Uuid), which appears to be running a different version of the firmware. This situation is dangerous - newer versions of the firmware may be trying to use capabilities that don't exist in older versions. The version hash is a simple hash of the "buildinfo" string, which can be seen using the tower "version" command. It is put into all Nmg messages, and checked on receipt.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A director with a different version of firmware may have been inserted into the cluster. Also a communications link could have been brought up by mistake, allowing a cluster of a different version to be visible.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If this situation arose because a director with a different version of firmware was inserted into the cluster and booted, then shut down that director. If the situation arose because a communications link has been brought up by mistake, then take down that communications link.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: A director with a different version of firmware may have been inserted into the cluster. Also, a communications link could have been brought up by mistake, allowing a cluster of a different version to be visible. If this situation arose because a director with a different version of firmware was inserted into the cluster and booted, then shut down that director. If the situation arose because a communications link has been brought up by mistake, then take down that communications link.

details.customerDescription: Director running a different version of the software detected.
details.internalDescription: Director running a different version of the software detected.
details.formatString: Received %s heartbeat from 0x%llx with swHash %u instead of %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The version hash is a simple hash of the "buildinfo" string, which can be seen using the tower "version" command. It is put into all Nmg messages, and checked on receipt.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A director with a different version of firmware may have been inserted into the cluster. Also a communications link could have been brought up by mistake, allowing a cluster of a different version to be visible.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If this situation arose because a director with a different version of firmware was inserted into the cluster and booted, then shut down that director. If the situation arose because a communications link has been brought up by mistake, then take down that communications link.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If this situation arose because a director with a different version of firmware was inserted into the cluster and booted, then shut down that director. If the situation arose because a communications link has been brought up by mistake, then take down that communications link.

details.customerDescription: Director running a different version of the software detected.
details.internalDescription: An Nmg message has been received from the specified other director, which appears to be running a different version of the firmware. This situation is dangerous - newer versions of the firmware may be trying to use capabilities that don't exist in older versions.
details.formatString: Received %s from %s with swHash %u instead of %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An Nmg message has been received from the specified other director which reports a different version of Nmg messages. That means that this director can't even understand that director's messages. The message is not processed. The Nmg version number is in all Nmg messages. It is a single-byte field at the beginning of the message, which is intended to change when the basic format of the messages changes.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A director with a different version of firmware may have been inserted into the cluster. Also a communications link could have been brought up by mistake, allowing a cluster of a different version to be visible.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If this situation arose because a director with a different version of firmware was inserted into the cluster and booted, then shut down that director. If the situation arose because a communications link has been brought up by mistake, then take down that communications link.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If this situation arose because a director with a different version of firmware was inserted into the cluster and booted, then shut down that director. If the situation arose because a communications link has been brought up by mistake, then take down that communications link.

details.customerDescription: Received message had a version mismatch.
details.internalDescription: Received message had a version mismatch.
details.formatString: Received message from 0x%llx with version %u instead of %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An Nmg heartbeat message has been received from the specified other director which reports a different version of Nmg messages. That means that this director can't even understand that director's messages. The message is not processed. Early heartbeat messages did not contain the version number. However, that place would have been a 0/1 flag. With the current version number of 3, a mismatch will be detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A director with a different version of firmware may have been inserted into the cluster. Also a communications link could have been brought up by mistake, allowing a cluster of a different version to be visible.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If this situation arose because a director with a different version of firmware was inserted into the cluster and booted, then shut down that director. If the situation arose because a communications link has been brought up by mistake, then take down that communications link.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If this situation arose because a director with a different version of firmware was inserted into the cluster and booted, then shut down that director. If the situation arose because a communications link has been brought up by mistake, then take down that communications link.

details.customerDescription: Received heartbeat had a version mismatch.
details.internalDescription: Received heartbeat had a version mismatch.
details.formatString: Received %s heartbeat from 0x%llx with version %u instead of %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: "The tower context in the yycli" means the tower console, for us mortals.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The director will be in a partially booted state, which allows a value to be set for director-count. Contact EMC Customer Support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: No flash setting for nodecount
details.internalDescription: This director found no value for the director-count variable in its flash memory. A valid value must be present before the director will boot.
details.formatString: No flash setting for nodecount

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The director will be in a partially booted state, which allows a value to be set for director-count. Contact EMC Customer Support for assistance.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The director will be in a partially booted state, which allows a value to be set for director-count. Contact EMC Customer Support for assistance.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support to correct the misconfigured director-count.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support to correct the misconfigured director-count.

details.customerDescription: Flash value out of range for director count.
details.internalDescription: The value read from flash for director-count is either 0 or too large, and so the director boot process has suspended.
details.formatString: Out of range flash setting (%u) for nodecount

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is for information purposes only.

details.customerDescription: Flash configured director count: %u
details.formatString: Flash configured director count: %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is for information purposes only.

details.customerDescription: NVol configured cluster count: %u
details.formatString: NVol configured cluster count: %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is for information purposes only.

details.customerDescription: NVol configured known clusters: [%u]
details.formatString: NVol configured known clusters: [%u]

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is for information purposes only.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Examine the network, to see if the cause of the disruption can be identified and resolved.

details.customerDescription: Empty global NMG group change suppressed
details.internalDescription: There has been a temporary disruption in the network that caused the NMG to rediscover. After the rediscovery, all directors running before the disruption were still part of the system.
details.formatString: Empty global NMG group change suppressed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg has received a departure notification from the COM layer about a director that it believes is already departed. The Nmg ignores the notification.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Departing 0x%llx director not on visible list
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications. The system will retry and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occasional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
details.formatString: Departing 0x%llx director not on visible list

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed unless this and similar messages are being repeated more than is normal, in which case investigation into network problems may be warranted.

details.customerDescription: Initiating global discovery.
details.internalDescription: Because of the specified reason, the Nmg component of the tower is starting another round of determining what the set of interoperating clusters should be. The underlying reason is usually the arrival or departure of a visible director, or a communication issue.
details.formatString: Initiating global discovery iteration %u (%s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Because of the specified reason, the Nmg component of the tower is starting another round of discovery with specified iteration number. This action determines what the set of interoperating local directors should be. The underlying reason is usually the arrival or departure of a visible director, or a communication issue.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed unless this and similar messages are being repeated more than is normal, in which case investigation into inter-director communication problems may be warranted.

details.customerDescription: Initiating local discovery iteration [iterationNumber] ([reason])
details.formatString: Initiating local discovery iteration %u (%s)

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed unless this and similar messages are being repeated, in which case investigation into communication problems may be warranted.

details.customerDescription: Received my own %s token request
details.internalDescription: A situation that is not normally expected has occurred. This may be a signal that communication errors have been ocurring.
details.formatString: Received my own %s token request

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed unless this and similar messages are being repeated, in which case investigation into communication problems may be warranted.

details.customerDescription: Never had arrival for unusable director 0x%llx
details.internalDescription: A situation that is not normally expected has occurred. This may be a signal that communication errors have been ocurring.
details.formatString: Never had arrival for unusable director 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The software is resolving issues with determining the set of directors to run at this cluster by deciding that this director should not be part of that set. This is usually because this director cannot see directors (both local and remote) that other directors can see.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The software is resolving issues with determining the set of directors to run at this cluster by deciding that this director should not be part of that set. This is usually because this director cannot see directors (both local and remote) that other directors can see.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If this director keeps rebooting and getting killed, investigate why it seems to be having trouble seeing other directors, or seeing directors that other directors do not see.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Local discovery declares this director unwanted - aborting
details.internalDescription: The software is resolving issues with determining the set of directors to run at this cluster by deciding that this director should not be part of that set. This is usually because this director cannot see directors (both local and remote) that other directors can see. This message often doesn't come out, because the director is STONITHed first.
details.formatString: Local discovery declares this director unwanted - aborting

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Resolve any communication issues. If none can be found, and the problem persists, reboot either this director or the indicated director.

details.customerDescription: Not reporting director %s - %u sends outstanding to it
details.internalDescription: This director is having trouble sending messages to the indicated director. This could indicate general communication problems.
details.formatString: Not reporting director %s - %u sends outstanding to it

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: "remoteDirectorsVisible" is how many directors at other clusters this director can see. "directorCount" is how many directors within the cluster that this director can see. "wantedGoneCount" and "problemCount" are values relating to the algorithm used to remove some director from the local director group, based on visibility differences between it and other directors. If the communication visibility issues (Com presence) continue for long enough, the director will be STONITHed in order that the system regain operation.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check for communication issues both within the cluster containing this director, and between clusters.

details.customerDescription: removing director 0x%llx: remote visible %u local visible %u wantedGone %u problemCnt %u
details.internalDescription: This director is having communications visibility problems with other directors. It has been chosen for expulsion based on it being at least as problematic as any other.
details.formatString: removing director 0x%llx: remote visible %u local visible %u wantedGone %u problemCnt %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If this happens, tower commands "nmg setallowauto" and "nmg setallowdelay" will set the values.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The proper configuration must be recreated.

details.customerDescription: bad nvol read of cluster join config, len %d not %u
details.internalDescription: The persistent configuration value "NmgAllowInfo" did not have the expected size. It has been ignored, and default values will be used.
details.formatString: bad nvol read of cluster join config, len %d not %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If this happens, the name can be re-entered with "nmg clustername".
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The desired cluster name should be re-entered into the system.

details.customerDescription: bad nvol read of cluster name, len %d not %u
details.internalDescription: The persistent configuration value "NmgClusterName" did not have the expected size. It has been ignored, and this cluster will not have a user-configured cluster name.
details.formatString: bad nvol read of cluster name, len %d not %u

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: Not reporting director %s - it re-arrived too early
details.internalDescription: This director has rebooted, but due to difficulties establishing the current local official group of directors, we have not yet been able to depart it. So, its re-arrival will be delayed.
details.formatString: Not reporting director %s - it re-arrived too early

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If this happens, tower commands "nmg setautowexpelcount" and "nmg setautoexpelseconds" will set the values.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The proper configuration must be recreated.

details.customerDescription: Bad nvol read of auto expel config, len %d not %u
details.internalDescription: The persistent configuration value "NmgAutoExpelInfo" did not have the expected size. It has been ignored, and default values will be used.
details.formatString: Bad nvol read of auto expel config, len %d not %u

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed until the conditions that triggered the departures that triggered the auto-expel setting have cleared up. Then the cluster can be manually unexpelled.

details.customerDescription: Auto-expelling cluster %u
details.internalDescription: The active configuration for auto-expelling clusters has been triggered. The cluster will now be auto-expelled, and must be manually unexpelled in order to bring it back.
details.formatString: Auto-expelling cluster %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If there are more than one of these events during a local discovery, then the current-count on subsequent ones will be decreased by each director being disallowed from the local ring.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check for communication issues both within the cluster containing this director, and between clusters.

details.customerDescription: Removing director 0x%llx", only %u of %u other local directors see it
