details.internalDescription: This director is having communications visibility problems with other directors. It has been chosen for expulsion based on it being at least as problematic as any other.
details.formatString: Removing director 0x%llx", only %u of %u other local directors see it

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check for communication issues both within the cluster containing this director, and between clusters.

details.customerDescription: Removing director 0x%llx, can only see %u other directors
details.internalDescription: This director is having communications visibility problems with other directors. It has been chosen for expulsion based on it being at least as problematic as any other.
details.formatString: Removing director 0x%llx, can only see %u other directors

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg remote code, as a client of the nmg message infrastructure, has to copy incoming remote messages into a new buffer in order to pass them to a thread for processing. However, a new buffer could not be allocated for this copying. Since we can't get a copy of the buffer for the copy, we can't get a buffer for sending a reply indicating this either.

details.customerDescription: No Nmg message to copy remote message for later processing.
details.formatString: No Nmg message to copy remote message for later processing.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg has received an arrival notification over the management network from COM layer about a director from another cluster. The Nmg ignores the unexpected notification. If this occurs repeatedly, there is an error in the configuration of the management network.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications.
details.internalDescription: Unexpected arriving director from another cluster on management network.
details.formatString: Unexpected membership arrival uuid 0x%llx appears from foreign cluster %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg has received a departure notification on the management network from the COM layer about a director that it doesn't know about. The system will ignore the condition and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occasional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications.
details.internalDescription: Never saw arrival of departing director [uuid].
details.formatString: Never saw arrival of departing membership node 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg witness version number is in all Nmg witness messages. It is a single-byte field at the beginning of the message, which is intended to change when the basic format of the messages changes.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: There is a mismatch between the software on this node and on the remote node. If the suggested remedies do not fix the problem, contact EMC Customer Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If this situation arose because a director with a different version of firmware was inserted into the cluster and booted, then shut down that director. If the situation arose because a communications link has been brought up by mistake, then take down that communications link.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If this situation arose because a director with a different version of firmware was inserted into the cluster and booted, then shut down that director. If the situation arose because a communications link has been brought up by mistake, then take down that communications link.

details.customerDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications.
details.internalDescription: An Nmg message has been received from the specified other director over the membership network which reports a different version of Nmg messages. That means that this director can't even understand that director's messages. The message is not processed.
details.formatString: Received message from 0x%llx with version %u instead of %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is an expected message issued by the witness when it is queried about the health of departing nodes. The discovery iteration number matches the number in the earlier nmg_78 message issued when discovery started. The number of nodes queried and the group status returned by the witness is given.

details.customerDescription: normal message reporting results of nmg witness query operation.
details.internalDescription: Local discovery [iterationNumber] witness query for [number] nodes returns [status]
details.formatString: Local discovery iteration %u witness query for %d nodes returns %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This failure exposes the cluster to a Data Unavailability (DU) condition in certain director failure/inter-director link failure scenarios. The nmg witness uses this communication path to check the health of directors that have lost communication over the regular inter-director communication network. If the management network path is down, then a failure of half of the running directors becomes a DU to avoid a potential Data Corruption condition. This is necessary because the health of the inaccessible directors cannot be determined.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This failure exposes the cluster to a Data Unavailability condition in certain director failure/inter-director link failure scenarios. The event indicates a persistent failure of the link over the management network from the director issuing this event to the director identified by director-name and COM-uuid. If the failure argument is 'never', the connection was never working. If the failure argument is 'not', the connection has failed for the number of seconds given by the secondsSinceOperational argument. NOTE: The other director COM-uuid appears in the VPlexcli director listing as its director-id attribute.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check that the ETH00 and ETH01 ports are enabled on all directors. Check the management network connections. Ensure that the IP routing allows the directors to ping each other. Use the tower command 'nmg winfo' to check the management network communication on each director.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the management network cables and the corresponding management modules. Contact EMC Customer Support for problem resolution.

details.customerDescription: This event indicates the issuing director does not have trustworthy communication with the identified director over the management network.
details.internalDescription: The nmg witness has been unable to communicate with the specified director over the management network for the interval reported in the event.
details.formatString: Membership com connection to %s/0x%llx untrustworthy: %s operational for %d sec

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is normal event when issuing the nsfw command "nmg wenable false" and when reading a persisted witness setting at director startup. When enabled, the nmg witness will minimize instances of data unavailablity if multiple director failures occur. You should not override the default settings in normal operation.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This is normal event when issuing an nsfw witness configuration command and at director startup. You should not change the witness settings unless directed by EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The nmg witness is disabled.
details.internalDescription: The nmg witness is disabled.
details.formatString: witness is disabled

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is normal event when issuing the nsfw command "nmg wenable true" and when reading a persisted witness setting at director startup. When enabled, the nmg witness will minimize instances of data unavailablity if multiple director failures occur. You should not override the default settings in normal operation.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This is normal event when issuing an nsfw witness configuration command and at director startup. You should not change the witness settings unless directed by EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The nmg witness is enabled.
details.internalDescription: The nmg witness was enabled. The current threshold settings are also displayed.
details.formatString: witness is enabled: trust threshold %u seconds, silence threshold %u seconds

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is normal event when issuing an nsfw witness configuration command and when reading a persisted witness setting at director startup. The settings control the timing thresholds used by the witness when it is enabled. You should not override the default settings in normal operation. The nsfw command "nmg wsettrust trustThreshold" command changes the trust threshold. The witness uses the trust threshold to judge if the management network connection to a director is trustworthy. For a director in the current local group, if the management network connection has failed for over trustThreshold seconds, the connection is considered untrustworthy and cannot be used by the witness. The nsfw command "nmg wsetsilence silenceThreshold" changes the silence threshold. The witness uses the silence threshold to determine if a director disconnected from the regular network has actually failed. The witness considers the director failed if it has been disconnected for at least silenceThreshold seconds.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This is normal event when issuing an nsfw witness configuration command and at director startup. You should not change the witness settings unless directed by EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: One or more nmg witness parameters were changed.
details.internalDescription: One or more nmg witness parameters were changed. The enable status will be "enabled" or "disabled". The current and previous threshold values are given. If a value is not changed, the previous value will be the same as the current value.
details.formatString: witness parameter change: %s with trust threshold %u seconds (was %u), silence threshold %u seconds (was %u)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The persistent configuration value "NmgWitnessParameters" did not have the expected size. It has been ignored, and default values will be used.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The persistent configuration value for the witness could not be read. The default values will be used.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If this happens, tower commands "nmg wenable", "nmg wsettrust", "nmg wsetsilence" will set the values.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The proper configuration must be recreated. Contact EMC Techincal Support.

details.customerDescription: There was an error reading persisted witness parameters.
details.internalDescription: bad nvol read of witness paramters, actualLen was read, not expectedLen
details.formatString: bad nvol read of witness parameters config, len %d not %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The cluster reporting this event has been unable to establish communication with Cluster Witness Server for the last 15 minutes or more. This may be due to failure of Cluster Witness Server (process, VM, or server); or due to loss of management network connectivity between this cluster's Management Server and Cluster Witness Server (loss of physical connectivity, route misconfiguration, or loss of VPN); or due to failure of Management Server or due to loss of private management connectivity between the lowest UUID director and the Management Server in this cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The cluster reporting this event has been unable to establish communication with Cluster Witness Server. This may be due to the failure of the server or loss of network connectivity.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if the Virtual Machine hosting the Cluster Witness Server is running. Check if the Management Server is running and verify the VPN settings b/w the Management Server and the Cluster Witness Server. If connectivity is lost from both clusters and can not be restored quickly advise the customer to disable the Cluster Witness Server via VPLEXCLI. This will prevent DU if a site partition occurs.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check network connectivity between the local Management Server and Cluster Witness Server. Check whether Cluster Witness Server VM is running. If connectivity is lost from both clusters, disable the Cluster Witness Server via VPLEXCLI until connectivity can be restored in order to prevent data unavailability on cluster partition. If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The cluster is unable to communicate with the Cluster Witness Server.
details.internalDescription: The cluster is unable to communicate with the Cluster Witness Server.
details.formatString: The cluster %u has been unable to establish communication with the Cluster Witness Server for %u seconds.

details.customerDescription: Communication is established between this cluster and Cluster Witness Server.
details.internalDescription: Communication is established between this cluster and Cluster Witness Server.
details.formatString: The communication between cluster %u and the Cluster Witness Server is established.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is a normal event indicating either that a booting director has learned its configuration or that a director accepted an administrative configuration change.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This is a normal event indicating either that a booting director has learned its configuration or that a director accepted an administrative configuration change.

details.customerDescription: One or more Cluster Witness parameters were changed.
details.internalDescription: One or more Cluster Witness parameters were changed. The enable status will be "enabled" or "disabled". The current and previous public and private IP addresses of the Cluster Witness Server are provided.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness parameter change: %s with public server IP address %s (was %s) with private server IP address %s (was %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is normal event when Cluster Witness is enabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This is normal event when Cluster Witness is enabled.

details.customerDescription: Cluster Witness is enabled.
details.internalDescription: Cluster Witness is enabled. The current and previous public and private IP addresses of the Cluster Witness Server are provided.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness is enabled: public server IP address %s (was %s), private server IP address %s (was %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is generated when Cluster Witness is administratively disabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This event is generated when Cluster Witness is administratively disabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If the Cluster Witness was disabled in error, re-enable it.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the Cluster Witness was disabled in error, re-enable it.

details.customerDescription: Cluster Witness is disabled.
details.internalDescription: Cluster Witness Server is disabled
details.formatString: Cluster Witness is disabled

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An invalid/corrupt message has been received from the Cluster Witness Server by the identified cluster. This message has been dropped.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the integrity of the management network.

details.customerDescription: An invalid/corrupt message has been received from Cluster Witness Server by the identified cluster.
details.internalDescription: An invalid/corrupt message has been received from the Cluster Witness Server by the identified cluster.
details.formatString: Received an invalid cluster witness message (type: %u) destined to cluster %u (local cluster is %u), specified nextState %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An invalid health-check broadcast message has been received on a director of this cluster. This broadcast message will be dropped. This could occur if some directors of a cluster have different clusterIds configured.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if all directors in a cluster have the same clusterId and are configured correctly.

details.customerDescription: An invalid health-check broadcast message has been received on a director of this cluster.
details.internalDescription: An invalid health-check broadcast message has been received on a director of this cluster.
details.formatString: Droping an invalid health-check broadcast message on cluster %u (local cluster is %u), node-id %u, specified nextState %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Cluster Witness Server has detected and reported an inter-cluster partition. This marks the loss of connectivity between the remote cluster and the reporting cluster. This may be due to physical failure or congestion of the inter-cluster network.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Cluster Witness Server has detected and reported an inter-cluster partition. This marks the loss of connectivity between the remote cluster and the reporting cluster. This may be due to physical failure or congestion of the inter-cluster network.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If the Cluster Witness Server is present and enabled, it should have provided guidance to continuue IO on the winning cluster. If the Cluster Witness Server is not present, check that the distributed devices and consistency groups are running on the winning cluster. Verify all cables connected to WAN-COM ports on the directors. Verify physical connectivity as well as load on the corresponding inter-cluster network.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the Cluster Witness Server is present and enabled, it should have provided guidance to continuue IO on the winning cluster. If the Cluster Witness Server is not present, check that the distributed devices and consistency groups are running on the winning cluster. If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Cluster Witness Server detected an inter-cluster partition and has provided its guidance to proceed with the configured detach rule settings.
details.internalDescription: Cluster Witness Server detected an inter-cluster partition and has provided its guidance to proceed with the configured detach rule settings.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness Server has detected a cluster partition and is providing guidance to proceed with the configured detach rule settings on the cluster %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Cluster Witness Server detected that the remote cluster is unreachable. This could mean that the remote cluster has either failed or become isolated from both its peer cluster and the Cluster Witness Server. This could be due to site disaster event. Alternatively, this could be due to dual failure of the inter-cluster and management networks.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Cluster Witness Server detected that the remote cluster has either failed or become isolated. This could be due to site disaster or due to dual failure of inter-cluster and management networks.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Verify the state of the remote cluster. Also, check the state of inter-cluster network as well as the management network connecting the remote cluster to Cluster Witness Server.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Cluster Witness Server detected that the remote cluster has either failed or become isolated and provided its guidance to the local cluster.
details.internalDescription: Cluster Witness Server detected that the remote cluster has either failed or become isolated and provided its guidance to the local cluster.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness Server detected that remote cluster %s has either failed or become isolated. This cluster %u is guided to proceed with I/O on all distributed volumes in all synchronous consistency groups regardless of configured detach rule settings.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Cluster Witness Server has reported that the local cluster was isolated and must suspend I/O on all distributed volumes in all synchronous consistency groups until its connectivity with the peer cluster recovers. This could either take place after a cluster fails and reboots and then finds itself partitioned from its peer cluster but capable of communicating with Cluster Witness Server. Alternatively, this could take place after a cluster becomes isolated and later recovers connectivity with Cluster Witness Server. At the point this event is reported the clusters cannot communicate with each other. This could be either due to partition of inter-cluster network or potential failure or isolation of the remote cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Cluster Witness Server detected that the local cluster was previously isolated and must suspend I/O on all distributed volumes in all synchronous consistency groups until its connectivity with the peer cluster recovers. This could be due to problems with the inter-cluster network or due to current failure or isolation of the remote cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Verify the state and load of the inter-cluster network. Check the state of the remote cluster. Also, check the state of management connectivity between the remote cluster's Management Server and Cluster Witness Server.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Cluster Witness Server detected that the local cluster has become isolated and provided its guidance.
details.internalDescription: Cluster Witness Server detected that the local cluster has become isolated and provided its guidance.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness Server detected that this cluster %u has become isolated. This cluster is suspending I/O on all distributed volumes in all synchronous consistency groups regardless of configured detach rule settings.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Cluster Witness cannot be enabled on systems with more than the supported number of clusters. This could occur due to mis-configuration of cluster-ids.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Cluster Witness cannot be enabled on systems with more than the supported number of clusters. If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support to correct the misconfigured cluster-id.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support to correct the misconfigured cluster-id.

details.customerDescription: The number of observed clusters exceeds the limit currently supported by Cluster Witness (2).
details.internalDescription: The number of observed clusters exceeds the limit currently supported by Cluster Witness (2).
details.formatString: Cluster Witness cannot be enabled on systems with more than %u deployed clusters.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The cluster reporting this event has been unable to receive any guidance from the Cluster Witness Server for the last 10 seconds. This may be due to failure of the Cluster Witness Server (process, VM, or server); or due to loss of management network connectivity between this cluster's Management Server and Cluster Witness Server (loss of physical connectivity, route misconfiguration, or loss of VPN); or due to failure of Management Server or due to loss of private management connectivity between the lowest UUID director and the Management Server in this cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The cluster reporting this event has been unable to receive any guidance from the Cluster Witness Server for the last 10 seconds. This may be due to failure of the Cluster Witness Server or loss of network connectivity.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: A winner needs to be manually chosen for all suspended synchronous consistency-groups using the VPlexcli command consistency-group choose-winner in order to resume I/O at the desired cluster. Once this is complete, check if the Virtual Machine hosting the Cluster Witness Server is running. Check if the Management Server is running and verify the VPN settings between the Management Server and the Cluster Witness Server.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: A winner needs to be manually chosen for all suspended synchronous consistency-groups using the VPlexcli command consistency-group choose-winner in order to resume I/O at the desired cluster. Once this is complete, check network connectivity between the local Management Server and Cluster Witness Server. Check whether Cluster Witness Server VM is running. If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The cluster did not receive any guidance from the Cluster Witness Server within 10 seconds.
details.internalDescription: The cluster did not receive any guidance from the Cluster Witness Server within the isolation timeout of 10 seconds.
details.formatString: The isolation timer expired for cluster %u without any guidance from Cluster Witness Server. This cluster is suspending I/O on all distributed volumes in all synchronous consistency groups regardless of configured detach rule settings.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Cluster Witness Client in the cluster reporting this event has changed its Cluster Witness state either based on loss/recovery of inter-cluster connectivity or based on guidance received from Cluster Witness Server.

details.customerDescription: The cluster changed internal Cluster Witness state.
details.internalDescription: Cluster Witness Client is changing its internal state either based on loss/recovery of inter-cluster connectivity or based on guidance received from Cluster Witness Server.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness Client changed state from %s to %s: (enabled %c, remClusterCount %u).

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Cluster Witness Client in the cluster reporting this event has received a message with unsupported protocol version from the Cluster Witness Server. This event may potentially be reported after incorrectly performed upgrade. While this condition persists, connectivity between the Cluster Witness Server and the cluster that reported this event may be severed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If this condition persists, ensure that software on all directors as well as Cluster Witness Server software is upgraded to a release where Cluster Witness Server and Client use compatible protocol versions.

details.customerDescription: A message with unsupported protocol version has been received from Cluster Witness Server.
details.internalDescription: The Cluster Witness Client received a message with unsupported protocol version from the Cluster Witness Server.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness Client dropped %u received message(s) with unexpected protocol version (received version in the last message: %u, expected version: %u).

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The persistent configuration value "NmgClusterWitnessParameters" did not have the expected size. It has been ignored, and default values will be used.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The persistent configuration value for the Cluster Witness could not be read. The default values will be used.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If this happens, tower commands "nmg cwenable", "nmg cwpub", "nmg cwpriv" may be used to set the values.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The proper Cluster Witness configuration must be recreated. Please, contact EMC Techincal Support.

details.customerDescription: There was an error reading persisted Cluster Witness parameters.
details.internalDescription: During NVOL read operation for Cluster Witness configuration paramters, a record of unexpected size was read
details.formatString: bad nvol read of Cluster Witness parameters config, len %u not %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The most likely root cause is memory corruption within nsfw and/or Cluster Witness Server.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: There are no known causes for this condition. Please contact EMC Customer Service.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The content of distributed volumes in the configured consistency groups may be diverging due to conflicting detach. Once the clusters re-establish connectivity with one another, manual intervention will be required to identify the cluster whose data should be used for recovery. Use \"consistency-group resolve-conflicting-detach\" VPlexcli command to select a cluster for each consistency group to be the source to resynchronize distributed volumes in that group.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The content of distributed volumes in the configured consistency groups may be diverging due to conflicting detach. Once the clusters re-establish connectivity with one another, manual intervention will be required to identify the cluster whose data should be used for recovery. Use \"consistency-group resolve-conflicting-detach\" VPlexcli command to select a cluster for each consistency group to be the source to resynchronize distributed volumes in that group.

details.customerDescription: Cluster Witness Server has detected potential conflicting detaches of distributed volumes in consistency groups.
details.internalDescription: Cluster Witness Server observed inconsistent clusters\' states, which is likely to cause conflicting detaches of distributed volumes in consistency groups.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness Client %u dropped %u received message(s) with inconsistentState rejection response (current cluster state %s, specified next cluster state %s).

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An nmg message could not be routed from the given source director to the given destination director. This event can be generated if a director or communication connectivity between directors is lost during local discovery.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal message could not be routed from the given source director to the given destination director. This event can be generated if a director or communication connectivity between directors is lost during local discovery.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: No action is required, since the message will be retried in the next round of local discovery.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: No action is required, since the message will be retried.

details.customerDescription: An internal message could not be routed to its final destination.
details.internalDescription: An nmg discovery message could not be routed to its final destination.
details.formatString: Message could not be routed from 0x%llx to 0x%llx (type %u, iteration %u)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An nmg message allocation level is higher than normal.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal message allocation level is higher than normal.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: This may be a transient issue, so first check that the higher than normal allocation level still exists. An 0x8a26307b event will be issued if the number of allocated messages drop to more normal levels). If the condition persists, then check for inter- and intra-cluster networking issues, since higher than normal networking delays can trigger scenarios where nmg messages are held for long periods of time.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: This may be a transient issue. 1. If the condition persists, then check for inter- and intra-cluster networking issues, since higher than normal networking delays can trigger scenarios where these internal messages are held for long periods of time. 2. If the above steps do not resolve this issue, then contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An internal message allocation threshold has been crossed.
details.internalDescription: An nmg message allocation threshold has been crossed.
details.formatString: Message allocation threshold (%u) reached

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An nmg message allocation level was higher than normal, but has dropped to more normal usage levels.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal message allocation level was higher than normal, but has dropped to more normal usage levels.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: No action is required.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: No action is required.

details.customerDescription: An internal message allocation level was higher than normal, but has dropped to more normal levels.
details.internalDescription: An nmg message allocation level was higher than normal, but has dropped to more normal levels.
details.formatString: Message allocation dropped below threshold

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An nmg message could not be routed to its destination since a routing loop was detected. The presence of a routing loop is a transient condition that should clear as soon as the network topology converges.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal message could not be routed to its destination due to the detection of a transient routing condition.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: No action is required, since the message will be retried in the next round of local discovery.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: No action is required, since the message will be retried.

details.customerDescription: An internal message could not be routed to its final destination due to a transient routing condition.
details.internalDescription: An nmg control message could not be routed to its final destination because a routing loop was detected.
details.formatString: Routing loop detected: sent from 0x%llx to destination 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The persistent configuration value "NmgCmgManualExpelBitmap" did not have the expected size. It has been ignored, and default values will be used.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The persistent configuration value for the expelled status could not be read. The default values will be used.

details.customerDescription: There was an error reading persisted information about the expelled cluster.
details.internalDescription: The persistent configuration value "NmgCmgManualExpelBitmap" did not have the expected size.
details.formatString: Manual expel bitmap is missing from Nvol, len read %d expected %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The cluster reporting this event has been unable to establish communication with Cluster Witness Server for the last 60 secs or more.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if the Virtual Machine hosting the Cluster Witness Server is running. Check if the Management Server is running and verify the VPN settings b/w the Management Server and the Cluster Witness Server. If connectivity is lost from both clusters and can not be restored quickly advise the customer to disable the Cluster Witness Server via VPLEXCLI. This will prevent DU if a site partition occurs.

details.customerDescription: The cluster is unable to communicate with the Cluster Witness Server.
details.internalDescription: The cluster is unable to communicate with the Cluster Witness Server.
details.formatString: The cluster %u has been unable to establish communication with the Cluster Witness Server for %u seconds.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is reported by all directors on a given cluster when an NMG group change event indicates that the NVOL server is moving.

details.customerDescription: Nvol server is now uuid 0x%llx
details.formatString: Nvol server is now uuid 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Reported by the current NVOL server when it detects that the server has changed

details.customerDescription: FS
details.formatString: FS

details.customerDescription: FS scan complete - nvol ready
details.formatString: FS scan complete - nvol ready

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Either the NVOL server is not configured, or there is a problem with the metadata storage volume, or the NVOL file system has been corrupted. The user should check that the NVOL server is configured and check that the metadata storage volume is ready. If the file system has been corrupted, some configuration data can still be recovered.

details.customerDescription: Couldn't read metavolume header - nvol not ready
details.internalDescription: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server could not startup. This could affect various system components that depend on the storage server for saved configuration settings.
details.formatString: Couldn't read metavolume header - nvol not ready

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server could not scan the file system, which means it has been corrupted in some way. The NVOL server will not start normal operations until the file system has been repaired.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The non-volatile file system has been corrupted and must be repaired.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Issuing "nvol mkfs" will recreate the file system, but the data from the point of error to the end will be lost.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The NVOL file system has been corrupted and must be repaired. Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Non-volatile storage filesystem corruption detected.
details.internalDescription: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server could not scan the file system, which means it has been corrupted in some way. The NVOL server will not start normal operations until the file system has been repaired.
details.formatString: Incomplete record, read %d blocks at %lld (last %lld)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server could not initialize file system because the metadata header is corrupted in some way. The NVOL server will not start normal operations until the file system has been repaired.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The non-volatile file system is either not configured or has been corrupted.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Issuing "nvol mkfs" will recreate the file system, all data in the existing file system will be lost.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The non-volatile file system is either not configured or has been corrupted. The file system should be reconfigured. Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Couldn't read metavolume header - nvol not ready.
details.internalDescription: Couldn't read metavolume header - nvol not ready.
details.formatString: Couldn't read metavolume header - nvol not ready

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Issuing "nvol mkfs" can be used to increase the size of the file system without losing data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Create a larger meta-volume with a larger NVOL file system. Contact EMC Customer Support for assistance.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Issuing "nvol mkfs" can be used to increase the size of the file system without losing data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Create a larger meta-volume. Contact EMC Customer Support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: An operation on the meta-volume has failed due to lack of space, and the size of the meta-volume needs to be increased.
details.internalDescription: An operation on the meta-volume has failed due to lack of space, and the size of the meta-volume needs to be increased. No data has been lost, but a failure of the director could result in lost configuration data.
details.formatString: File System is full, compact failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Issuing "nvol rm key" will remove the corrupted key so that its contents can be regenerated, but its current contents will be lost.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The specified record within the NVOL file system has been corrupted and must be repaired. Contact EMC Technical Support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: Bad CheckSum %d for key %s, expected %d
details.internalDescription: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server keeps a ckecksum with every record, both in memory and on storage volume. If the checksum of the current record contents does not match the saved checksum, it means the data has been corrupted in some way. The NVOL server will continue with the corrupted data, but the data should be repaired.
details.formatString: Bad CheckSum %d for key %s, expected %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server writes all records immediately to storage volume, but also keeps a copy of the data in memory. If the write to storage volume fails, the record is still in memory, but its contents could be lost if the in-memory copy is lost due to director failure or shutdown. The NVOL server will continue with the vulnerable data, and will persist it when the metadata storage volume is repaired.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A write error occurred to the non-volatile storage server and data was not written to disk.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Issuing "nvol compact" when the meta-volume is repaired will flush the entire in-memory database to meta-volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Investigate why writing to the meta-volume failed. If failure cannot be corrected, create a new meta-volume and copy the in memory data to the new meta-volume.

details.customerDescription: A write error occurred and data was not written to disk.
details.internalDescription: A write error occurred and data was not written to disk.
details.formatString: Write Error in %s, data not persisted

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Issuing "nvol compact" when the system load returns to normal will ensure that all changes have been persisted to storage volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The system is overloaded and is running out of memory. The load on the system should be reduced.

details.customerDescription: Could not create thread %s
details.internalDescription: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) server uses threads to perform some of its work. If a thread cannot be created, the work cannot be performed. The NVOL server will continue processing the work requests that it can, but some state changes may not be persisted to storage volume.
details.formatString: Could not create thread %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The nvol database should be checked to see if any updates are missing.

details.customerDescription: Lock holder 0x%016llx departed clearing lock
details.internalDescription: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) server allows clients to lock the database to make multiple updates appear atomic. If the client has departed without clearing the lock, the multiple updates may not have completed. The lock is cleared to allow other clients to continue, but some updates could be missing.
details.formatString: Lock holder 0x%016llx departed clearing lock

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server file system usage has crossed the warning threshold and is almost full. Although no data has been lost, action should be taken to prevent a potential data loss.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This event indicates that the NVOL filesystem has crossed the warning threshold and is almost full.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Issuing "nvol mkfs" can be used to increase the size of the file system without losing data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: While this event does not indicate an immediate failure, it is advised that the NVOL file system be resized to prevent it from filling up. Contact EMC Customer Support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: File System usage has crossed the warning threshold.
details.internalDescription: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server file system usage has crossed the warning threshold and is almost full.
details.formatString: File System usage greater than %u%%

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Depending on the hardware platform, the port component expects a fixed inventory of devices to be reported by the low level device drivers. This event indicates that some low level driver has reported a device whose name is not in the fixed 'layout'.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: On initialization of the firmware, unexpected hardware was detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: To avoid this when running on non standard hardware configurations either edit the layout or run with the "portenglayout=1" boot option.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: Device [device] not found in port layout.
details.internalDescription: On initialization of the firmware, unexpected hardware was detected, for which no port role could be established.
details.formatString: Device %s not found in port layout

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A hardware port is being enabled by user.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A hardware port is being enabled by user.

details.customerDescription: Device [device] is being enabled with role [role].
details.internalDescription: A hardware port [device] is being enabled with role [role].
details.formatString: enabling port %s role %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A hardware port is being disabled by user.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A hardware port is being disabled by user.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The administrator requested to disable a port.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The administrator requested to disable a port, please make sure this is as planned.

details.customerDescription: Device [device] with role [role] is being disabled.
details.internalDescription: A hardware port [device] with role [role] is being disabled.
details.formatString: disabling port %s role %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event shows various internal qlogic revision levels as reported by the qlogic firmware on reset. portId: the qlc port being reported The string inside the [] should be "ISP". If this isn't so, the chip isn't behaving properly. The other fields are: chip: the chip revision level risc: the risc processor revision rom: the risc rom revision level seq: the sequencer revision mbox8: the buffer and module revision levels NOTE: There are other values reported by the chip that are not printed out here. These include the frame buffer module fibre protocol modules

details.arguments: portId string chip risc rom seq mbox8
details.customerDescription: qlc%d: less [%c%c%c%c%c%c] chip %d risc %d rom %d seq %d mbox8 %x
details.formatString: qlc%d: <%c%c%c%c%c%c> chip %d risc %d rom %d seq %d mbox8 %x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The qlogic firmware delivered a port logout event.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: received a port logout
details.internalDescription: A port logout is an indication that the port discovery timed out, a port name changed or relogin happened. This is normal during start up and fibre channel fabric disruptions. On a GSX 3000, qlc0 corresponds to the port labeled FC0, qlc1, qlc2 through qlc15 correspond to the ports labeled FC1, FC2 through FC15, respectively.
details.formatString: qlc%d: received a port logout

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The qlogic firmware delivered a global logo event. This indicates that all communication from this port dropped (for example due to a pulled cable).

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: received a global logo
details.formatString: qlc%d: received a global logo

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The qlogic driver decided to make a debug dump of the qlogic firmware. This dump should be helpful for qlogic to analyze this problem. Port [portId] ran into difficulties. The dump is made to physical address [physicalAddress] and has a length of [length] bytes. Important parameters for getting an actual Ascii dump are the end offset of the sram memory [sramHigh], the request queue length [reqLen] and response queue length [respLen]. In case there was not enough room for a full dump the [truncateString] will indicate so.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: debug dump to phys 0x%llx len %d%s
details.formatString: qlc%d: debug dump to phys 0x%llx len %d%s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Qlogic firmware on port [portId] gave us a second task with tag [rxid]. The task that we have been given earlier with this tag has not yet been completed. If the Qlogic firmware was asked to abort a task it provides us only with a tag (it should also provide us with an initiator id, target id and logical unit number according to the scsi spec), we would not know which of these two tasks to abort.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: rxid (0x%x) already exists
details.formatString: qlc%d: rxid (0x%x) already exists

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Qlogic firmware on port [portId] gave us a second task with tag [rxid]. The task that we have been given earlier with this tag has not yet been completed. If the Qlogic firmware was asked to abort a task it provides us only with a tag (it should also provide us with an initiator id, target id and logical unit number according to the scsi spec), we would not know which of these two tasks to abort.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: rxid (0x%x) already exists
details.formatString: qlc%d: rxid (0x%x) already exists

On a GSX 3000, qlc0 corresponds to the port labeled FC0, qlc1, qlc2 through qlc15 correspond to the ports labeled FC1, FC2 through FC15, respectively.
details.formatString: qlc%d: can't create qlcPortPanic thread

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: MOD_VP_CONFIG iocb failed

details.customerDescription: qlc%d virtual port %d creation failed %d"

details.customerDescription: qlc%d virtual port %d enabling failed with code %d"
details.internalDescription: A VIRUTAL_PORT_CONTROL iocb that has been issued to the qlogic firmware failed with error code [vpResult]. As a result the corresponding virtual port realization fails.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: VP_CONTROL iocb failed

details.customerDescription: qlc%d virtual port %d disabling failed with code %d"
details.internalDescription: A VIRUTAL_PORT_CONTROL iocb that has been issued to the qlogic firmware failed with error code [vpResult]. As a result the corresponding virtual port destroy fails.
details.formatString: qlc%d virtual port %d disabling failed with code %d"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Qlogic firmware might be stuck.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: No heartbeat for more " than %d seconds.
details.internalDescription: The firmware running on the qlogic interface [interfaceId] is either dead or is too busy to update the firmware heartbeat.
details.formatString: qlc%d: No heartbeat for more " than %d seconds.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event provides enough information to identify the problem connection on the interface, port and the remote device.

details.arguments: qiId portname status flags initloopid targetloopid
details.customerDescription: qi %d qp 0x%016llx receives a tmf status 0x%x and flags 0x%x on a non-existent login at loopid 0x%x from loopid 0x%x
details.internalDescription: This problem could be a race condition inside the Qlogic firmware that tmfs are received on logins that have been torn down already.
details.formatString: qi %d qp 0x%016llx receives a tmf status 0x%x and flags 0x%x on a non-existent login at loopid 0x%x from loopid 0x%x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event provides enough information to identify the problem connection on the interface, port and the remote device.

details.customerDescription: qi %d received a IN (status 0x%x flags 0x%x) on a non-existent port at loopid %d
details.internalDescription: This problem could be a race condition inside the Qlogic firmware that tmfs are received on qps that have been torn down already.
details.formatString: qi %d received a IN (status 0x%x flags 0x%x) on a non-existent port at loopid %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event provides enough information to identify the problem connection on the interface, port and the remote device.

details.customerDescription: qi %d qp 0x%016llx received a port logout IN on a non-existent qc at loopid %d
details.internalDescription: This problem could be a race condition inside the Qlogic firmware that tmfs are received on a qp that isn't ready yet.
details.formatString: qi %d qp 0x%016llx received a port logout IN on a non-existent qc at loopid %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Qlogic firmware might be stuck.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: No heartbeat for more " than %d seconds. Resetting interface.
details.internalDescription: The firmware running on the qlogic interface [interfaceId] is either dead or has been too busy to update the firmware heartbeat, for longer than the heartbeat timeout. The interface is being automatically reset.
details.formatString: qlc%d: No heartbeat for more " than %d seconds. Resetting interface.

details.formatString: Port %s link is up.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Port [portId] lost activity on the wire.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the SFP, cable, and switch attached to this back-end port, especially anything that has been changed recently. If problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.internalDescription: The reported port has no signal therefore no devices are accessibe through that port. Devices may still be accessible through another port, but the maximum possible throughput is decreased.
details.formatString: Port %s link is down.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If unused devices are discovered they may be added to spare pools and used for new device set creation.

details.internalDescription: The initiator has issued a Report LUNs command to the target port. This will allow the initiator to discover the new set of LUNs added to that target. New devices will appear under the default spare pool for this cluster. Removed devices will be taken out of the pool.
details.formatString: Scsi Renew on IT Nexus %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The EMC Symmetrix sets the additional length field incorrectly, so we must process inquires that break the rules.

details.formatString: Received incorrect Additional Length value %d in standard inquiry data from %s that is less than expected %d. Processing inquiry data anyway.

details.internalDescription: The standard inquiry data from the target device is corrupted due to packet loss, device errro, etc, and will be discarded.
details.formatString: Received invalid standard inquiry data from %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A scsi command issued by the tower has returned with descriptor format sense data. This data can be useful for debugging. In the following description, each field indicated with an asterix (*) is from the sense data format defined in SCSI-3 SCSI Primary Commands (SPC) 4.5.2. The [tgt] is the target that the scsi command is issued to; The [cmd] is the numeric operation code of the scsi command; [status] is the return status of the command; [resp]* is the response code from byte 0 of the sense data; [snskey]* is sense key of the sense data; [asc]* is the additional sense code; [ascq]* is the additional sense code qualifier; [alen] is the additional sense length;

details.arguments: tgt cmd status resp snskey asc ascq alen
details.customerDescription: A scsi command issued by the tower has returned with descriptor format sense data.
details.internalDescription: A scsi command issued by the tower has returned with descriptor format sense data.
details.formatString: tgt %s cmd 0x%x status 0x%x resp 0x%x snskey 0x%x asc 0x%x ascq 0x%x alen %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A scsi command issued by the tower has returned with sense data of reserved response code. This data can be useful for debugging. The response code returned in the sense data is between 0x74h and 0x7Eh, which is reserved according to SPC-3 Revision 21c

details.formatString: Sense data with reserved response code 0x%x has been received from target %s. Sense data: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A scsi command issued by the tower has returned with sense data of vendor specific format. This data can be useful for debugging. The response code returned in the sense data is vendor specific according to SPC-3 Revision 21c.

details.formatString: Sense data with vendor specific response code %x has been recieved from target %s. Sense data: %s

details.internalDescription: An initiator port with port name [portName] and node name [nodeName] is in REALIZING state as defined by FEBE.
details.formatString: Initiator port %s|%s has entered REALIZING state.

details.internalDescription: The realization process of the SCSI initiator port ([portName]|[nodeName]) has completed.
details.formatString: Initiator port %s|%s has entered REALIZED state.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The failure could be due to any one of the following: 1. The director was unable to allocate anymore memory, 2. REPORT LUNS command was unable to complete.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The failure could be due to any one of the following: 1. The director was unable to allocate anymore memory, 2. Attempt to get logical unit inventory was unable to complete.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The initiator will retry the command until either the limit for consecutive retries is reached, or the command succeeds. If the director was unable to allocate anymore memory, reboot the director.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The initiator will retry until either the limit for consecutive retries is reached, or the attempt succeeds.

details.customerDescription: Failed to get logical unit inventory on IT Nexus [itNexus]. Retrying in [retryUSeconds] usec.
details.internalDescription: REPORT LUNS command failed on IT Nexus [itNexus]. Retrying in [retryUSeconds] usec.
details.formatString: Renew failed on IT Nexus %s with reason %s. Retrying in %d usec.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The repeated failure and scsi layer giving up retrying could be due to any one of the following: 1. The director was unable to allocate anymore memory, 2. REPORT LUNS command was unable to complete. 3. The REPORTLUNS command failed as there is no LUNID 0 provisioned to the VPLEX on the path from a Hitachi, HP, SUN or HDS array.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The repeated failure and system giving up retrying could be due to any one of the following: 1. The director was unable to allocate anymore memory, 2. Attempts to get logical unit inventory were unable to complete. 3. The REPORTLUNS command failed as there is no LUNID 0 provisioned to the VPLEX on the path from a Hitachi, HP, SUN or HDS array.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: 1. Check if the array is a Hitachi, HP, SUN or HDS array, and if it is verify that each path from the array has a LUNID 0 exported to VPLEX. 2. Check for other scsi/27 command failures for the array in the firmware.log and investigate the health of the BE array. 3. If memory is believed to be the cause of the problem engage VPLEX Engineering.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check if the array is a Hitachi, HP, SUN or HDS array, and if it is verify that each path from the array has a LUNID 0 exported to VPLEX. Investigate the health of the BE array. If the issue persists contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Retry limit to get logical unit inventory exceeded on an IT Nexus.
details.internalDescription: REPORT LUNS command retry limit exceeded on an IT Nexus.
details.formatString: Renew retry limit of %d exceeded on IT Nexus %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The failure is due to the limit on number of steps that can be added was reached (for example, scsi itl scan failed to add a step to send inquiry to get VPDxx page data because, the limit of 36 steps was reached).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The failure is due to the limit on number of steps that can be added was reached.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: This should never happen. Upgrade the director firmware at the next opportunity.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Failed to add a step to the multistep process.
details.internalDescription: Failed to add a step to the multistep process.
details.formatString: Failed to add step '%s' to multistep process %p.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Tried to allocate structure and failed. Running out of memory resources.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Tried to allocate structure and failed. Running out of memory resources.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If can not allocate memory, check VPLEX director memory usage.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: A memory allocation failed to allocate an object, resulting in an internal functional failure.
details.internalDescription: A memory allocation failed to allocate an object, resulting in an internal functional failure.
details.formatString: Memory allocation failure of object %s in function %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A sanity check is run in the array layer which validates a sane path state. Sanity check failures have been observed in some circumstances with Clariions where the two SPs are claiming contradictory active/passive states for the same unit.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A logical unit has inconsistent path types. Have exhausted attempts to correct this via refresh and have banished the unit.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The admin should look at the health of the storage array. It is reporting some very strange results and is likely in a degraded state. The tower command 'scsi unitunbanish' will attempt to heal the banished state by refreshing the underlying ITLs. If this operation fails, (i.e. the unhealthy condition still exists), another error of the same type will be thrown and the unit will be returned to the banished state. This is a director-local command, and will have to be run on all directors which have the lun banished.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: A Logical Unit reported an inconsistant path state for the array. Recovery attempts failed and the unit has been banished.
details.internalDescription: A Logical Unit reported an inconsistant path state for the array. Recovery attempts failed and the unit has been banished.
details.formatString: Inconsistent path info resolved for logical unit %s on array %s. Banishing the unit.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: ITs can be banished to prevent COM crosstalk on local and wan ports. Other causes of banishment might be misbehaving ITs. Use 'scsi it banished' to see what is banished.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the IT in question should be usable, contact techincal support.

details.internalDescription: The specified IT Nexus is being banished in the system and won't be usable.
details.formatString: Banishing IT Nexus %s.

details.customerDescription: The specified IT is being unbanished to make it usable.
details.internalDescription: The specified IT is being unbanished to make it usable.
details.formatString: Unbanished IT Nexus %s, reason - %s.
Initiator port %s|%s has been destroyed.
Interface %d could not start after reset.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The standard inquiry from all paths to this array have been detected as falling into the Class 1 category.

details.customerDescription: The target array detected is supported.
details.internalDescription: This is for when a target array is detected as a first party and/or well supported device backed up by a higher level of access to organizational resources.
details.formatString: Array %s has identified as an EMC storage device.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The standard inquiry for one or more of the paths to this array has been detected as falling into the Class 2 category.

details.customerDescription: The target array detected is supported.
details.internalDescription: This is for a target array that is a third-party device.
details.formatString: Array %s has identified as a supported 3rd party storage device.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The standard inquiry for one or more of the paths to this array has SPC version != SPC2, 3, or 4, which is not supported by VPLEX.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Target device advertised a behavior which is not supported by the VPLEX initiator.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Upgrade target device to SPC-2, 3, or 4 level, following VPLEX best practices for this device. Do not use this target device, or the device may be less highly available than is recommended for normal operation.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Switch the target device into a supported mode following VPLEX best practices for this device, do not use this target device, or the device may be less highly available than is recommended for normal operation.

details.customerDescription: The target device in its current configuration is not supported for high availability.
details.internalDescription: This SPC level is a target configuration that we know to be actively unsupported.
details.formatString: Array %s supports an SPC version NOT matching 2,3, or 4. Version = %s. This is not supported for high availability.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The standard inquiry response from one or more paths to the array has a device type that is unsupported by VPLEX initiator (not a block device lun, for example), or else this advertised behavior is on a blacklist for behaviors not allowed for inter-operation.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The target device advertised a behavior which doesn't work with the VPLEX initiator.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Find the LU that is reporting the unsupported device type and replace or remove. Follow VPLEX best practices or do not use this target device.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Switch the target device into a supported mode following VPLEX best practices or do not use this target device.

details.customerDescription: Target device is detected to be unsuitable for operation with VPLEX.
details.internalDescription: Target device is detected to be unsuitable for operation with VPLEX.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The scsi layer lost an ITL connection for a LUN ID. The LUN still has more than one path. There might be a faulty hardware (cable, backend switch, array).

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Verify reported array's BE disk health and LUN masking. Check array configuration and physical connection between (a) the director (VPLEX BE Port) and the backend switch and (b) backend switch and the array.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The device server on the back-end array has a mapping of the provisioned Logical Units (LUs) to their respective Logical Unit Numbers (LUNs). The same mapping information is reported to VPLEX via SCSI commands and that LU-LUN mapping must remain the same, till that LU is removed, unclaimed and forgotten by VPLEX and array re-discover is run. Due to some back-end configuration changes this LU-LUN mapping has changed. Depending on the state of the system (host IOs running or not), either DU, DL and DC might have already happened or might happen in future.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: LU mapping on the back-end array had changed. Depending on the state of the system (host IOs running or not), either DU, DL and DC might have already happened or might happen in future.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The VPLEX will automatically destroy this ITL, create a new ITL and re-discover on the new ITL. Inform the customer: 1. That LUN swapping had occurred for the VPDIDs identified in the CDATA of the call-home, and if I/O was running there is the potential that DU/DL occurred. 2. It's important to follow the 'Remove Disk or Array' procedure in the Generator when de-provisioning storage-volumes and/or re-provisioning storage-volumes to VPLEX to ensure an 'array re-discover' is run in between changes in order to prevent LUN swapping from occurring.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: LU mapping on the back-end array had changed. The system will automatically run a refresh to destroy the stale ITL to the old LUID and re-discover the ITL to the new LUID. Always follow the 'Remove Disk or Array' procedure in the Generator when de-provisioning storage-volumes and/or re-provisioning storage-volumes to VPLEX to ensure an 'array re-discover' is run in between changes in order to prevent LUN swapping from occurring.

details.customerDescription: Logical Unit(LU) mapping change detected. For this ITL, a different LU is reported now than what was reported earlier.
details.internalDescription: Logical Unit(LU) mapping change detected. For this ITL, a different LU is reported now than what was reported earlier. The system will destroy this ITL, create a new ITL and re-discover on the new ITL.
details.formatString: LU changed, ITL %s Old LUID %s New LUID %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check for faulty hardware: verify the health of the cables, backend switches and array. Contact EMC Support if the problem persists.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This logical unit has timed out more often than is considered acceptable(timeout rate is specified in the log message).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This logical unit has timed out more often than is considered acceptable
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The cause of the unit timeouts must be determined and fixed. If this unit supports a RAID-1 mirror, VPLEX may have isolated the mirror causing loss of redundancy. If the underlying issues cannot be fixed in a timely manner, consider detaching the unhealthy mirror and attaching a healthy mirror.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Determine the cause of timeouts on the backend by referring to the troubleshooting guide. If this unit supports a RAID-1 mirror, VPLEX may automatically prevent IOs to the leg to improve RAID-1 performance causing loss of redundancy. If the underlying issues cannot be fixed in a timely manner, consider detaching the unhealthy mirror from the RAID-1 device and attach a healthy mirror to reinstate redundancy. Contact EMC Support if the problem persists.

details.customerDescription: The logical unit is below reliability limits and may need to be taken out of service.
details.internalDescription: The logical unit is below reliability limits and should not participate in a RAID-1.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This logical unit is no longer considered degraded.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The cause of the unit busies should be determined.It may be specific to one unit or array.Investigate the health of the BE array, BE fabric and VPLEX BE port to determine the source of the issue. Look for SCSI Firmware events 153 with status BUSY which will help determine if the problem is with a single unit, array, initiator or target.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The cause of busy on the backend should be investigated. Investigate the health of the BE array, BE fabric and VPLEX BE port to determine the source of the issue. Contact EMC Support if there are performance problems.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The array reported an unexpected serial number.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Before using this array, check the storage-arrays context to ensure that multiple entries do not have the same identifier, and that this array does not present multiple identifiers. If either of these conditions occur, do not use this array. The array name and version number should be reported to engineering so that array specific handling can be added. Continuing to use the array could lead to DU/DL conditions and unreliable array behavior.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Before using this array, check the storage-arrays context to ensure that multiple entries do not have the same identifier, and that this array does not present multiple identifiers. If either of these conditions occur, do not use this array. The array name and version number should be reported to EMC support. Continuing to use the array could lead to DU/DL conditions and unreliable array behavior.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: VPLEX received deferred error from the specified target which indicates exception condition occured on the target during processing of some previous command for which status was already returned. This can lead to DU/DL.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: VPLEX received deferred error from the specified target which indicates exception condition occured on the target during processing of some previous command for which status was already returned. This can lead to DU/DL.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Determine which BE array the target corresponds to, and then engage the BE array vendor's Customer Support to determine the cause of the deferred error and to correct the exception condition on the target. VPLEX will not receive any details of the command for which the deferred error had occured, hence BE array vendor will need to identify the deferred error that occured on the specified target. Provide time and target details to the BE array vendor for troubleshooting. Refer to the troubleshooting guide for more information on this deferred error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Determine which BE array the target corresponds to, and then engage the BE array vendor's Customer Support to determine the cause of the deferred error and to correct the exception condition on the target.

details.customerDescription: Received deferred error from a specific target for a previous command.
