eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The array reported lun count is above the per IT Nexus limit supported by VPLEX. Only the supported number of LUs will be processed and rest will be discarded.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The array reported lun count is above the per IT Nexus limit supported by VPLEX. Only the supported number of LUs will be processed and rest will be discarded.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Provision LUNs as per IT Nexus limit supported by VPLEX.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Provision LUNs as per IT Nexus limit supported by VPLEX.

details.customerDescription: A specific IT Nexus reported a specific number of LUs which is above VPLEX supported limit.
details.internalDescription: A specific IT Nexus reported a specific number of LUs which is above VPLEX supported limit.
details.formatString: IT nexus %s, reported %d LUs which is above the supported limit of %d. Processing the first %d and discarding the last %d LUs.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The array returned Check Condition 7/27h/07h SPACE ALLOCATION FAILED WRITE PROTECT for the reported thin-enabled storage-volume on a VPLEX write. This indicates the thin LUN on the BE array has run out of block resources and can't accept the write to the un-mapped region.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Space allocation has failed on the thin-enabled storage-volume. There are no more available storage blocks on the BE array to map to the address to which the host has issued a write command.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The customer needs to free up or add additional block resources on the BE array to increase the space available to the thin-enabled storage-volume. Once additional space is available host administrators can re-start the hosts that are suspended/stopped.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The host administrator can try reclaiming storage using the scsi UNMAP command from the host. If reclaimed storage is not sufficient, the storage administrator must add free block storage to the BE storage array to increase the space available to the thin-enabled storage-volume. Once additional space is available host administrators can re-start the hosts that are suspended/stopped.

details.customerDescription: The reported thin-enabled storage-volume has run out of space.
details.internalDescription: The reported thin-enabled storage-volume has run out of space.
details.formatString: Space allocation failed on scsi vol %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An array returned Unit Attention 6/38/07h THIN_PROVISIONING_SOFT_THRESHOLD_REACHED for a storage-volume on a VPLEX write. The thin pool on the array is running out of space.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An array returned Unit Attention 6/38/07h THIN_PROVISIONING_SOFT_THRESHOLD_REACHED for a storage-volume on a VPLEX write. The thin pool on the array is running out of space.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Add additional block resources to the thin pool on the array from which the storage-volume is provisioned.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Add additional block resources to the thin pool on the array from which the storage-volume is provisioned.

details.customerDescription: A storage volume reported a Thin Provisioning Soft Threshold Reached error on a VPLEX write.
details.internalDescription: A storage volume reported a Thin Provisioning Soft Threshold Reached error on a VPLEX write.
details.formatString: Thin Provisioning Soft Threshold reached - vol %s.
Failover initiated for logical unit %s on array %s to target controller %s as active.
Failover %s for logical unit %s on array %s to target controller %s as active. %s

details.internalDescription: This unit has reached a normal, healthy state.
details.formatString: Logical unit %s enters NOMINAL state.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A state of VULNERABLE means that at least one director is missing passive paths to this unit. REPAIRABLE_DEGRADED means that at least one director is missing active paths to the unit. DEGRADED means that at least one director is missing active paths and at least one director (not necessarliy the same director) is missing passive paths for a particular unit. UNREACHABLE means that no directors in the cluster have either active or passive paths to the unit.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the backend wiring and zoning on the system to ensure the logical is presented uniformly to all directors in a fully-redundant configuration from both directors of the active/passive storage array.

details.internalDescription: This event indicates that APFO has a sub-optimal state of connectivity to this logical unit on one or more directors.
details.formatString: Logical unit %s enters %s state.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This could be related to a switch reset or failure, a controller reset or failure, a cable failure, or a zoning problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Connections between the director, backend switch, and the storage array should be checked. Verify zoning on the backend switch includes the director and the reported controller in the same zone. Verify the controller and any backend switches are functional.

details.internalDescription: The reported controller is no longer reachable by the reporting director.
details.formatString: Controller %s isn't seen by director %x.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This could be related to a switch reset or failure, a controller reset or failure, a cable failure, or a zoning problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Connections between the directors, backend switches, and the storage array should be checked. Verify zoning on the backend switch includes the directors and the reported controller in the same zone. Verify the controller and any backend switches are functional.

details.internalDescription: The reported controller is no longer reachable by any director in the cluster.
details.formatString: Controller %s isn't seen by any directors.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A path must be available to target controller receiving failover for at least one of the units in the group being failed over. All directors are found unsuitable canditates based on the completeness of their path state. The code, at this point, has to drop the failover decision on the floor. This is likely indicative of severely degraded hardware and/or fabric condition. Restore connectivity to the array controllers for all directors.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This is likely indicative of severely degraded hardware and/or fabric condition. Restore connectivity to the array controllers for all directors.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: This is likely indicative of severely degraded hardware or fabric condition. Restore connectivity to the array controllers for all directors. Contact EMC Customer Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: This is likely indicative of severely degraded hardware or fabric condition. Restore connectivity to the array controllers for all directors. Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: A single director can't be selected to perform the failover of a group of luns.
details.internalDescription: A single director can't be selected to perform the failover of a group of luns.
details.formatString: No suitable executor could be found for failover decision on array %s to controller %s. The luns cannot be failed over.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Message from previous Master director is seen by joining node that has become new Master. Message is dropped, since this new node knows nothing of this action.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Message from previous Master director is seen by joining node that has become new Master. Message is dropped, since this new node knows nothing of this action.

details.customerDescription: Message has been dropped because this director is not involved in the decision.
details.internalDescription: Message has been dropped because this director is not involved in the decision.
details.formatString: Decision of type %d received from node %d is not executing on this director. Dropping message.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: In response to an administrator request, this director is commencing a shutdown.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: Director shutting down as requested
details.internalDescription: The operator has requested that this director be shut down. This message confirms that the shutdown process has started.
details.formatString: Director shutting down as requested

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: In response to an administrator request, or a HWH condition, this cluster is shutting down. This event will appear on all directors at the cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The user cannot stop the shutdown, but may have some control over a loss of power situation, and so can be ready for a quick reboot.

details.customerDescription: Cluster shutting down as requested
details.internalDescription: As a result of an operator request, or because of a HWH condition, this cluster has commenced shutdown.
details.formatString: Cluster shutting down as requested

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Shutdown of this director is complete. The director can safely be powered off without loss of data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The director is now ready for manual user action, such as powering off, physical removal, rebooting, etc.

details.customerDescription: Director shutdown complete
details.internalDescription: This director has completed its shutdown processing and can now be safely powered off (if it has not done so by itself). It can also be rebooted if that is desired.
details.formatString: Director shutdown complete

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director has completed its part of the shutdown of its cluster. It can be safely powered off without loss of data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: When all directors at the cluster have completed their shutdown, the entire cluster can be powered off, physically removed, disassembled, etc.

details.customerDescription: Director shutdown complete (cluster shutdown)
details.internalDescription: This director has completed its part of the shutdown of this cluster and can now safely be powered off. However, since the rest of this cluster is being shut down, the other directors should be checked to see if they have all fully shut down before rebooting any of the directors at the cluster.
details.formatString: Director shutdown complete (cluster shutdown)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director is attempting to shut down, but cannot get needed resources. It will continue retrying on a periodic basis. When it can start shutting down, event shdn/1 will be emitted. 1.11: this is a fatal error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: Cannot create thread for director shutdown - shutdown will be delayed
details.internalDescription: This director has been asked to shut down, but has encountered a lack of memory to create a thread to do so. It will retry periodically, and will emit an event when it starts its shutdown.
details.formatString: Cannot create thread for director shutdown - shutdown will be delayed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director is attempting to shut down as part of the shutdown of its cluster. However, it cannot allocate resources needed. It will continue retrying on a periodic basis. When it can start shutting down, event shdn/2 will be emitted. 1.11: this is a fatal error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: Cannot create thread for local cluster shutdown - shutdown will be delayed
details.internalDescription: This director needs to shut down as part of shutting down its cluster, but it has encountered a lack of memory. It will retry periodically, and will emit event shdn/2 when it starts its shutdown.
details.formatString: Cannot create thread for local cluster shutdown - shutdown will be delayed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director has been told about the shutdown of the specified cluster, and is trying to ensure that it is not exporting data from that cluster to its connected hosts. However, it cannot allocate the needed resources. It will continue retrying on a periodic basis. 1.11: this is a fatal error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: Cannot create thread for cluster %u shutdown - shutdown will be delayed
details.internalDescription: This director, like all directors, needs to participate in the shutdown of a remote cluster. However, due to a lack of memory, the participation can't be started. This director will retry periodically.
details.formatString: Cannot create thread for cluster %u shutdown - shutdown will be delayed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A director shutdown was requested (either by the admin or because of a low power signal), but only one director is left at this cluster. So, the shutdown has turned into a cluster shutdown.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: Only one director left at cluster - director shutdown becomes cluster shutdown
details.internalDescription: If the last director at a cluster has been requested to shut down, this is effectively a cluster shutdown. So, the internal details of the shutdown have been changed to be that of a cluster shutdown.
details.formatString: Only one director left at cluster - director shutdown becomes cluster shutdown

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event, and the abort, happens when this director receives shdn component state from another director at this cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: My cluster is shutting down - shutting down this director immediately
details.internalDescription: The local cluster is currently shutting down, but a new director is just booting at this cluster. There is no useful work the new director can do, and it might hinder the shutdown. So, it immediately aborts instead.
details.formatString: My cluster is shutting down - shutting down this director immediately

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event happens when a test version of the system and a special test command is used for testing site shutdown.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: My cluster is shutting down - shutting down this director immediately
details.internalDescription: Someone has issued a command to cause [testpoint] to sleep. This is normally done for a testpoint in the site shutdown barrier. This means that a site is shutting down and this director is sleeping during a barrier. This is used for automated integration testing, to force a certain event to happen at a critical time and confirm that it is handled properly.
details.formatString: Sleeping at testpoint \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A high volume of "Abort Task" messages generally indicate extremely slow or stuck I/O processing (check "cch ops"). Hosts will escalate to "Logical Unit Reset" and "Target Reset" TMFs if they remain unhappy. The status field contains internal SCSI Target and cache status flags for any aborted task.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check I/O processing statistics.

details.arguments: tmf transport initiatorPortName initiatorPortWWN targetPortName targetPortWWN lun qtag volumeName taskElapsedTime dormantQCnt enabledQCnt status
details.customerDescription: Scsi Task Management Function has been performed on the specified ITLQ nexus.
details.internalDescription: Task Management Functions (TMFs) are part of error and recovery processing by initiators. In large numbers, they are indicative of high latency I/O processing.
details.formatString: Scsi Tmf [%s] on %s ITLQ: [%s (0x%"FS64x") %s (0x%"FS64x") 0x%"FS64x" 0x%"FS64x"] vol %s taskElapsedTime(usec) %"FS64u" dormantQCnt %d enabledQCnt %d status %016"FS64x":%016"FS64x"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: More info about current logins is available via provider commands. For qlc, try "qlc show login" or "qlc pdb".
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check fabric zoning and storage-view configurations.

details.customerDescription: Unregistered initiator port established %s IT nexus [%s %s]
details.internalDescription: In SCSI, a nexus represents a connection, or login. Best practises state that initiators should be zoned only to see those target ports through which they have access to storage.
details.formatString: Unregistered initiator port established %s IT nexus [%s %s]

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Failing to handle incoming TMFs, especially Abort Task TMFs, can lead to data corruption.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.arguments: tmf protocol initiatorPortName initiatorPortWWN targetPortName targetPortWWN LUN scsiServiceResponse
details.customerDescription: Malformed Tmf %s on ITL %s: [%s (%s) %s (%s) 0x%"FS64x"] summarily rejected (srr %d)
details.internalDescription: A SCSI Task Management Function (TMF) has been rejected because it was malformed by the initiator.
details.formatString: Malformed Tmf %s on ITL %s: [%s (%s) %s (%s) 0x%"FS64x"] summarily rejected (srr %d)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Failing to handle incoming TMFs, especially Abort Task TMFs, can lead to data corruption (iproj:773). This situation can occur legitimately as a race condition, but it is rare. If this event is generated frequently, it suggests a bug in the formation of the StdfNexus that is used to search for the matching task to abort.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If these events occur with regularity, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Abort Task Tmf unable to find tag 0x%llx
details.internalDescription: A SCSI Task Management Function (TMF) has been processed for which no active task on the nexus could be found.
details.formatString: Abort Task Tmf unable to find tag 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This log message is generated whenever an FCP initiator port establishes a connection to a target port.

details.customerDescription: An initiator port has established an FCP connection with a target port.
details.internalDescription: An initiator port has established an FCP connection with a target port.
details.formatString: FCP connection established. IT: [%s (0x%"FS64x") %s (0x%"FS64x")]

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This log message is generated whenever a FCP initiator port's connection to a target port is lost, due to logout or departure from the fabric.

details.customerDescription: A target port has lost its FCP or iSCSI connection with an initiator port.
details.internalDescription: A target port has lost its FCP or iSCSI connection with an initiator port.
details.formatString: %s connection lost. IT: [%s (%s) %s (%s)]

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An enabled FE port has gone down as a result of FC cable pull, switch reboot or disabling switch port.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An FE port link has been lost.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check that the FC cable is properly plugged in to FE port, the switch is operational and the corresponding switch port is enabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check that the FC cable is properly plugged in to FE port, the switch is operational and the corresponding switch port is enabled.

details.customerDescription: Unexpected FE port link down.
details.internalDescription: An enabled FE port link went down.
details.formatString: Unexpected link down for port %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: During the I/O transfer phase of NDU, the 2nd upgraders were not killed before the 'ndu2 shutdown' timer expired. It is possible that both 1st and 2nd upgrader front-ends were enabled at the same time for a brief period. Data corruption may have occurred.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: NDU failed to terminate the 2nd upgrader directors quickly enough during the I/O transfer. Data corruption may have occurred.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: After NDU has completed, check exported volumes for data consistency.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: After NDU has completed, check exported volumes for data consistency.

details.customerDescription: NDU failed to terminate the 2nd upgrader directors quickly enough during the I/O transfer. Data corruption may have occurred.
details.internalDescription: NDU failed to terminate the 2nd upgrader directors quickly enough during the I/O transfer. Data corruption may have occurred.
details.formatString: NDU shutdown timer expired. Resuming all LUs.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Scsi Compare and Write Processing is disabled on the VPLEX.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Scsi Compare and Write Processing is disabled on the VPLEX.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Use the CLI command "set /clusters/*/storage-views/*::caw_enabled true" to enable it.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Use the CLI command "set /clusters/*/storage-views/*::caw_enabled true" to enable it.

details.customerDescription: Scsi Compare and Write Processing is disabled on the VPLEX.
details.internalDescription: Scsi Compare and Write Processing is disabled on the VPLEX.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The host application or OS requested an invalid transfer size on a Scsi Compare and Write Command.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: This is a host side issue. Investigate why the host application or OS is not respecting the maximum transfer size advertised by the VPLEX. Consult the Troubleshooting Entry in the VAAI section of the Generator for this event
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: This is a host side issue. Investigate why the host application or OS is not respecting the maximum transfer size advertised by the VPLEX. Consult the Troubleshooting Entry in the VAAI section of the Generator for this event If problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.internalDescription: The host application or OS requested an invalid transfer size on a Scsi Compare and Write Command.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The host application or OS specified an out of range Logical Block Address on a Scsi Compare and Write Command.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The host application or OS specified an out of range Logical Block Address on a Scsi Compare and Write Command.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: This is a host side issue. Investigate why the host application or OS is not respecting the maximum size of the volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: This is a host side issue. Investigate why the host application or OS is not respecting the maximum size of the volume. If problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The host application or OS specified an out of range Logical Block Address on a Scsi Compare and Write Command.
details.internalDescription: The host application or OS specified an out of range Logical Block Address on a Scsi Compare and Write Command.
details.formatString: Compare and Write LBA 0x% above maximum 0x%".

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The VPLEX director had insufficient memory resources to process the Scsi Compare and Write Command.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The VPLEX director had insufficient memory resources to process the Scsi Compare and Write Command.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Investigate the reason for the low memory issue.

details.customerDescription: The VPLEX director had insufficient memory resources to process the Scsi Compare and Write Command.
details.internalDescription: The VPLEX director had insufficient memory resources to process the Scsi Compare and Write Command.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The attempt to start a cache transaction for a Scsi Compare and Write command failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The attempt to start a cache transaction for a Scsi Compare and Write command failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Investigate the health of the VPLEX directors, especially the cache sub-system. Examine logs for signs of unusual behavior.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The processing of a Scsi Compare and Write command could not complete.
details.internalDescription: The attempt to start a cache transaction for a Scsi Compare and Write command failed.
details.formatString: Compare and Write cache transaction submit failed, status %d".

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The host requested an invalid transfer size on a Scsi Write Same Command.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Investigate why the host is not respecting the maximum transfer size advertised by the VPLEX.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Investigate why the host is not respecting the maximum transfer size advertised by the VPLEX. If problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.arguments: block_count_requested maximum_block_count_supported protocol initiatorPortWWN targetPortWWN LUN luId

details.internalDescription: The host requested an invalid transfer size on a Scsi Write Same Command.
details.formatString: WriteSame block count 0x%x is above maximum of 0x%x, ITL %s: (%s)(%s)(0x%016"FS64x", %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The host specified an out of range Logical Block Address on a Scsi Write Same Command.

details.internalDescription: The host specified an out of range Logical Block Address on a Scsi Write Same Command.
details.formatString: WriteSame end LBA 0x%"FS64x" above maximum 0x%"FS64x", ITL %s: (%s)(%s)(0x%016"FS64x", %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The VPLEX director had insufficient memory resources to process the Scsi Write Same Command.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The VPLEX director had insufficient memory resources to process the Scsi Write Same Command.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Investigate the reason for the low memory issue. Analyze the performance monitors for high CPU Utilization on the director and FE load distribution among the directors.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: The VPLEX director had insufficient memory resources to process the Scsi Write Same Command.
details.internalDescription: The VPLEX director had insufficient memory resources to process the Scsi Write Same Command.
details.formatString: WriteSame insufficient resources, ITL %s: (%s)(%s)(0x%016"FS64x", %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The attempt to start a cache transaction for a Scsi Write Same command failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The attempt to start a cache transaction for a Scsi Write Same command failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Investigate why the attempt to start a cache transaction for a Scsi Write Same command failed. Consult the Troubleshooting Entry in the VAAI section of the Generator for this event. Escalate to VPLEX Engineering if this does not resolve.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Consult the Troubleshooting Entry in the VAAI section of the Generator for this event. If it does not resolve, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.arguments: Failure_status_code protocol initiatorPortWWN targetPortWWN LUN luId

details.internalDescription: The attempt to start a cache transaction for a Scsi Write Same command failed.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Scsi Write Same command processing is disabled on VPLEX. ESX servers using Scsi Write Same for VM operations may have degraded performance.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Scsi Write Same command processing is disabled on VPLEX. This can cause performance degradation.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Discuss the performance implications of disabling write-same-16 with the customer. Use the CLI command "set /clusters/*/storage-views/*::write-same-16-enabled true" to enable it. To ensure that the default write same template is enabled by default in the future, use the VPlexcli command 'll /clusters/*' command to verify if the write same template is set to 'true'. If it is not set to true, set it to true with the VPlexcli command 'set /clusters/*::default-write-same-16-template true'
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Use the CLI command "set /clusters/*/storage-views/*::write-same-16-enabled true" to enable it.

details.customerDescription: Scsi Write Same command processing is disabled on VPLEX.
details.internalDescription: Scsi Write Same command processing is disabled on VPLEX.
details.formatString: Write Same 16 is disabled, ITL %s: (%s)(%s)(0x%016"FS64x", %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Task Management Functions (TMFs) are part of error and recovery processing by host initiators. When I/O processing is extremenly slow or stuck, the host would resort to "Logical Unit Reset" and "Target Reset" TMFs if they remain unhappy. Regardless of what is causing the host to issue Target Reset, the effect of these resets if in large number will have a performance impact on other, possibly all, hosts.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Host initiator has issued target reset due to slow I/O processing.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check I/O processing statistics. Identify the reason for the host to issue Target Reset and resolve it. If the problem is with the host, resolve it by unzoning from the fabric.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check I/O processing statistics. Identify the reason for the host to issue Target Reset and resolve it. If the problem is with the host, unzone the initiator in question from the fabric to prevent potential performance impact to other hosts until the issue can be resolved. Contact EMC Support if problem persists.

details.arguments: tmf transport initiatorPortName initiatorPortWWN targetPortName targetPortWWN
details.customerDescription: Scsi Target Reset TMF has been performed on the specified IT nexus.
details.internalDescription: Scsi Target Reset TMF has been performed on the specified IT nexus.
details.formatString: Scsi Tmf [%s] on %s IT: [%s (0x%"FS64x") %s (0x%"FS64x")]

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Multiple active iSCSI logins detected from the same initiator.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Multiple active iSCSI logins detected from the same initiator.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Likely transient condition possible during session recovery. No specific action necessary.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Likely transient condition possible during session recovery. No specific action necessary.

details.customerDescription: Multiple active iSCSI logins detected from the same initiator.
details.internalDescription: Multiple active iSCSI logins detected from the same initiator.
details.formatString: iSCSI connection overlap. IT: [(%s %s) (%s %s)]

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is a generic one. It contains the variable data and format from a tower abort (internal firmware error).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal software error has occurred, which may be triggered by unexpected changes in the cluster's environment or configuration.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The affected director is being reset. If normal operation is not restored, contact EMC Customer Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The affected director is being reset. If normal operation is not restored, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: A director is resetting due to an internal software failure.
details.internalDescription: The affected director is being reset. Normal operation should be reestablished within minutes.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This log message is produced when the user enters the "log" command on the console with a non-numeric first argument. The entire tail of the command line is the text of the log message.

details.customerDescription: This is the log message.
details.formatString: This is the log message.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This log message is produced when the user's privilege level has been changed from [CmdPrivLevel] to [level] using the essyou command.

details.customerDescription: Privilege level changed from %lu to %lu
details.formatString: Privilege level changed from %lu to %lu

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This looks like just a demonstration of logging. [Should this even be in here?]

details.customerDescription: This is via dbg_event
details.formatString: This is via dbg_event

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The date has been set manually by the user.

details.customerDescription: Date manually set.
details.formatString: Date manually set.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The board shutdown process has been started. This occurs when the "shutdown" command is issued. This command is issued when the administrator wishes to cleanly shut down the director, typically when the director is to be powered off, or restarted. Note that the shutdown command affects the single director only. Note: This message is not displayed in SMS because SMS generates its own message when shut down is started.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Wait for the "Shutdown completed" message.

details.customerDescription: Shutdown started.
details.internalDescription: The shutdown command was issued.
details.formatString: Shutdown started.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The board shutdown process has completed. The director can now be powered off or restarted without starting full recovery activity.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Perform required maintenance, then restart the director/system.

details.customerDescription: Shutdown completed.
details.internalDescription: The director finished its shutdown process. It can now be serviced.
details.formatString: Shutdown completed.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is issued by the event code when a caller tried to generate an event that does not fit within the system buffers. This event is sent out instead, which identifies the level, component and event id of the too-long event.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the level is higher than INFO, examine surrounding messages in the system log. Contact EMC Customer Support if assistance is required.

details.customerDescription: log message too long - lvl %u cmp '%s' id %u
details.internalDescription: A log message received from the director was too long. The message contents were lost.
details.formatString: log message too long - lvl %u cmp '%s' id %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is for information purposes only.

details.customerDescription: sw-version: %s
details.formatString: sw-version: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is for information purposes only.

details.customerDescription: sw-info: %s
details.formatString: sw-info: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is for information purposes only.

details.customerDescription: sw-build: %s
details.formatString: sw-build: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The 'trace autostop' setting was enabled, and the trace buffer has now filled, causing the trace to stop.

details.customerDescription: Trace has been automatically stopped with a full buffer.
details.formatString: Trace has been automatically stopped with a full buffer.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director has been terminated as expected (e.g. after vaulting has completed).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This director has been terminated as expected (e.g. after vaulting has completed).
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The director will be restarted as part of the normal recovery procedure.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The director will be restarted as part of the normal recovery procedure.

details.customerDescription: A director has been terminated as expected.
details.internalDescription: A director has been terminated as expected.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event indicates that a command could not be run because there are already three instances of that same command running.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: There are already three instances of the given management command currently running, and more than three are not allowed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if the condition clears within a few minutes. If not, then escalate the issue to VPLEX Engineering.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: While executing a command the director encountered an internal resource error.
details.internalDescription: Too many running instances of command.
details.formatString: Too many running instances of command \"%s\".

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Vdp could not create a timer to do the check discussed in vdp/13. Thus, there will be no event if the indicated virtual volume does not become I/O-able in a minute.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: could not create timer to check status of pre-attached virtual volume [0x%016llx.%lu]
details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: could not create timer to check status of pre-attached virtual volume [0x%016llx.%lu]

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If a request to enable I/O for a virtual volume happens before the back end has discovered any of the storage volumes involved in the virtual volume, then the back end does not yet even know about the device and virtual volume. It is possible that it never will. So, the Vdp code starts a one minute timer when such a request comes in. If the virtual volume is not I/O-able after a minute, the Vdp will issue this warning. The status will usually be "media not present". There is no way to convert "volumeName" to a device name. After the device is finally discovered (if it ever is), "vdp l" will show the name and the id. Saved console logs or GUI sessions may show old versions of the id to name mapping.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Wait for the system to complete initialization. Verify all expected storage volumes have been discovered and all devices are available as displayed in the Device Configuration screen.

details.customerDescription: volume %s is still '%s'
details.internalDescription: The storage volumes that comprise the device set containing the reported virtual volume have not been discovered yet. The system will retry after discovering the storage volumes.
details.formatString: volume %s is still '%s'

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A simple allocation request has failed. The director is essentially completely out of memory and is unlikely to be working well.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Reduce the load on the director that encountered the problem.

details.customerDescription: no memory to attach %s
details.internalDescription: An internal component could not allocate a small amount of memory when attaching a virtual volume for client export. I/O on that virtual volume will not be possible. If this happens, the system will likely be having other more serious problems as well.
details.formatString: no memory to attach %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event comes out when the suspend count for a Vdp attachment goes from 1 to 0.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: Resuming I
details.internalDescription: Volumes are suspended for various reasons, such as the loss of an intercluster link. "Losing" virtual volumes are not automatically resumed after they are again available for I/O. This event is issued when all conditions, internal or manual, that were blocking I/O are released.
details.formatString: Resuming I

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The virtual volume is being attached in the Vdp when it is already suspended. "vdp pst [volumeName]" will show its suspend/resume history. This event should be very rare. It happens if we're just now exporting the virtual volume for the first time, minutes or even days after this cluster was declared the loser after a link outage. It's difficult for SW to detect this case, and automatically clear the lsrSusp flag. It will usually be cleared by the operator doing "amf losersresume *".
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the virtual volume status. If it is awaiting a manual resume ("amf list detailed" shows "lsrSusp T"), then use the "amf losersresume" command to unsuspend I/O on that virtual volume, when any host applications using it are ready for the data change.

details.customerDescription: Volume %s attached suspended
details.internalDescription: The virtual volume has just been attached, likely because it is now exported to hosts. However, it is not yet ready for I/O. This may be for a brief internal reason, or because an "amf losersresume" is needed to allow I/O on it after its data has changed.
details.formatString: Volume %s attached suspended

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A logging volume is normally created when the system or cluster is first installed. Check with your system installer or contact EMC Customer Support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: Attaching to virtual volume %s, for which logging is not fully set up.
details.internalDescription: The system has been configured to export a virtual volume. The underlying device is not fully protected for logging changed data when a mirror is not accessible. Any write to the virtual volume while the mirror is not accessible can result in the device being marked fully out of date. Full rebuilds begin on unprotected devices when access to the mirror is restored. A mirror is inaccessible during a link outage or if access to storage devices is lost.
details.formatString: Attaching to virtual volume %s, for which logging is not fully set up.

details.customerDescription: Cannot create zero
details.internalDescription: Could not allocate enough memory to create a page full of zeros to use when faking I/O to the indicated virtual volume. I/O will be real.
details.formatString: Cannot create zero

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A persisted record for a consistency group had a format unrecognized by the system. The record is thus being ignored.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A persisted record for a consistency group had a format unrecognized by the system. The record is thus being ignored.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check for any missing consistency groups, and reconstruct these as required. This could be indicative of corrupted meta-data, or a system which had it's GeoSynchrony version downgraded, which is not supported in customer environments. Contact VPLEX Engineering to resolve.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check for any missing consistency groups, and reconstruct these as required. Contact EMC Customer Support for assistance.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The cluster witness has triggered a detach on the given volume set, and detached the specified cluster. If all missing clusters have been detached, then I/O can resume at the remaining clusters.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The cluster witness has triggered a detach on the given volume set, and detached the specified cluster. If all missing clusters have been detached, then I/O can resume at the remaining clusters.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: No action is required.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: No action is required.

details.customerDescription: Cluster [clusterId] detached with respect to volume set "[setName]" from cluster witness triggered detach.
details.internalDescription: Cluster [clusterId] detached with respect to volume set "[setName]" from cluster witness triggered detach.
details.formatString: Site %u detached with respect to volume set "%s" from cluster witness triggered detach.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: All volumes in the volume set have been manually suspended via the "vmg suspend" command.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: All volumes in the volume set have been manually suspended.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Issue the "vmg resume" command to unsuspend the volumes in the volume set.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Issue the "vmg resume" command to unsuspend the volumes in the volume set.

details.customerDescription: Manually suspended all volumes associated with a volume set.
details.internalDescription: Manually suspended all volumes associated with a volume set.
details.formatString: Manually suspended all volumes associated with volume set "%s".

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: All volumes in the volume set were previously manually suspended, and have now been resumed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: All volumes in the volume set were previously manually suspended, and have now been resumed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: No action is required.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: No action is required.

details.customerDescription: Resumed all volumes associated with a manually suspended volume set.
details.internalDescription: Resumed all volumes associated with a manually suspended volume set.
details.formatString: Resumed all volumes associated with volume set "%s" after manual suspension.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: All volumes in the volume set have been made not-ready via the "vmg setNotReady" command.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: All volumes in the volume set have been made not-ready.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: No action is required.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: No action is required.

details.customerDescription: All volumes associated with a volume set have been made not-ready due to a command trigger.
details.internalDescription: All volumes associated with a volume set have been made not-ready due to a command trigger.
details.formatString: All volumes associated with volume set "%s" have been made not-ready.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: All volumes in the volume set have been cleared of not-ready state via the "vmg clearNotReady" command.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: All volumes in the volume set have been cleared of not-ready state.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: No action is required.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: No action is required.

details.customerDescription: All volumes associated with a volume set have been cleared of not-ready state due to a command trigger.
details.internalDescription: All volumes associated with a volume set have been cleared of not-ready state due to a command trigger.
details.formatString: Volumes associated with the volume set "%s" have been cleared of NotReady state.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the suspended I/O is due to a failure in the network link, and I/O must be reinstated before the link is restored, then one or more non-communicating clusters must be detached for each virtual volume in the WOF group to allow the remaining clusters access to distributed storage.

details.customerDescription: Suspending I
details.internalDescription: Multi-cluster activities, e.g. loss of a link, and director failures require that all I/O be suspended to the indicated WOF group.
details.formatString: Suspending I

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: All delta catch-ups, etc., have completed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Verify hosts have recognized the storage is again accessible.

details.customerDescription: Resuming I
details.internalDescription: Synchronization of system data is complete. The reported WOF group is once again available for I/O.
details.formatString: Resuming I

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the performance implications of this value are important, correct the configuration and restart the tower. Contact EMC Customer Support if you are not aware of setting this parameter.

details.customerDescription: wofPagelets kw expected unsigned int, got %s
details.internalDescription: When the director is started up, it can be passed a series of parameters to alter its default behaviour. The value for one of those, "wofPagelets", was not in the expected numeric format.
details.formatString: wofPagelets kw expected unsigned int, got %s

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the performance implications of this value are important, correct the configuration and restart the tower. Contact EMC Customer Support if you are not aware of setting this parameter.

details.customerDescription: wofPagelets kw cannot be 0
details.internalDescription: When the director is started up, it can be passed a series of parameters to alter its default behaviour. The value for one of those, "wofPagelets", was 0, which is unsupported.
details.formatString: wofPagelets kw cannot be 0

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Crash consistency has been lost on the given async consistency group, due to unplanned loss of data, or inability to write a crash-consistent image.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Crash consistency has been lost on the given async consistency group, due to unplanned loss of data, or inability to write a crash-consistent image.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Choose a cluster to be used for rebuilding the data image at the other cluster(s), with the 'wof resolveFailure' command.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Choose a cluster to be used for rebuilding the data image at the other cluster(s), with the 'consistency-group resume-after-data-loss-failure' command.

details.customerDescription: Failure causing loss of crash consistency detected on async consistency group.
details.internalDescription: I/O suspended due to loss of crash consistency.
details.formatString: One or more failures causing crash consistency loss detected on async consistency group %s.

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u chosen to be the winner on WOF group %s after a data-loss failure.
details.internalDescription: The specified cluster has been chosen to contain the desired data image after a failure causing data loss occurred in the system. Mirrors of all distributed deviceS in the WOF group will be fully rebuilt in order to bring the storage back in sync.
details.formatString: Cluster %u chosen to be the winner on WOF group %s after a data-loss failure.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Restart applications, as required.

details.customerDescription: Discarded uncommitted deltas on WOF group %s.
details.internalDescription: An event (cluster detach or director failure) has caused the system to discard all WOF data from the given WOF group not already committed to storage volume.
details.formatString: Discarded uncommitted deltas on WOF group %s.

details.customerDescription: Added virtual volume %s to WOF group %s.
details.internalDescription: The given virtual volume has been added to the given WOF group.
details.formatString: Added virtual volume %s to WOF group %s.

details.customerDescription: Volume %s scheduled for removal from WOF group %s, when the pipeline has been flushed.
details.internalDescription: The admin has requested that the specified virtual volume be removed from the specified WOF group. This will be done once the WOF pipeline has been flushed.
details.formatString: Volume %s scheduled for removal from WOF group %s, when the pipeline has been flushed.

details.customerDescription: Created WOF group %s.
details.internalDescription: A WOF group with the given name has been added to the system.
details.formatString: Created WOF group %s.

details.customerDescription: Destroyed WOF group %s.
details.internalDescription: A WOF group with the given name has been removed from the system.
details.formatString: Destroyed WOF group %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If access to the reported virtual volume at the repoted cluster is required, remove that virtual volume from the WOF group and I/O will be allowed to proceed.

details.customerDescription: Suspending WOF virtual volume %s exported to hosts at bystander cluster %u.
details.internalDescription: In the current release of WOF functionality, host access to WOF protected virtual volumes is allowed only at clusters that have a mirror of the device set containing that virtual volume. An export at a cluster without a mirror was attempted. I/O to that virtual volume is suspended at that cluster.
details.formatString: Suspending WOF virtual volume %s exported to hosts at bystander cluster %u.

details.customerDescription: Resuming I
details.internalDescription: The reported virtual volume had been remotely exported but was under WOF protection. That type of export is invalid in the current release and that I/O had been suspended. Either that virtual volume was removed from the WOF group or the user has unexported it at the remote cluster.
details.formatString: Resuming I

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u switching to active mode on WOF group %s after being passive for %u deltas.
details.internalDescription: The specified cluster, having not contributed any I/O towards recent WOF deltas on the given WOF group, has now resumed I/O to that group. If the link were to go down, and that cluster were to be detached, data would have to be discarded on the winning cluster in order to maintain write order consistency.
details.formatString: Cluster %u switching to active mode on WOF group %s after being passive for %u deltas.

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u has been passive for %u deltas on WOF group %s - switching to passive mode.
details.internalDescription: The specified cluster, having not contributed any I/O towards recent WOF deltas on the given group, is now being marked as passive. If the link were to go down, and that cluster were to be detached, data would not have to be discarded on the winning cluster in order to maintain write order consistency.
details.formatString: Cluster %u has been passive for %u deltas on WOF group %s - switching to passive mode.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Issue 'wof datachangeresume'.

details.customerDescription: Data image has changed on WOF group %s. Detached losing cluster(s)
details.internalDescription: The exported data image of the given wof group at the cluster that emitted this event has been changed. The reason for the change in data is that we discarded the WOF pipeline (ie. an active cluster was detached or failed and rebooted). The WOF group was not configured to resume I/O automatically in this situation.
details.formatString: Data image has changed on WOF group %s. Detached losing cluster(s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The given cluster has a newer version of the given WOF group than the local cluster does. This can happen, for instance, if a new cluster joins the system or if a cluster fails before it can persist a change to an existing WOF group. The newer version of the WOF group has now been accepted by the local cluster, and operation will continue as normal.

details.customerDescription: Updating to version %llu of WOF group %s, as sent by cluster %u.
details.formatString: Updating to version %llu of WOF group %s, as sent by cluster %u.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The WOF exchange protocol encountered an unexpected error. Hopefully the system has recovered from this event, but if it hasn't, then the presence of this event may help us figure out what went wrong.

details.customerDescription: WOF rdma failed on group %s with unexpected error 0x%x.
details.formatString: WOF rdma failed on group %s with unexpected error 0x%x.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The exchange phase of the given WOF group on the local director was interrupted by an nmg group change and needed either to be restarted or abandoned. The specified number of pagelets had already been pulled, from the specified target pagelet count.

details.customerDescription: Exchange phase on WOF group %s interrupted after pulling %u of %u pagelets.
details.formatString: Exchange phase on WOF group %s interrupted after pulling %u of %u pagelets.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The exchange phase of the given WOF group on the local director was interrupted by an nmg group change and needed either to be restarted or abandoned. The local director had not yet received the exchange token, and therefore had not started pulling any pages.

details.customerDescription: Exchange phase on WOF group %s interrupted before beginning to pull any pages.
details.formatString: Exchange phase on WOF group %s interrupted before beginning to pull any pages.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Address, if possible, the reason for which wthru was requested on the specified WOF group.

details.customerDescription: Avoiding wthru for yve-based WOF group \"%s\".
details.internalDescription: In the current release, WOF groups built from YVE pools do not support going into wthru. In the event that such a group is requested to go into wthru, the request will be ignored.
details.formatString: Avoiding wthru for yve-based WOF group \"%s\".

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Correct the configuration and restart the tower.

details.customerDescription: wofMaxRemoteBlades kw expected unsigned int, got %s
details.internalDescription: When the director is started up, it can be passed a series of parameters to alter its default behaviour. The value for one of those, "wofMaxRemoteBlades", was not in the expected numeric format.
details.formatString: wofMaxRemoteBlades kw expected unsigned int, got %s

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Correct the configuration and restart the tower.

details.customerDescription: wofMaxRemoteBlades kw must be at least 1 and no greater than %d
details.internalDescription: When the director is started up, it can be passed a series of parameters to alter its default behaviour. The value for one of those, "wofMaxRemoteBlades", was less than 1 or greater than 16, which is unsupported.
details.formatString: wofMaxRemoteBlades kw must be at least 1 and no greater than %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Active detach has been enabled on the given consistency group, and the given cluster has departed. Choosing active-detach implies that only one-side should have been writing to this volume at a time. At the time of the link outage this was not the case, and we cannot automatically choose a winner.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The "active-cluster-wins" rule-set has been set on the given consistency group, and the given cluster has departed. For "active-cluster-wins" rule-set it is recommended that only one cluster is writing to the volumes in the consistency group at a time. At the time of the cluster departure this was not the case, and a winner cannot automatically be chosen. Choosing a winner, will allow the winning cluster to resume, but implies data loss to maintain crash-consistency.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: To resume I/Os to volumes in the consistency group, user can take one of the following actions based on the event that caused the departure. 1. If the cluster departure was due to inter-cluster link failure: A. and the customer cannot accept a data loss, wait for the link to restore. or B. and the customer can accept a data loss but not a prolonged data unavailability, issue 'consistency-group choose-winner' and 'consistency-group resume-after-rollback' command as required to let the desired cluster(s) resume I/O. 2. If the cluster departure was caused due to a cluster failure there has been dataloss, in which case a rollback is required and I/Os to the consistency group can be resumed by: A. issuing 'consistency-group choose-winner' and 'consistency-group resume-after-rollback' while the failed cluster has not recovered. or B. waiting to recover the failed cluster and then issuing 'consistency-group resume-after-rollback'.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: To resume I/Os to volumes in the consistency group, user can take one of the following actions based on the event that caused the departure. 1. If the cluster departure was due to inter-cluster link failure: A. and the customer cannot accept a data loss, wait for the link to restore. or B. and the customer can accept a data loss but not a prolonged data unavailability, issue 'consistency-group choose-winner' and 'consistency-group resume-after-rollback' command as required to let the desired cluster(s) resume I/O. 2. If the cluster departure was caused due to a cluster failure there has been dataloss, in which case a rollback is required and I/Os to the consistency group can be resumed by: A. issuing 'consistency-group choose-winner' and 'consistency-group resume-after-rollback' while the failed cluster has not recovered. or B. waiting to recover the failed cluster and then issuing 'consistency-group resume-after-rollback'. Contact EMC Customer Support for details on cluster-detaching commands and the potential consequences of choosing a winner in this situation.

details.customerDescription: Consistency group active detach blocked after cluster departure.
details.internalDescription: Consistency group active detach blocked after cluster departure.
details.formatString: Active detach cannot take effect on wof group %s after departure of cluster %u, manual intervention required to resume I/O

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is a little awkward at this time but a better solution to this issue needs to wait until the virtual volume manager component comes into existence.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Issue 'amf losersresume'.

details.customerDescription: Data image has changed on WOF group %s. Catching up to the winning cluster(s)
details.internalDescription: The exported data image of the given wof group at the cluster that emitted this event has been changed. The reason for the change in data is because the cluster was detached and has now come back in contact with the winning clusters. The WOF group was not configured to resume I/O automatically in this situation.
details.formatString: Data image has changed on WOF group %s. Catching up to the winning cluster(s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The env_write call returned something other than the length it was asked to write. Flash may be full or damaged.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Validation of the written length of the director UUID in the system flash failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Shut down the director as quickly as possible, and keep it down until the upgrade sequence is succeeds or fails.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Shut down the director as quickly as possible, and keep it down until the upgrade sequence is succeeds or fails. Report this issue to EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Validation of the length of a director ID failed - write corrupted UUID list.
details.internalDescription: The firmware was unable to write the list of first-upgrader directors to non-volatile memory. Non-volatile memory may now contain an invalid list of first-upgrader directors.
details.formatString: bad write (len %d not %u) of uuid list

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required.

details.internalDescription: "ndu mark" has completed successfully on this director.
details.formatString: ndu mark success

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required.

details.customerDescription: ndu release success
details.internalDescription: "ndu release" has completed successfully on this director.
details.formatString: ndu release success

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required.

details.internalDescription: "ndu drain" has completed successfully on this director.
details.formatString: ndu drain success

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: See Developer-Info entry for "ndu drain failure".
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: See user-action entry for "ndu drain failure".

details.customerDescription: ndu drain failing: timeout
details.internalDescription: "ndu drain" did not complete due to timeout on one or more last-upgrader directors.
details.formatString: ndu drain failing: timeout

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: See Developer-Info entry for "ndu drain failure".
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: See user-action entry for "ndu drain failure".

details.customerDescription: ndu drain failing: %s
details.internalDescription: "ndu drain" did not complete due to a configuration change observed on one or more last-upgrader directors.
details.formatString: ndu drain failing: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: See developer-info entry for "ndu drain failure".
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: See user-action entry for "ndu drain failure".

details.customerDescription: ndu drain failing: amf-header write
details.internalDescription: "ndu drain" did not complete due to a configuration change observed on one or more last-upgrader directors.
details.formatString: ndu drain failing: amf-header write

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: See Developer-Info entry for "ndu drain failure".
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: See user-action entry for "ndu drain failure".

details.customerDescription: ndu drain failing: nvol write
details.internalDescription: "ndu drain" did not complete due to a configuration change observed on one or more last-upgrader directors.
details.formatString: ndu drain failing: nvol write

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The drain attempt fails if one or more directors timeout or observe a metadata change in the form of either an amf-header write, an nvol write, or a persistent-state change. If the reason for failure is a timeout then using a larger timeout value can increase the likelihood of a subsequent drain-attempt succeeding.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The drain attempt has failed on one or more last-upgrader directors. An undrain is automatically issued on all last-upgrader directors. The drain may be attempted again. However, prior to attempting another drain, all first-upgrader directors must be re-booted if any of them were booted-up prior to the most recent drain attempt.

details.customerDescription: ndu drain failure
details.internalDescription: "ndu drain" has failed to complete successfully on one or more last-upgrader directors. "ndu drain" may be retried if desired. Prior to retrying "ndu drain" a reboot of all first-upgrader directors is necessary if any of the first-upgrader directors were booted-up prior to the most recent "ndu drain".
details.formatString: ndu drain failure

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required.

details.customerDescription: ndu kill success
details.internalDescription: "ndu kill" has completed successfully on this director.
details.formatString: ndu kill success

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required.

details.customerDescription: ndu cancel success
details.internalDescription: "ndu cancel" has completed successfully on this director.
details.formatString: ndu cancel success

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A call to env_read returned something other than the expected value.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A read from non-volatile memory returned something other than the expected value.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Shut down the director as quickly as possible, and keep it down until the upgrade sequence succeeds or fails. Report this issue to EMC Customer Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Shut down the director as quickly as possible, and keep it down until the upgrade sequence succeeds or fails. Report this issue to EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Unsuccessful read of data.
details.internalDescription: The upgrade data that the firmware read from non-volatile memory is invalid.
details.formatString: unsuccessful read of data

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A call to env_read returned something other than the expected value.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Shut down the director as quickly as possible, and keep it down until the upgrade sequence succeeds or fails. Report this issue to EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: unsuccessful read of data version
details.internalDescription: The upgrade data-version that the firmware read from non-volatile memory is invalid.
details.formatString: unsuccessful read of data version

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The read-in data-version is not supported.

details.customerDescription: data version mismatch detected
details.internalDescription: The upgrade data read-in from non-volatile memory was read-in successfully but its contents appear to be inconsistent.
details.formatString: data version mismatch detected

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A call to env_write returned something other than the expected value.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Shut down the director as quickly as possible, and keep it down until the upgrade sequence succeeds or fails. Report this issue to EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: unsuccessful write of data
details.internalDescription: The firmware was unable to write upgrade data to non-volatile memory. Non-volatile memory may now contain invalid upgrade data.
details.formatString: unsuccessful write of data

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A call to env_write returned something other than the expected value.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Shut down the director as quickly as possible, and keep it down until the upgrade sequence succeeds or fails. Report this issue to EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: unsuccessful write of data version
details.internalDescription: The firmware was unable to write upgrade data-version to non-volatile memory. Non-volatile memory may now contain an invalid upgrade data-version.
details.formatString: unsuccessful write of data version

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A director detects that its current firmware-version is the same as the one that it was running at the beginning of the upgrade by way of comparing the current firmware-version number against the one that is stored in flash data. If there is no version number in flash data then the director relies on the CMG state-send mechanism, whereby the director knows that it is running the old version of firmware if it is a first upgrader and it is able to communicate with last upgrader directors.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If one or more directors did not automatically abort the upgrade then report this issue to EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: firmware version inconsistency detected
details.internalDescription: A first-upgrader director booted up and detected that its current firmware version is the same as the one that it was running at the beginning of the upgrade. All directors that are able to communicate with the booting director will automatically abort the upgrade.
details.formatString: firmware version inconsistency detected

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Release of I/O to the first upgraders did not occur within the specified timeout. Front-end on the first upgraders has been re-disabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The transfer of I/O to the first upgraders did not occur in time. The first upgraders have been prevented from serving I/O at the target director software version.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The external NDU control script will take action on noticing the failure, resulting in a roll-back to the previous director software version.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: NDU will attempt to automatically recover, resulting in a roll-back to the previous director software version.

details.customerDescription: NDU of the VPLEX has failed before transferring I/O to the first upgraders.
details.internalDescription: NDU of the VPLEX has failed before transferring I/O to the first upgraders.
details.formatString: NDU of the VPLEX has failed before transferring I/O to the first upgraders. NDU will attempt to automatically recover and roll-back to the previous director software version.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: First upgrader front-end has been enabled and will wait for I/O release up until a specified timeout.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: NDU has begun re-enabling first upgrader front-end ports in preparation for the I/O transfer.

details.customerDescription: NDU has begun re-enabling first upgrader front-end ports in preparation for the I/O transfer.
details.internalDescription: NDU has begun re-enabling first upgrader front-end ports in preparation for the I/O transfer.
details.formatString: NDU has begun re-enabling first upgrader front-end ports in preparation for the I/O transfer.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Release of I/O to first upgraders has failed. This may be due to an abnormal timing issue or a critical vault event occurring during NDU (such as a power loss).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: NDU has failed to transfer I/O to the first upgraders.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: NDU will attempt to automatically recover the VPLEX to minimize or eliminate data unavailability.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: NDU will attempt to automatically recover the VPLEX.

details.customerDescription: NDU has failed to transfer I/O to the first upgraders.
details.internalDescription: NDU has failed to transfer I/O to the first upgraders.
details.formatString: NDU has failed to transfer I/O to the first upgraders.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: NDU has failed to start due to a power loss event.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: NDU will attempt to automatically recover the VPLEX.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: NDU will attempt to automatically recover the VPLEX.

details.customerDescription: NDU has failed to start due to a power loss event.

details.customerDescription: NDU detected a metadata write to amf.
details.internalDescription: NDU detected a metadata write to amf.
details.formatString: NDU detected a metadata write to amf.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: NDU detected an event during the I/O transfer phase. In this phase the following events can happen: 1. ndu xferio: failed to start 2. ndu xferio: stopping iofwd 3. ndu xferio: iofwd-stop init failed 4. ndu xferio: iofwd-stop procedure failed 5. ndu xferio: ending 6. ndu xferio: failed to end 7. ndu xferio: might have failed to kill second upgraders 8. ndu xferio: releasing IO
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: NDU detected an event during the I/O transfer phase. In this phase the following events can happen: 1. ndu xferio: failed to start 2. ndu xferio: stopping iofwd 3. ndu xferio: iofwd-stop init failed 4. ndu xferio: iofwd-stop procedure failed 5. ndu xferio: ending 6. ndu xferio: failed to end 7. ndu xferio: might have failed to kill second upgraders 8. ndu xferio: releasing IO
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: NDU detected an event during the I/O transfer phase. In case this event is a failure NDU will attempt to automatically recover and roll-back to the previous director software version.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: NDU detected an event during the I/O transfer phase. In case this event is a failure NDU will attempt to automatically recover and roll-back to the previous director software version.

details.customerDescription: NDU detected an event during the I/O transfer phase.
details.internalDescription: NDU detected an event during the I/O transfer phase.
details.formatString: NDU detected an event during the I/O transfer phase. NDU will attempt to automatically recover and roll-back to the previous director software version.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: NDU detected an error while trying to enable FE ports in suspended state on first upgraders. This only happens when IO forwarding is enabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: NDU detected an error while trying to enable FE ports in suspended state on first upgraders. This only happens when IO forwarding is enabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: NDU will attempt to automatically recover and roll-back to the previous director software version.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: NDU will attempt to automatically recover and roll-back to the previous director software version.

details.customerDescription: Unsuccessful enable frontend ports on first upgraders.
details.internalDescription: The command 'ndu enablefrontend' failed to enable FE ports in suspended state on first upgraders.
details.formatString: Unsuccessful enable frontend ports on first upgraders.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Each first-upgrader pings second-upgrader directors on the cross-version channel right before transferring I/O from second-upgraders to first-upgraders. If a director emits this event it means the director failed to ping at least one of the second-upgraders on that cluster. This indicates a communication problem among first and second upgrader directors.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Each first-upgrader pings second-upgrader directors on the cross-version channel right before transferring I/O from second-upgraders to first-upgraders. If a director emits this event it means the director failed to ping at least one of the second-upgraders on that cluster. This indicates a communication problem among first and second upgrader directors.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: NDU will attempt to automatically recover and roll-back to the previous director software version.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: NDU will attempt to automatically recover and roll-back to the previous director software version.

details.customerDescription: Communication problem between first and second upgraders.
details.internalDescription: Communication problem between first and second upgraders.
details.formatString: (ndu-com not initialized | ping failed: channel CHAN | ping timed-out: chan CHAN elpsd(us) TIME num_resp NUM_RESP | ping failed N times)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is a generic 'pass-through' message. When sms sees any xmmg message it will check the xmmg's severity level and if it is ERR or above sms will pass on the message intact so an sms user will see it. Alerts can not be generated on these events.

details.customerDescription: %s
details.internalDescription: This event was generated from the monitoring subsystem.
details.formatString: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is a notification of an IB chip detecting an error.

details.customerDescription: Ignoring information unit that is too big
details.internalDescription: An SRP initiator has sent an information unit that is bigger than the value that was negotiated during login.
details.formatString: Ignoring information unit that is too big

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: We validate incoming SRP_RSP tags to ensure they look sane before trusting them. If they don't look good, we emit this event and drop the response. Dropping CMD and TMF responses can lead to aborts and/or connection teardown.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Report problem to target vendor.

details.customerDescription: Malformed SRP_RSP tag 0x%16llx received from target port with remote port identifier 0x%016llx%016llx" -- discarding response
details.internalDescription: An SRP target port has sent an SRP_RSP information unit that contains an invalid 'tag'.
details.formatString: Malformed SRP_RSP tag 0x%16llx received from target port with remote port identifier 0x%016llx%016llx" -- discarding response

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The power supply in the specified slot is in faulted state. This could be due to some faulty cabling, faulty switch to the power supply or a faulty power source.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The power supply in the specified slot is in faulted state.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the cabling and source of the power. If the condition persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The power supply in the specified slot has faulted.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The input air temperature to the power supply has exceeded the threshold levels.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the environmental conditions of the server room. If the condition still persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Power supply input air temperature threshold exceeded.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The fan in the specified slot has faulted.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The other three fans if operational are sufficient to cool the enclosure until the faulty fan is replaced. However the fan module should be replaced as soon as possible.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.internalDescription: One of the fans in the specified slot has gone faulted. If the other fans are functioning it is sufficient to cool the enclosure.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The speed of the fan has dropped below the threshold value.
