eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The speed of the fan has dropped below the acceptable limits.
details.internalDescription: The speed of the fan has dropped below the acceptable limits. The other 3 fans are sufficient to cool the enclosure until the problem is fixed.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The speed of the fan had exceeded the threshold values. It is now functioning normally.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The speed of the fan has recovered from an error condition and is now functioning normally.

details.customerDescription: A fan speed is now nominal.
details.internalDescription: The speed value of the fan has recovered from an error condition.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the cabling to the AC source. Also verify that the AC power to the rack is in good state. If continued on AC power, verify that the battery gets fully charged.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the cabling to the AC source. Also verify that the AC power to the rack is in good state. If continued on AC power, verify that the battery gets fully charged. If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the cabling to the AC source. Also verify that the AC power to the rack is in good state. Restore the AC power to the SPS as soon as possible. If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the cabling and the AC power source to the SPS. If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The temperature of the enclosure has exceeded the threshold and a result of which the director is shutting down.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the ambient temperature of the server room. If the problem still persists contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The director fault code represents the last hardware operation or a hardware fault. The fault is indicated in the fault code string.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The peer of a director is not present.The peer director may be removed from the engine.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if the director is inserted into the engine. If not, insert into the engine.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check if the director is inserted into the engine. If not, insert into the engine. If the problem still persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The peer of a director is not present.

details.formatString: Director : PartNo %s /Sno %s /RevNo %s /InstanceId %d :The peer of director %s is not present.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A communication failure has been reported while attempting to contact the UPS. This could be due to a failed cable, failed UPS or failed Management Module serial port. It may also be due to an internal configuration problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A communication failure has been reported while attempting to contact the UPS. This could be a hardware problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Consult the failure detail string in the event log message. If the error is not timeout, then there is an internal director configuration problem. If the error is timeout, then there is a communication failure. If the UPS status display indicates the UPS is operating, then check the cabling between the UPS and the Management Module associated with director. If the problem persists, the faulty component must be identified and replaced immediately.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the UPS status display indicates the UPS is operating, then check the cabling between the UPS and the Management Module associated with director. If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The director is unable to communicate with its associated UPS.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The I/O Module is not present in the specified slot of the I/O Annex.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The I/O Module is not present in the specified slot of the I/O Annex.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Insert the I/O Module of the appropriate type into the specified slot of the I/O Annex. If the I/O Module is present, reseat it in the slot.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The specified I/O Module is not detected in the slot of the I/O Annex.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Gigabit Ethernet I/O Module is not present in the specified slot.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The Gigabit Ethernet I/O Module is not present in the specified slot.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Insert the Gigabit Ethernet I/O Module into the slot immediately. If the I/O Module is present, reseat it correctly.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check if the I/O Module is seated correctly. If the problem still persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: A Gigabit Ethernet I/O Module is not present.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The power supply is not present in the specified slot.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The power supply is not present in the specified slot.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Insert the power supply of required specification into the slot. If the power supply is present in the slot, reseat it.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check if the power supply is seated correctly. If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: A power supply is missing.
details.internalDescription: The power supply in the slot is no longer detected by the system.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s :PowerSupply is not present in the specified slot.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: One of the fans in the specified slot is not present.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The fan in the specified slot is not present.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The other three fans if operational are sufficient to cool the enclosure until the fan is inserted. However the fan module should be inserted immediately. The fan should be reseated if it is present in the slot.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check if the fan is seated correctly. If the problem still persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The engine cannot detect the fan in the specified slot.
details.internalDescription: The engine cannot detect the fan in the specified slot.
details.formatString: %s: Fan is not present in the specified slot.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Fans in the specified slots are in faulted state.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Fans in the specified slots are in faulted state.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The remaining fans, if operational, are not sufficient to cool the engine until the fans are inserted. The power supply will shut down the engine in 3 minutes. The engine will not bootup if multiple fans are non-operational. One or more fan modules should be replaced immediately. The fans should be reseated if already present in the slots.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check if the fans in the specified slots are seated correctly. The power supply will shut down the engine in 3 minutes. The engine will not bootup if 2 fans are non-operational. If the problem still persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The operational state of multiple fans is faulted.
details.internalDescription: The operational state of multiple fans is faulted.
details.formatString: Fans: (%s): The operational state of the specified fans is faulted.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A family and fru id mismatch is reported for the specified FRU. This could be due to an incorrect or faulty FRU being inserted in the slot.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A family and fru id mismatch is reported for the specified FRU.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Ensure that the correct FRU type is inserted in the specified slot.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The power supply is now on DC due to AC power failure. 1.Verify that there is AC power to the rack. 2. Check the cabling to the AC source. 3. Verify if the SPS is functioning properly. If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Verify that the AC power to the rack is in good state. Check the cabling to the AC source. Verify if the SPS is functioning properly. If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The power and environment monitoring process failed due to an internal error.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The power and environment monitoring process failed.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal hardware error has been detected on one of the directors.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The process should continue to monitor the director's running state.Reference KBA 193413 for instructions on how to determine which hardware components need to be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An internal hardware error has been detected on one of the directors.
details.internalDescription: AER error exceeds threshold limits.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The director's ICH10 exceeds the threshold limits. Check zpem log for detail.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal hardware error has been detected on one of the directors.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The process should continue to monitor the director's running state. Run the collect-diagnostics utility to collect ZEPM traces and core files. Report the problem to EMC Customer Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An internal hardware error has been detected on one of the directors.
details.internalDescription: ICH10 error exceeds threshold limits.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A network connection from the management server to a director has failed. This could be due to a hardware problem on one side of the management network or an unresponsive director.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A management network connection has failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the management network ethernet cabling and accessibility of the director on the other network.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Management network failure: IP address is unreachable.
details.internalDescription: Management network failure: IP address is unreachable.
details.formatString: management network failure: address %s is unreachable

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The VPN tunnel between this management server and the remote management server is down.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Management of remote and distributed resources is no longer possible.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the ipsec Connection with the cli command "vpn status" to check its state. If the ipsec connection is down, restart it with "ipsec start" command from a terminal command line. If problems still occur, ensure the remote site's management server can be reached.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the ipsec Connection with the cli command "vpn status" to check its state. If the ipsec connection is down, restart it with "vpn start" command from VPlexcli. If problems still occur, ping remote site's management server and ensure it can be reached. Also, please verify if there are any issues in the network between the management servers. If problem persists, please call EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Remote and distributed resource management not possible.
details.internalDescription: The VPN tunnel between this management server and the remote management server is down.
details.formatString: The Management Network for cluster %s can not reach its partner cluster.

details.customerDescription: Remote and distributed resource management possible.
details.formatString: The Management Network for cluster %s has been connected to its partner cluster.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Host certificate will expire within a week.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The Host Certificate will expire within a week.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Create a new Host certificate with the cli command 'security create-host-certificate'. Run the cli command 'security import-host-certificate'. If the customer is running GeoSynchrony 5.0.1 or later, have them use the "Renew Security Certificates" procedure in the Generator.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the cluster is running GeoSynchrony 5.0.1 or later, use the "Renew Security Certificates" procedure in the Generator. Otherwise, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The Host Certificate will expire within a week.
details.internalDescription: The Host Certificate will expire within a week.
details.formatString: The Host Certificate will expire in 7 days.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The CA certificate will expire in a week.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The CA certificate will expire in a week.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If the customer is running GeoSynchrony 5.0.1 or later, have them use the "Renew Security Certificates" procedure in the Generator. Otherwise, create a CA certificate on one of management server in the system by running the cli command 'security create-ca-certificate'. Run 'security export-ca-certiifcate'. Copy the certificate to the other management server. On both management servers, run 'security create-host-certificate' and then run the command to 'security import-host-certificate'. Now do an ipsec start.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the cluster is running GeoSynchrony 5.0.1 or later, use the "Renew Security Certificates" procedure in the Generator. Otherwise, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The CA certificate will expire in a week.
details.internalDescription: The CA certificate will expire in a week.
details.formatString: The CA Certificate will expire in 7 days.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The CA certificate on the Management server has expired.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Your CA certificate has expired.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If the customer is running GeoSynchrony 5.0.1 or later, have them use the "Renew Security Certificates" procedure in the Generator. Otherwise, create a CA certificate on one of management server in the system by running the cli command 'security create-ca-certificate'. Run 'security export-ca-certiifcate'. Copy the certificate to the other management server. On both management servers, run 'security create-host-certificate' and then run the command to 'security import-host-certificate'. Now do an ipsec start.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the cluster is running GeoSynchrony 5.0.1 or later, use the "Renew Security Certificates" procedure in the Generator. Otherwise, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Your CA certificate has expired.
details.internalDescription: Your CA certificate has expired.
details.formatString: The CA Certificate has expired.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Host certificate on the Management server has expired.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Your Host certificate has expired.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If the customer is running GeoSynchrony 5.0.1 or later, have them use the "Renew Security Certificates" procedure in the Generator. Otherwise, create a new Host certificate with the cli command 'security create-host-certificate'. Run the cli command 'security import-host-certificate'.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the cluster is running GeoSynchrony 5.0.1 or later, use the "Renew Security Certificates" procedure in the Generator. Otherwise, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The Host certificate on the Management server has expired.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A partition on the Management Server has exceeded a critical capacity threshold. Corrective action must be taken or valuable logging information may be lost and the Management Server may become unstable.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A partition on your Management Server has exceeded a critical capacity threshold.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: 1. You will need to back up critical data. Run "sudo /tmp/VPlexInstallPackages/VPlex-MS-install --pre-reimage -v -l /var/log/install.log. Move this file to a destination off of the Management Server and delete the local copy. 2. You will need to collect any diagnostic data. Run "collect-diagnostics". Move this file to a destination off of the Management Server and delete the local copy. 3. Find the largest files in the partition by running du -s [partition]> | sort -n. Remove the largest files until the available space is less. This can be confirmed with du -sh [partition].
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: 1. You will need to back up critical data. Run "sudo /tmp/VPlexInstallPackages/VPlex-MS-install --pre-reimage -v -l /var/log/install.log. Move this file to a destination off of the Management Server and delete the local copy. 2. You will need to collect any diagnostic data. Run "collect-diagnostics". Move this file to a destination off of the Management Server and delete the local copy. 3. Find the largest files in the partition by running du -s [partition]> | sort -n. Remove the largest files until the available space is less. This can be confirmed with du -sh [partition].

Move this file to a destination off of the Management Server and delete the local copy. 3. Find the largest files in the partition by running du -s [partition]> | sort -n. Remove the largest files until the available space is less. This can be confirmed with du -sh [partition].
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: 1. You will need to back up critical data. Run "sudo /tmp/VPlexInstallPackages/VPlex-MS-install --pre-reimage -v -l /var/log/install.log. Move this file to a destination off of the Management Server and delete the local copy. 2. You will need to collect any diagnostic data. Run "collect-diagnostics". Move this file to a destination off of the Management Server and delete the local copy. 3. Find the largest files in the partition by running du -s [partition]> | sort -n. Remove the largest files until the available space is less. This can be confirmed with du -sh [partition].

details.customerDescription: A hidden command which should not be used under normal conditions has been executed.
details.internalDescription: Customer has executed a hidden command, advise customer not to use commands which are not exposed and should not be used under normal conditions.
details.formatString: Hidden command '%s' has been executed.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Either the Cluster Witness Server or the two clusters might have lost connectivity with the Management Server during the execution of enable/disable command. Other potential causes could be failure of the Cluster Witness Server or either of the clusters.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: VPLEX CLI command to administratively enable (or disable) Cluster Witness functionality failed due to lack of connectivity during its execution.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Ensure that the management connectivity between all Cluster Witness components is properly established and the Cluster Witness Server and both clusters are operational and re-issue the command again. The system may be at risk of DU/DL if connectivity issues persist for one of the components and the Cluster Witness admin state is inconsistent. To reduce the risk of DU/DL, refer to the troubleshooting procedure for using disable-cluster-witness-on-cluster and disable-cluster-witness-server VPlexadmin commands to disable Cluster Witness functionality on the cluster and server respectively.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Ensure that Cluster Witness Server and both clusters are operational. Validate VPN management connectivity. Rectify any observed connectivity issues and re-issue the command to ensure that all Cluster Witness components have the same admin-state.

details.arguments: component returncode statuscode componentname1 adminstate1 componentname2 adminstate2 componentname3 adminstate3
details.customerDescription: The VPLEX CLI command to enable (or disable) Cluster Witness functionality has failed due to lack of connectivity.
details.internalDescription: VPLEX CLI command to enable (or disable) Cluster Witness functionality has failed on one of the components due to which the overall-admin-state of Cluster Witness might be inconsistent or unknown. It is very crucial to get the admin-state of each Cluster Witness Component into either enabled or disabled state.
details.formatString: Enable/Disable of Cluster Witness failed on %s with Returncode %s and Statuscode %s. %s admin-state is %s, %s admin-state is %s, %s admin-state is %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Disable and enable the corresponding port. Please contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: IO failed due to exchanges timed out. There might be faulty hardware on the IO path.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: IO failed due to exchanges timed out. There might be faulty hardware on the IO path.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check for faulty hardwares with following steps: 1. identify the IO path specified by the event; 2. Clean and re-seat the cables on the path; 3. If applicable, check switch stats to see if any switch is over-subscribed, if so, try to re-route some IO; 4. Replace SFPs on the IO path; 5. Check the target storage device see if it is over-subscribed, if so, add more target ports to serve IO.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact the EMC Customer Support in any step need help: Check for faulty hardwares with following steps: 1. identify the IO path specified by the event; 2. Clean and re-seat the cables on the path; 3. If applicable, check switch stats to see if any switch is over-subscribed, if so, try to re-route some IO; 4. Replace SFPs on the IO path; 5. Check the target storage device see if it is over-subscribed, if so, add more target ports to serve IO.

details.arguments: iid portname percent I T nportid
details.customerDescription: IO exchange timeout threshold exceeded.
details.internalDescription: Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) observed high IO timeout failure ([percent] percent) on the IO path from initiator [I]to target [T] (nport id [nportid]). Common cause is faulty hardware (dirty cable, faulty SFP, etc).
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): In the past minute, %f percent IO failed on I 0x%"FS64x" T 0x%"FS64x" (nportid 0x%06x) due to IO timeout, there might be faulty hardware in the IO path.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Some amount of IO failure on a login due to dropped frames.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Some amount of IO failure on a login due to dropped frames.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the target storage device specified by the event, try to add more target ports to serve IO. This is usually caused by the target device port cannot handle the amount of IO generated by the initiator ports. Or an over-subscribed switch in the IO path could also cause the symptom. Check switch log for any sign of over-subscription.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the target storage device specified by the event, try to add more target ports to serve IO. Contact EMC Customer Support for more information.

details.arguments: iid portname percent I T nportid
details.customerDescription: IO frame drop threshold exceeded.
details.internalDescription: Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) observed high IO failure rate ([percent] percent) due to dropped frames on the IO path from initiator [I] to target [T] (nport id [nportid]). Common cause is that the target device is not designed to handle the IO load we are generating, adding more target port to spread IO across could help. Also check the switch, make sure they has enough switching capacity.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): In the past minute, %f percent IO failed on I 0x%"FS64x" T 0x%"FS64x" (nportid 0x%06x) due to lost frame error, the target might not function well.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Some amount of IO failure on a login due to frames timed out. There might be faulty hardware close to the backend port.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Some amount of IO failed because frames timed out.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it connected to (or target device); 2. Clean and re-seat the cable; 3. Replace the SFP on both ends; 4. try to use a different switch port if available; 5. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.arguments: iid portname percent I T nportid
details.customerDescription: IO failed due to frames timed out, the amount exceeds the threshold.
details.internalDescription: Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) observed high IO failure rate ([percent] percent) due to frames timed out on the IO path from initiator [I] to target [T] (nport id [nportid]). Common cause is that a faulty SFP or dirty cable on this Fibre Channel port or the switch port connecting to this Fibre Channel port.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): In the past minute, %f percent IO failed on I 0x%"FS64x" T 0x%"FS64x" (nportid 0x%06x) due to frame timed out, there might be faulty hardware close to the local port.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Fibre Channel driver received an FCP frame with invalid task attribute.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Fibre Channel driver received an FCP frame with invalid task attribute.

details.customerDescription: Received FCP frame with wrong format.
details.internalDescription: Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) received an FCP frame with invalid task attribute ([attribute]). We observed this behavior with some QLogic HBAs at pre-booting phase: When the host equipped with these QLogic HBAs was stopped at early boot sequence to get into the HBA firmware configuration menu (similar to get into the host BIOS menu), and issue device scan from the HBA firmware configuration menu, the FCP frame generated by the HBA would contain uninitialized task attribute field. These task would be treated as SIMPLE task, no action is required.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): unknown task attribute 0x%02x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Fibre Channel port is connected to a switch, and the switch hasn't put the port in any zone yet.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Fibre Channel port is connected to a switch, and the switch hasn't put the port in any zone yet.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The port specified by the event was connected to a switch, however, there was indication that this port is not placed in any software zone. Please verify: 1. if a wrong cable was attached to this port? 2. if the switch zoning is not complete or not correct? 3. some switch need to enable the zoning configuration one more time to make the just-changed zoning configuration applied.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: A Fibre Channel port came online, but is unzoned.
details.internalDescription: Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) is connected to a switch and link is up. However, the Fibre Channel port is not in any configured switch zone. This might be an oversight of switch configuration, or as planned.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): Possible unzoned port

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A Fibre Channel port is continuously toggling between linkup and linkdown. There might be faulty hardware at the port.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A Fibre Channel port is continuously toggling between linkup and linkdown. There might be faulty hardware at the port.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it connected to (or target device); 2. Clean and re-seat the cable; 3. Re-seat the SFP on both ends; 4. Replace the SFP on both ends; 5. try to use a different switch port if available; 6. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Repeated transitions detected on an FC port.
details.internalDescription: A Fibre Channel port is continuously toggling between linkup and linkdown.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): In the past %u seconds, the port has toggled (linkup/linkdown) %d times.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A Fibre Channel port that was previously toggling between linkup and linkdown has been fixed and is no longer toggling.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A Fibre Channel port that was previously toggling between linkup and linkdown has been fixed and is no longer toggling.

details.customerDescription: A Fibre Channel port that was previously toggling between linkup and linkdown has been fixed.
details.internalDescription: Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) is no longer toggling.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): Port toggling for this port has been cleared.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The RX Power level on a Fibre Channel port is below the low limit and IO timeouts have occurred.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it connected to (or target device); 2. Clean and re-seat the cable; 3. Re-seat the SFP on both ends; 4. Replace the SFP on both ends; 5. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it connected to (or target device); 2. Clean and re-seat the cable; 3. Re-seat the SFP on both ends; 4. Replace the SFP on both ends; 5. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC.

details.customerDescription: Detected receive power on a FC port is lower than a configured threshold.
details.internalDescription: The RX Power level (rx power level [rx_power]) on Fibre Channel port(id [iid] port name [portname]) is below the low limit. This indicates either a bad SFP or bad/dirty cable.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): RxPower Low: %d.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The RX Power level on a Fibre Channel port has been restored to a good level.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The RX Power level on a Fibre Channel port has been restored to a good level.

details.customerDescription: The RX Power level on a Fibre Channel port has been restored to a good level.
details.internalDescription: The RX Power level (rx power level [rx_power]) on Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) is now at a good level.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): RxPower Restored: %d.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The EMC part number of the SFP was not recognized. It is required to use EMC approved SFPs with the EMC products.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The EMC part number of the SFP was not recognized. It is required to use EMC approved SFPs with the EMC products.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Replace the SFP with an EMC approved SFP for the product.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The port is equipped with an SFP which is not approved by EMC.
details.internalDescription: The port is equipped with an SFP which is not approved by EMC.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): is equipped with an SFP which is not approved by EMC for this product: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The port is equipped with an SFP with approved EMC part number for this product, but the vendor part number is not on the recognized list.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The port is equipped with an SFP with approved EMC part number for this product, but the vendor part number is not on the recognized list.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Make sure the vendor product number had been added to the approved list of this product. If not, replace the SFP.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Unrecognized vendor part no. for SFP with approved EMC part no.
details.internalDescription: The port [portname] id [iid] is equipped with an SFP with approved EMC part number for this product, but the vendor part number is not on the recognized list, details: [reason]
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): is equipped with an SFP with approved EMC part number for this product , but: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Name Server request has timed out, port discovery has failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Name Server request has timed out, port discovery has failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Indentify the port specified in the event, disable it and re-enable it; 2. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it is connected to. On the Fibre Channel switch, check the status of Name Server (this varies depending on the type of switch). If the Name Server is down, take the necessary steps to restart it (in most cases, the switch will need a reboot); 3. If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The Name Server on the FC switch connected to the port is not responding.
details.internalDescription: The Name Server on the FC switch connected to the port [portname] id [iid] is not responding to requests.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): Name Server request timed out.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An SFP is missing, inserted incorrectly, or faulty.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An SFP is missing, inserted incorrectly, or faulty.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event; 2. If the SFP is missing, insert a new SFP and attach the appropriate cable; 3. Re-seat the SFP; 4. Replace the SFP; 5. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An SFP is not responding to requests.
details.internalDescription: The SFP in Fibre Channel port(id [iid] port name [portname]) is not responding to requests. The SFP is either missing, inserted incorrectly, or faulty
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): SFP not detected: 0x%X

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An SFP that had previously been missing has now been detected.

details.customerDescription: An SFP that was previously not responding to requests has been detected and is now servicing requests.
details.internalDescription: The SFP in Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) is now servicing requests.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): SFP has been detected: 0x%X

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Link on an FC port became up.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Link on an FC port became up.

details.arguments: iid portname portwwn nPortId topology speed

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Some SERDES setting has been updated according to EMC specification.

details.internalDescription: Some SERDES setting had been updated according to EMC spec

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An SFP has asserted the receiving power too low alarm. This could be a problem on the SFP itself, or the cable attached to it, or the device on the other end of the attached cable.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An SFP has asserted the receiving power too low alarm.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it connected to (or target device); 2. Clean and re-seat the cable; 3. Re-seat the SFP on both ends; 4. Replace the SFP on both ends; 5. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An SFP has asserted the receiving power too low alarm.
details.internalDescription: An SFP has asserted the receiving power too low alarm.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): SFP asserted RX power (%u) low alarm.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An SFP has asserted the transmitting power too low alarm. This SFP needs to be replaced ASAP.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An SFP has asserted the transmitting power too low alarm.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event; 2. Re-seat the SFP on both ends; 3. Replace the SFP on the specified port; 4. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An SFP has asserted the transmitting power too low alarm.
details.internalDescription: An SFP has asserted the transmitting power too low alarm.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): SFP asserted TX power (%u) low alarm.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An SFP has cleared the receiving power too low alarm.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An SFP has cleared the receiving power too low alarm.

details.customerDescription: An SFP has cleared the receiving power too low alarm.
details.internalDescription: An SFP has cleared the receiving power too low alarm.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): SFP RX power is normal.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An SFP has cleared the transmitting power too low alarm.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An SFP has cleared the transmitting power too low alarm.

details.customerDescription: An SFP has cleared the transmitting power too low alarm.
details.internalDescription: An SFP has cleared the transmitting power too low alarm.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): SFP TX power is normal.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An FC chip detected persistent PCI error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An FC chip detected persistent PCI error.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if the indicated SLIC is healthy and has full connectivity. If the SLIC is unhealthy, or the errors persist, replace it. If SLIC replacement doesn't solve the issue, consider director replacement.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An FC chip detected persistent PCI error.
details.internalDescription: An FC chip detected persistent PCI error. This SLIC needs to be replaced.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): noticed persistent PCI error, pci config status: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Interface received frames with EOFa (End Of Frame Abort) delimiter in the last minute. There might be faulty hardware on the IO path.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Interface received frames with EOFa (End of Frame Abort) delimiter in the last minute. There might be faulty hardware on the IO path.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check for faulty hardwares with following steps: 1. Clean and re-seat the cables connecting to the interface; 2. Replace SFPs on the interface.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Interface received frames with protocol error in the last minute. There might be faulty hardware on the IO path.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Interface received frames with protocol error in the last minute. There might be faulty hardware on the IO path.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check for faulty hardwares with following steps: 1. Clean and re-seat the cables connecting to the interface; 2. Replace SFPs on the interface.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An FC port's receiving power level resumed and is turned back on.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An FC port's receiving power level resumed and is turned back on.

details.customerDescription: An FC port's receiving power level resumed and is turned back on.
details.internalDescription: An FC port's receiving power level resumed and is turned back on.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): RxPower Restored: %d, turning ON port.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An FC port is being turned off because RX power low and IO timeout.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An FC port is being turned off because RX power low and IO timeout.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The FC port was turned off because the RX power level is too low, and higher than 5% of IO timeout had been observed. Turning off this port to avoid performance issues. The hardware attached to this port need to be carefully invetigated. The SFP, cable needs to be re-seated, cleaned, swapped. The port will be turned back on by firmware when the RX power resumed to normal level.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The hardware attached to this port needs to be carefully investigated. The switch port SFP and cable need to be re-seated, cleaned, swapped. Contact EMC Customer Support if problem persists.

details.customerDescription: An FC port is being turned off because RX power low and IO timeout.
details.internalDescription: An FC port is being turned off because RX power low and IO timeout.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): RxPower Low: %d, turning OFF port.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An FC port's TX power is too low.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An FC port's TX power is too low.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The SFP attached to the VPLEX Fibre Channel port indicated in the message needs to be re-seated or swapped.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An FC port's TX power is too low.
details.internalDescription: An FC port's TX power is too low.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): TxPower Low: %d.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An FC port's TX power is restored to normal level.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An FC port's TX power is restored to normal level.

details.internalDescription: An FC port's TX power is restored to normal level.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An FC port will reset link to recover from no BB_credit.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The filesystem monitor failed to retrieve the status of one of the filesystems that it was monitoring.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The filesystem monitor failed to retrieve the status of one of the filesystems that it was monitoring.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The affected filesystem may need to be repaired, or the director may need to be rebooted or re-imaged. If normal operation cannot be restored, contact EMC Customer Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Unable to retrieve filesystem status.
details.internalDescription: Unable to retrieve filesystem status.
details.formatString: Failed to check filesystem mounted at '%s': %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A filesystem has exceeded its usage threshold and is getting low on free space.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A filesystem has exceeded its usage threshold and is getting low on free space.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The affected filesystem may need to be cleaned up and/or repaired, or the director may need to be rebooted. If normal operation cannot be restored, contact EMC Customer Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: A filesystem is getting full.
details.internalDescription: A filesystem is getting full.
details.formatString: The filesystem mounted at '%s' is %s full.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The temperature of the I/O Annex is nearing the error threshold. This may be due to environment conditions.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The temperate of the I/O Annex is nearing the error threshold levels due to some environmental conditions.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the ambient conditions of the server room. If the problem persists, replace the I/O Annex immediately.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the ambient temperature of the server room and power on the director. If the problem still persists contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: I/O Annex temperature is approaching the error threshold.
details.internalDescription: The temperature of the I/O Annex is approaching the error threshold limits.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : I/O Annex temperature warning detected.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The specified device is in a degraded state.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The specified device is in a degraded state.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The device may need to be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The specified device is in a degraded state.
details.internalDescription: The specified device is in a degraded state.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The operational state of the specified fru is Degraded.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Conditioning of an SPS has been missed for two cycles. Typically this occurs if the power zones are not completely healthy and this may indicate a persistent power problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Conditioning of an SPS has been missed for two cycles.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Manually schedule SPS conditioning using the 'battery-conditioning manual-cycle' command. Verify that all power zones on this cluster are healthy, using the 'cluster status' command.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Manually schedule SPS conditioning using the 'battery-conditioning manual-cycle' command. Verify that all power zones on this cluster are healthy, using the 'cluster status' command.

details.customerDescription: SPS conditioning has not occurred recently.
details.internalDescription: SPS conditioning has not occurred recently.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : SPS conditioning has not occurred recently.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The fibre channel switch and/or management server are not plugged in to the UPS.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The fibre channel switch and/or management server are not plugged in to the UPS.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Ensure both fibre channel switches are plugged in to different UPSs and that the management-server is plugged in to one of the UPSs.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Ensure both fibre channel switches are plugged in to different UPSs and that the management-server is plugged in to one of the UPSs.

details.customerDescription: UPS load power is lower than expected.
details.internalDescription: UPS load power is lower than expected.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : UPS load power is lower than expected.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The I/O Annex is not present in the specified slot.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The I/O Annex is not present in the specified slot.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Insert the I/O Annex in the specified slot. If the I/O Annex is already present, it needs to be reseated.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check if the correct FRU has been inserted in the slot. If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The I/O Annex is no longer detected by the engine.
details.internalDescription: The I/O Annex is no longer detected by the engine.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The I/O Annex is not present in the specified slot

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An I/O Annex fuse has faulted.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An I/O Annex fuse has faulted.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The I/O Annex must be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An I/O Annex fuse has faulted.
details.internalDescription: An I/O Annex fuse has faulted.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : I/O Annex fuse fault detected

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A fan in the I/O Annex has faulted.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A fan in the I/O Annex has faulted.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Although the I/O Annex can operate on a single fan, the I/O Annex should be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: A fan in the I/O Annex has faulted.
details.internalDescription: A fan in the I/O Annex has faulted.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : One of the fans in the I/O Annex has faulted

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A resume PROM cannot be accessed or has failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The system experienced a problem accessing an internal PROM.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Although the system can normally function without the PROM information, the FRU containing the PROM should be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An internal PROM read or write failed.
details.internalDescription: A resume PROM read or write failed.
details.formatString: %s: resume PROM %s failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A resume PROM checksum doesn't match its contents.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal PROM has become corrupted.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Although the system can normally function without the PROM information, the FRU containing the PROM should be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An internal PROM has become corrupted.
details.internalDescription: A resume PROM checksum check failed.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : Resume PROM checksum error

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Low level hardware, BIOS, or POST has detected an internal error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal hardware error has been detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The message should identify the faulty hardware and the appropriate actions to take.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An internal hardware error has been detected.
details.internalDescription: An internal hardware error has been detected.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : Hardware error - %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The state of the I2C bus is faulted. This could be due to a hardware or software error in the I2C subsystem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The state of the I2C bus is faulted.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The location of the fault should be isolated using any other logged I2C events and the zi2cdiags and zdt tools.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The state of the I2C bus is faulted.
details.internalDescription: The state of the I2C bus is faulted.
details.formatString: %s: The operational state of the i2c bus has changed to %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Unable to arbitrate for the top-level I2C mux. This is probably due to a software error where communication with the zlpc.ko kernel module is compromised.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Unable to arbitrate for the top-level I2C mux.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Reload the zlpc.ko kernel module and run the zi2cdiags diagnostic tool to verify that the fault has been corrected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Unable to arbitrate for the top-level I2C mux.
details.internalDescription: Unable to arbitrate for the top-level I2C mux.
details.formatString: %s : The mux arbitration process failed.\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Unable to arbitrate for the I2C bus. This is probably due to a software error where communication with the zlpc.ko kernel module is compromised.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Unable to arbitrate for the I2C bus.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Reload the zlpc.ko kernel module and run the zi2cdiags diagnostic tool to verify that the fault has been corrected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Unable to arbitrate for the I2C bus.
details.internalDescription: Unable to arbitrate for the I2C bus.
details.formatString: %s : The bus arbitration process failed.\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Unable to configure the top-level I2C mux. This is probably due to a software error where communication with the zlpc.ko kernel module is compromised.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Unable to configure the top-level I2C mux.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Reload the zlpc.ko kernel module and run the zi2cdiags diagnostic tool to verify that the fault has been corrected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Unable to configure the top-level I2C mux.
details.internalDescription: Unable to configure the top-level I2C mux.
details.formatString: %s : The mux configuration process failed.\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Configuration of the switches on the I2C bus failed. This is probably due to a hardware error preventing proper I2C communication with the switches.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Configuration of the switches on the I2C bus failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Along with any other logged I2C events, run the zi2cdiags tool to pinpoint the location of the fault and replace the faulty hardware.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Configuration of the switches on the I2C bus failed.
details.internalDescription: Configuration of the switches on the I2C bus failed.
details.formatString: %s : The switch configuration process failed.\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SCL signal on the specified I2C bus is shorted to ground. This is a hardware error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The SCL signal on the specified I2C bus is shorted to ground.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Pinpoint the location of the fault using any other logged I2C-related events and the zi2cdiags tool. Replace the faulted hardware.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The SCL signal is shorted to ground.
details.internalDescription: The SCL signal is shorted to ground.
details.formatString: %s : The SCL line is stuck low.\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SDA signal on the specified I2C bus is shorted to ground. This is a hardware error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The SDA signal on the specified I2C bus is shorted to ground.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Pinpoint the location of the fault using any other logged I2C-related events and the zi2cdiags tool. Replace the faulted hardware.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The SDA signal is shorted to ground.
details.internalDescription: The SDA signal is shorted to ground.
details.formatString: %s : The SDA line is stuck low.\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The temperature of the I/O Annex has exceeded the threshold levels and the I/O Annex is shutting down.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The temperature of the I/O Annex has exceeded the threshold and a result of which the I/O Annex is shutting down.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the ambient temperature of the server room. Verify if the fans are working sufficiently to provide effective cooling.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the ambient temperature of the server room. If the problem still persists contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Temperature threshold exceeded; I/O Annex shutdown in progress.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Both fans in the I/O Annex have faulted. The I/O Annex will shut down.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Both fans in the I/O Annex have faulted. The I/O Annex will shut down.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The reported I/O Annex must be replaced.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The specified UPS is not connected to this director. If the UPS is already present, check the connections to the UPS.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The specified FRU cannot be accessed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The specified FRU cannot be accessed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: There is a hardware failure involving either the director or the specified FRU or there is a software error in the I2C access logic. Use /var/log/ztrace.log messages to identify the faulty hardware or software problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The director hardware detection logic is not functioning. Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Cannot determine operational state of the specified FRU.
details.internalDescription: The director hardware detection logic is not functioning.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /Rev No %s : The specified FRU cannot be accessed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The specified FRU is not present.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The specified FRU is not present.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Insert the correct FRU in the specified slot. If the FRU is already present, it needs to be reseated.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check if the correct FRU has been inserted in the slot. If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The specified FRU is no longer detected by the engine.
details.internalDescription: The specified FRU is no longer detected by the engine.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The state of the specified FRU is faulted. This could be due to a hardware error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The state of the specified FRU is faulted
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if the module is inserted in its slot correctly. If the problem still persists, then the FRU must be replaced immediately.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The operational state of the specified FRU is faulted.
details.internalDescription: The operational state of the specified FRU is faulted.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The operational state of the specified FRU is Faulted.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Local director ram size mismatch. It either indicates a factory configuration problem or a faulty DIMM. BIOS has turned off the faulty DIMM.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Memory configuration error has been detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The message should identify the ram size mismatches. The memory on all directors should be equal. Any poorly seated DIMMs should be reseated and/or faulty DIMMS replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Local director ram size mismatch.
details.internalDescription: Local director ram size mismatch.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : Local director ram size mismatch

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: DIMM error count exceeds threshold levels.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal hardware error has been detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The DIMM specified in the call-home text needs to be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An internal hardware error has been detected on one of the DIMMs.
details.internalDescription: An internal hardware error has been detected on one of the DIMMs.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : DIMM ECC threshold exceeded.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An error occurred accessing an NVRAM log.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An error occurred accessing an NVRAM log.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The director described in the call-home should be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An error occurred accessing an NVRAM log.
details.internalDescription: An error occurred accessing an NVRAM log.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : Error %d trying to fetch dmi log from NVRAM.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Incorrect CPU count on local director. One or more CPUs are either not detected, disabled, bad or not present. Check the /var/log/zpem_messages.log for details.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: CPU configuration error has been detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: 1. Perform a firmware restart on the director - Run VPlex CLI commands: 'director shutdown --force' and 'director run' from the context of affected director. Ex: If director 'director-1-1-A' has incorrect CPU count then run VPlex CLI command from 'director-1-1-A' context: 'VPlexcli:/engines/engine-1-1/directors/director-1-1-A> director shutdown --force' and 'VPlexcli:/engines/engine-1-1/directors/director-1-1-A> director run'. Note: Run 'director shutdown --force' and 'director run' commands on a single director at a time. 2. If director firmware restart doesn't resolve the problem then reboot the director OS by following KBA 000304328. 3. If the condition persists, replace the affected director.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Local director CPU count mismatch.
details.internalDescription: Local director CPU count mismatch.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : Local director CPU count mismatch

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An SPS conditioning cycle has failed because the battery can no longer hold a sufficient charge.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An SPS conditioning cycle has failed because the battery can no longer hold a sufficient charge.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The SPS or SPS battery needs to be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: An SPS conditioning cycle failed to complete due to insufficient battery.
details.internalDescription: An SPS conditioning cycle failed to complete due to insufficient battery.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : SPS conditioning has failed.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The state of the specified FRU is offline. This could be due to a hardware error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The state of the specified FRU is offline.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if the module is inserted in its slot correctly. If the problem still persists, then the FRU must be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The operational state of the specified FRU is offline.
details.internalDescription: The operational state of the specified FRU is offline.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The operational state of the specified FRU is Offline.

details.customerDescription: A vaulting request was issued due to [reason].
details.internalDescription: A vaulting request was issued due to [reason]. Vaulting will start, and all the directors in the cluster will be shutdown.
details.formatString: A vaulting request was issued due to %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The cluster has started vaulting either because user initiated a manual vault or due to a persistent power and/or environmental conditions, and will cause the cluster to shutdown.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The cluster has started vaulting either because user initiated a manual vault or due to a persistent power and/or environmental conditions.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If the vaulting was not started by the user, investigate the cause for the vaulting. Once the vaulting has completed and the cause has been resolved, follow the Administration procedure in the Generator to startup up the cluster after a vault.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the vaulting was not started by the user, investigate the cause for the vaulting. Once the vaulting has completed and the cause has been resolved, follow the Administration procedure in the Generator to startup up the cluster after a vault.

details.customerDescription: The cluster has started vaulting, and will cause the cluster to stop servicing IOs and the VPLEX service to shutdown.
details.internalDescription: The cluster has started vaulting, and will cause the cluster to shutdown.
details.formatString: The cluster has started vaulting due to %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: To prevent data loss, the director has stopped and drained all IOs during the vaulting process.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: To prevent data loss, outstanding IOs have been stopped, future host IOs will not be serviced.

details.customerDescription: Outstanding IOs have been stopped.
details.internalDescription: Outstanding IOs have been stopped.
details.formatString: The director has stopped and drained all IOs.

details.customerDescription: The director has completed vaulting [byteCount] bytes, and will shutdown.
details.internalDescription: The director has completed vaulting [byteCount] bytes, and will shutdown.
details.formatString: The director has completed vaulting %u bytes.

details.customerDescription: The director has started unvaulting.
details.internalDescription: The director has started unvaulting, and will read the vaulted data into its local memory.
details.formatString: The director has started unvaulting.

details.customerDescription: The director has completed unvaulting [byteCount] bytes.
details.internalDescription: The director has completed unvaulting [byteCount] bytes.
details.formatString: The director has completed unvaulting %u bytes.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The recovery of all the vaulted data has started. This process initiates the recovery of all the vaulted data from the local director's memory to VPLEX global cache to establish global cache coherency across all clusters.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The recovery of all the vaulted data has started. Loading vaulted data from the local director's memory to VPLEX global cache.

details.customerDescription: The recovery of all the vaulted data has started.
details.internalDescription: The recovery of all the vaulted data has started.
details.formatString: The director has started vault recovery.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The recovery of all the vaulted data has completed. This cluster will start servicing IOs.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The recovery of all the vaulted data has completed. This cluster will start servicing IOs.

details.customerDescription: The recovery of all the vaulted data has completed.
details.internalDescription: The recovery of all the vaulted data has completed.
details.formatString: The director has completed vault recovery.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The director has discarded all vaulted data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The director has discarded all vaulted data.

details.customerDescription: The director has discarded its vault data. Reason: [DiscardReason]
details.internalDescription: The director has discarded its vault data. Reason: [DiscardReason]
details.formatString: The director has discarded its vault data. Reason: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The cluster has detected that one or more power supply components (e.g. SPS) are not on AC power and is preparing to vault if the problem persists.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The cluster has detected that one or more power supply components (e.g. SPS) are not on AC power and is preparing to vault if the problem persists.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Please verify the power status of all components in the cluster and correct problem if possible.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Please verify the power status of all components in the cluster and correct problem if possible.

details.customerDescription: The cluster has detected a power problem and is preparing to vault if the problem persists.
details.internalDescription: The cluster has detected a power problem and is preparing to vault if the problem persists.
details.formatString: Cluster-wide power problem has been detected. Cluster will vault and shutdown if the problem persists.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Sufficient power has been restored and the cluster is no longer preparing to vault.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Sufficient power has been restored and the cluster is no longer preparing to vault.

details.customerDescription: Sufficient power has been restored.
details.internalDescription: Sufficient power has been restored and the cluster is no longer preparing to vault.
details.formatString: Sufficient power restored to cluster before vault and shutdown were necessary. Normal operation resumes.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Vault recovery on the cluster cannot proceed because all director(s) required to complete recovery are either not operational or communicating. This requires manual intervention from the user before IOs will be allowed to resume on any distributed volumes.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Vault recovery on the cluster cannot proceed because all director(s) required to complete recovery are either not operational or communicating. This requires manual intervention from the user before IOs will be allowed to resume on any distributed volumes.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Customer needs to follow the cache-vaulting section in the VPLEX troubleshooting guide to proceed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Customer needs to follow the cache-vaulting section in the VPLEX troubleshooting guide to proceed.

details.customerDescription: The wait time for missing director(s) to be present before vault recovery has been exceeded.
details.internalDescription: The director waited for [quorum_wait_min] minutes for [missing_director_count] missing director(s) to be present before the cluster can proceed with vault recovery.
details.formatString: The director waited for %d minutes for %d missing directors to be present before the cluster can proceed with vault recovery.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: User issued the command to override the unvault recovery quorum. Cluster will not wait for all the directors required to be present before proceeding with the recovery of the vault.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: User issued the command to override the unvault recovery quorum. Cluster will not wait for all the directors required to be present before proceeding with the recovery of the vault.

details.customerDescription: The command to override unvault recovery quorum has been received.
details.internalDescription: The command to override unvault recovery quorum has been received.
details.formatString: The command to bypass unvault recovery quorum has been received. The director will not wait for all the required directors before proceeding with vault recovery.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The cluster has successfully completed recovering all valid director vaults without data loss.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The cluster has successfully completed recovering all valid director vaults without data loss.

details.customerDescription: The cluster has successfully completed recovering all valid director vaults without data loss.
details.internalDescription: The cluster has successfully completed recovering all valid director vaults without data loss.
details.formatString: The cluster has successfully completed recovering all vaults with no data loss.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The cluster has detected at least two director vaults that could not be recovered. All director vaults in the cluster are being discarded which may cause data loss.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The cluster has detected at least two director vaults that could not be recovered. All director vaults in the cluster are being discarded which may cause data loss.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Data may have been lost on volumes in asynchronous consistency groups. I/O may automatically suspend on all volumes in these consistency groups at all of the participating clusters. Verify the state of all consistency groups and follow the procedures in the VPLEX CLI document for rolling back and resuming these volumes if necessary. The behavior of the cluster when this occurs is similar to a complete cluster failure.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Data may have been lost on volumes in asynchronous consistency groups. I/O may automatically suspend on all volumes in these consistency groups at all of the participating clusters. Verify the state of all consistency groups and follow the procedures in the VPLEX CLI document for rolling back and resuming these volumes if necessary.

details.customerDescription: The cluster could not recover the vaulted data due to an insufficent number of recoverable vaults causing possible data loss.
details.internalDescription: The cluster could not recover the vaulted data due to an insufficent number of recoverable vaults causing possible data loss.
details.formatString: The cluster could not recover the vaulted data due to an insufficent number of recoverable vaults causing possible data loss.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A director failure has terminated the recovery of all vaults because there is no longer enough recoverable director vaults. All unrecovered vaults in the cluster are being discarded which may cause data loss.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A director failure has terminated the recovery of all vaults because there is no longer enough recoverable director vaults. All unrecovered vaults in the cluster are being discarded which may cause data loss.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Data may have been lost on volumes in asynchronous consistency groups. I/O will automatically suspend on all volumes in these consistency groups at all of the participating clusters. Verify the state of all consistency groups and follow the procedures in the VPLEX CLI document for resuming these volumes. The behavior of the cluster when this occurs is similar to multiple simultaneous director failures.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Data may have been lost on volumes in asynchronous consistency groups. I/O will automatically suspend on all volumes in these consistency groups at all of the participating clusters. Verify the state of all consistency groups and follow the procedures in the VPLEX CLI document for resuming these volumes.

details.customerDescription: A director failure during the recovery of its vault has resulted in an insufficient number of recovered vaults causing possible data loss.
details.internalDescription: A director failure during recovery of director vaults has resulted in an insufficient number of recovered vaults causing possible data loss.
details.formatString: A director failure during the recovery of its vault has resulted in an insufficient number of recovered vaults causing possible data loss.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: There is an ongoing NDU when a power loss that may require vaulting has occurred. The vault will not occur.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: There is an ongoing NDU when a power loss that may require vaulting has occurred. The vault will not occur.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: No action required.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: No action required.

details.customerDescription: A power loss that may require vaulting has occurred, but an NDU is in progress.
details.internalDescription: A power loss that may require vaulting has occurred, but an NDU is in progress.
details.formatString: Cluster-wide power problem has been detected. NDU in progress prevents vaulting.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The cluster has detected that one or more power supply components (e.g. SPS) are not on AC power during early cluster bootup. It must shut down immediately to preserve the current vault data, if any.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The cluster has detected that one or more power supply components (e.g. SPS) are not on AC power during early cluster bootup. It must shut down immediately.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Ensure all the VPLEX components in the cluster are on AC power and then restart the cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Ensure all the VPLEX components in the cluster are on AC power and then restart the cluster.

details.customerDescription: The cluster has detected a power problem and will shutdown immediately to avoid data loss.
details.internalDescription: The cluster has detected a power problem and will shutdown immediately to avoid data loss.
details.formatString: Cluster-wide power problem detected at cluster boot up. Cluster will shutdown immediately.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The director may not be able to complete writing the vault in case of power loss.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The director may not be able to complete writing the vault in case of power loss.

details.customerDescription: The director has been vaulting for a period of time which is approaching the completion threshold.
details.internalDescription: The director has been vaulting for a period of time which is approaching the completion threshold. The director may not be able to complete writing the vault in case of power loss.
details.formatString: The director has been vaulting for %d seconds and has not yet completed writing the vault.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The director(s) in the cluster are taking more than expected time to quiesce IO and freeze the cache for vaulting.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The director(s) in the cluster are taking more than expected time to quiesce IO and freeze the cache for vaulting.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check event description to identify the activity preventing the cluster from freezing its cache, and escalate to VPLEX Engineering to analyze the issue and apply the possible resolution to unblock the cluster from vaulting.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The director(s) in the cluster have waited to allow dirty data to freeze. Cluster cannot start to vault because the blocking activity is not complete.
details.internalDescription: The director(s) in the cluster have waited to allow dirty data to freeze. Cluster cannot start to vault because the blocking activity is not complete.
details.formatString: The director has waited for %d seconds to allow dirty data to freeze. Director cannot start to vault because %s is not complete.

details.customerDescription: Director has completed failure handling.
details.internalDescription: Director has completed failure handling.
details.formatString: Director has completed failure handling.

details.customerDescription: Director has completed wof delta advance catchup for all of its wof groups.
details.internalDescription: Director has completed wof delta advance catchup for all of its wof groups.
details.formatString: WOF has completed delta advance catchup for all of its wof groups.

details.customerDescription: Director has blocked prot group change handling as part of vault.
details.internalDescription: Director has blocked prot group change handling as part of vault.
details.formatString: Director has blocked prot group change handling.

details.customerDescription: The director has booted with a persistent power and/or environmental problem and hence has been blocked from servicing any IO.
details.internalDescription: The director has booted with a persistent power and/or environmental problem. This will prevent it from joining the local ring and hence servicing any IOs.
details.formatString: Director blocked due to power problem. It will join when power is normal.
