eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: GeoSynchrony has failed three times with not more than 3 minutes of time interval between consecutive failures.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: GeoSynchrony has failed three times continuously.Contact EMC Customer Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Run the collect-diagnostics utility to collect firmware logs and core files.Report the problem to EMC Customer Support.Once the issue is resolved,start GeoSynchrony using "run" command from VPlexcli.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The system will fix this automatically. Use the 'cluster status' command to assure that the failure recovery completes. If the recovery does not complete, contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Broadcast messages are sent by APFO between the directors for co-ordinating path states and failovers. When a directors joins or leaves a cluster, all outstanding broadcast messages are discarded. This ensures only the most upto-date decisions are being processed. A decision for which a broadcast message was discarded is restarted with the new groupId.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This event is for internal information. This event occurs whenever a director joins or leaves the cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: While this event doesn't indicate failure, check the health of the system.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: While this event doesn't indicate failure, check the health of the system. Contact EMC Customer Support for more information.

details.customerDescription: Broadcast message discarded due to a director joining or leaving the cluster.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Automated meta-volume backup has not been properly configured. The list of VPDs for backing up the meta-volume should be stored in /var/log/VPlex/cli/VPlexConfig.xml and it is not. The file could also be missing.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Automated meta-volume backup has not been properly configured, or the configuration file was removed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Configure automated metavolume backup by using the 'configuration metadata-backup' command.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Configure automated metavolume backup by using the 'configuration metadata-backup' command.

details.customerDescription: Automated meta-volume backup has not been configured.
details.internalDescription: Automated meta-volume backup has not been configured.
details.formatString: Automated meta-volume backup has not been configured.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: One, or both, storage volumes reserved for automated meta-volume backup are used by manually created meta-volume backups. A previously existing automated backup was destroyed, and reused to create a different backup.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: One, or both, Storage volumes reserved for automated meta-volume backup are used by manually created meta-volume backups.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Either delete the manually created meta-volume backup(s) using the reserved storage volume(s) and run 'configuration metadata-backup' command to use the same volumes as before. Or if additional volumes are available, run 'configuration metadata-backup' and select different volumes.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Either delete maually created meta-volume backup(s) using the reserved storage volume(s) and run 'configuration metadata-backup' command to use the same volumes as before. Or if additional volumes are available, run 'configuration metadata-backup' and select different volumes.

details.customerDescription: Storage volumes reserved for automated meta-volume backup have been used by manually created meta-volume backups.
details.internalDescription: Storage volumes reserved for automated meta-volume backup have been used by manually created meta-volume backups.
details.formatString: Storage volumes reserved for automated meta-volume backup have been used by manually created meta-volume backups.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Detected incorrect number of storage-volumes configured for automated meta-volume backup.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Detected incorrect number of storage-volumes configured for automated meta-volume backup.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Correct the number of storage-volumes configured for automated metavolume backup by: 1. Destroy the existing backups using the 'meta-volume destroy' command. 2. Unclaim those volumes if they are to be re-used with the 'storage-volume unclaim' command. 3. Use the 'configuration metadata-backup' command to reconfigure the backups.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Correct the number of storage-volumes configured for automated metavolume backup by: 1. Destroy the existing backups using the 'meta-volume destroy' command. 2. Unclaim those volumes if they are to be re-used with the 'storage-volume unclaim' command. 3. Use the 'configuration metadata-backup' command to reconfigure the backups.

details.customerDescription: Detected incorrect number of storage-volumes configured for automated meta-volume backup.
details.internalDescription: Detected incorrect number of storage-volumes configured for automated meta-volume backup.
details.formatString: Detected incorrect number of storage-volumes configured for automated meta-volume backup.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Backup meta-volume could not be destroyed, in order to allow the next metadata backup.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Backup meta-volume could not be destroyed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Confirm that the volumes configured to be used for the backup are in a healthy state. If the volumes are unhealthy, create new automated metavolume backups by: 1. Destroy the existing backups using the 'meta-volume destroy' command. 2. Unclaim those volumes if they are to be re-used with the 'storage-volume unclaim' command. 3. Use the 'configuration metadata-backup' command to reconfigure the backups. If the previous volumes used were not healthy enough to destroy, create the backups with new healthy devices.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Confirm that the volumes configured to be used for the backup are in a healthy state. If the volumes are unhealthy, create new automated metavolume backups by: 1. Destroy the existing backups using the 'meta-volume destroy' command. 2. Unclaim those volumes if they are to be re-used with the 'storage-volume unclaim' command. 3. Use the 'configuration metadata-backup' command to reconfigure the backups. If the previous volumes used were not healthy enough to destroy, create the backups with new healthy devices.

details.customerDescription: A meta-volume backup could not be destroyed.
details.internalDescription: A meta-volume backup could not be destroyed.
details.formatString: A meta-volume backup could not be destroyed.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The automated backup of the meta-volume could not be completed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The automated backup of the meta-volume could not be completed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Confirm that the volumes configured to be used for the backup are in a healthy state. If the volumes are unhealthy, create new automated metavolume backups by: 1. Destroy the existing backups using the 'meta-volume destroy' command. 2. Unclaim those volumes if they are to be re-used with the 'storage-volume unclaim' command. 3. Use the 'configuration metadata-backup' command to reconfigure the backups. If the previous volumes used were not healthy enough to destroy, create the backups with new healthy devices.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Confirm that the volumes configured to be used for the backup are in a healthy state. If the volumes are unhealthy, create new automated metavolume backups by: 1. Destroy the existing backups using the 'meta-volume destroy' command. 2. Unclaim those volumes if they are to be re-used with the 'storage-volume unclaim' command. 3. Use the 'configuration metadata-backup' command to reconfigure the backups. If the previous volumes used were not healthy enough to destroy, create the backups with new healthy devices.

details.customerDescription: The automated backup of the meta-volume could not be completed.
details.internalDescription: The automated backup of the meta-volume could not be completed.
details.formatString: The automated backup of the meta-volume could not be completed.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Cluster Witness Server has received a message with unsupported protocol version from one of the clusters. This event may potentially be reported after incorrectly performed upgrade. While this condition persists, connectivity between the Cluster Witness Server and the cluster that reported this event may be severed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If this condition persists, ensure that software on all directors as well as Cluster Witness Server software is upgraded to a release where Cluster Witness Server and Client use compatible protocol versions.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A communication path is degraded.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A communication path is degraded.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Depends on the degradation condition: 1). RTT_TOO_BIG: the path might be congested, when the congestion resolves, the degrade condition will resolve by itself; If the path does have longer RTT compare to the other path, then it will not be used unless it is the last usable path. 2). IO_ERROR: some IO error will trigger this condition, these IO errors are usually caused by a faulty hardware on the IO path. Try to identify the common point of failure and remove the faulty condition. The condition will be removed if no more IO error was noticed for a while. 3). LINK_FLAP: the link had been flapping too often, fix the hardware issue caused the flapping and the condition will be resolved.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC support.

details.customerDescription: A communication path is degraded.
details.internalDescription: A communication path is degraded.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A communication port didn't reach link up in time.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A communication port didn't reach link up in time.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: A communication had been enabled, but after a certain time, it still didn't reach link up. Communication redundancy might be compromised. First check the link redundancy status. If the port is not supposed to be enabled, then disable it. If the port is supposed to reach link up, then check the cabling and hardware to fix the issue.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC support.

details.customerDescription: An FC COM port finished initializaiton, set the link state to down.
details.internalDescription: An FC COM port finished initializaiton, set the link state to down.
details.formatString: COM port %s (role: %s) initial link down.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The last redundant FC path to the specified VPLEX WAN-COM interface is down.This could be due to problem with the VPLEX Fiber Channel WAN COM switch.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The last redundant FC path to the specified VPLEX WAN-COM port is down.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Investigate the VPLEX Fibre Channel WAN-COM switches and the links between them to determine why the link is down.Check the cables and the SFPs, make sure they are properly plugged in. Check the related switches (if applicable), and make sure they are operational and the corresponding switch ports are enabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Investigate the VPLEX Fibre Channel WAN-COM switches and the links between them to determine why the link is down.Check the cables and the SFPs, make sure they are properly plugged in. Check the related switches (if applicable), and make sure they are operational and the corresponding switch ports are enabled. If problem persists contact EMC Support.

details.customerDescription: The last redundant path to the specified director is down.There is only one available path.If that also goes down,it will result in site departure.
details.internalDescription: The last redundant path to the specified director is down.
details.formatString: The active paths count to the node with uuid 0x%llx siteId %u has reduced to %lu while the link is still UP.

Please immediately escalate to VPLEX Engineering and forward the call-home CDATA, which contains important diagnostic information. If director crash happened, please also forward the extended collect-diagnostics.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The immediate data probe on an inter-director FC path failed.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Large number of i/os have timed out on this connection in the past one minute.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Please investigate the health of the switch(es), cables and SFPs in the connection identified as having a high timeout count. Please rectify any bad hardware found. If the connection with a high timeout count is a local COM path (between directors in one cluster) please contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Scsi xcopy command processing is disabled on VPLEX. ESX servers using scsi xcopy for VM operations may have degraded performance.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Scsi xcopy command processing is disabled on VPLEX.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Discuss with the customer the performance impact of disabling xcopy command processing. Use the CLI command "set /clusters/*/storage-views/*::xcopy-enabled true" to enable it. This value should be the same across all storage-views. Ensure that the default xcopy template is enabled so that all future storage-views are created with xcopy enabled. Use the VPlexcli command 'll /clusters/*' command to verify if the xcopy template is set to 'true'. If it is not set to 'true' set it to 'true' with the VPlexcli command 'set /clusters/*::default-xcopy-template true'.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Use the CLI command "set /clusters/*/storage-views/*::xcopy-enabled true" to enable it. This value should be the same across all storage-views.

details.customerDescription: Scsi xcopy command processing is disabled on VPLEX.
details.internalDescription: Scsi xcopy command processing is disabled on VPLEX.
details.formatString: xcopy is disabled, ITL %s: (%s)(%s)(0x%016"FS64x", %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A xcopy command was aborted because it has an out of range destination LBA.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A xcopy command was aborted because it has an out of range destination LBA.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Investigate why the host was not respecting the size of the destination volume advertised by the VPLEX. Verify the host-issued LBA and storage reported max LBA.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Investigate why the host was not respecting the size of the destination volume advertised by the VPLEX. If problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A scsi xcopy command was only partially received from a host. VPLEX got a CDB that had xcopy as the command, but subsequent required transfers from host to VPLEX were not received. This command was aborted.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A scsi xcopy command was only partially received from a host.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Investigate host connectivity issues. If the host crashed or was disconnected part way through issuing an xcopy command this event would be expected. See if there are other scsi commands that are also generating host errors or host retires. Check for SAN connectivity issues.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Investigate host connectivity issues. If the host crashed or was disconnected part way through issuing an xcopy command this event would be expected. See if there are other scsi commands that are also generating host errors or host retires. Check for SAN connectivity issues. If problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: A scsi xcopy command was only partially received from a host.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: From the vplexcli, cd to the context of the port that failed to disable. Verify that the 'enabled' attribute is false. Toggle the port by first setting 'enabled' to true and then back to false. This should correct the port state. Do not use wildcards(*) when disabling ports as this could result in a DU.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: It is possible to trigger a rebalance by executing "opm virtual-volume set-override" command on the volume with different directors than it is currently set to and then execute "opm virtual-volume set-override --clear" command for the volume.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: IO failed due to exchanges timed out. There might be faulty hardware on the IO path.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: IO failed due to exchanges timed out. There might be faulty hardware on the IO path.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check for faulty hardwares with following steps: 1. identify the IO path specified by the event; 2. Clean and re-seat the cables on the path; 3. If applicable, check switch stats to see if any switch is over-subscribed, if so, try to re-route some IO; 4. Replace SFPs on the IO path; 5. Check the target storage device see if it is over-subscribed, if so, add more target ports to serve IO.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact the EMC Customer Support in any step need help: Check for faulty hardwares with following steps: 1. identify the IO path specified by the event; 2. Clean and re-seat the cables on the path; 3. If applicable, check switch stats to see if any switch is over-subscribed, if so, try to re-route some IO; 4. Replace SFPs on the IO path; 5. Check the target storage device see if it is over-subscribed, if so, add more target ports to serve IO.

details.arguments: iid portname percent I T nportid
details.customerDescription: IO exchange timeout threshold exceeded.
details.internalDescription: An IO port observed high IO timeout failure on an IO path. Common cause is faulty hardware (dirty cable, faulty SFP, etc).
details.formatString: io port: %d (%s): In the past minute, %f percent IO failed on I 0x%"FS64x" T 0x%"FS64x" (nportid 0x%06x) due to IO timeout, there might be faulty hardware in the IO path.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Some amount of IO failure on a login due to dropped frames.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Some amount of IO failure on a login due to dropped frames.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the target storage device specified by the event, try to add more target ports to serve IO. This is usually caused by the target device port cannot handle the amount of IO generated by the initiator ports. Or an over-subscribed switch in the IO path could also cause the symptom. Check switch log for any sign of over-subscription.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the target storage device specified by the event, try to add more target ports to serve IO. Contact EMC Customer Support for more information.

details.arguments: iid portname percent I T nportid
details.customerDescription: IO frame drop threshold exceeded.
details.internalDescription: An IO port observed high IO failure rate due to dropped frames on the IO path.
details.formatString: io port: %d (%s): In the past minute, %f percent IO failed on I 0x%"FS64x" T 0x%"FS64x" (nportid 0x%06x) due to lost frame error, the target might not function well.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Some amount of IO failure on a login due to frames timed out. There might be faulty hardware close to the backend port.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Some amount of IO failed because frames timed out.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it connected to (or target device); 2. Clean and re-seat the cable; 3. Replace the SFP on both ends; 4. try to use a different switch port if available; 5. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC if all other steps have failed to fix the issue.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.arguments: iid portname percent I T nportid
details.customerDescription: IO failed due to frames timed out, the amount exceeds the threshold.
details.internalDescription: An IO port observed high IO failure rate due to frames timing out on the IO path.
details.formatString: io port: %d (%s): In the past minute, %f percent IO failed on I 0x%"FS64x" T 0x%"FS64x" (nportid 0x%06x) due to frame timed out, there might be faulty hardware close to the local port.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: IO driver received an IOP frame with invalid task attribute. The cause of this may stem from QLogic HBAs in pre-booting phase: When the host equipped with these QLogic HBAs was stopped at early boot sequence to get into the HBA firmware configuration menu (similar to get into the host BIOS menu), and issue device scan from the HBA firmware configuration menu, the IOP frame generated by the HBA would contain uninitialized task attribute field. These task would be treated as SIMPLE task, no action is required.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: IO driver received an IOP frame with invalid task attribute.

details.customerDescription: Received IOP frame with wrong format.
details.internalDescription: An IO port received an IOP frame with invalid task attribute.
details.formatString: io port: %d (%s): unknown task attribute 0x%02x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: IO port is connected to a switch, and the switch hasn't put the port in any zone yet.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: IO port is connected to a switch, and the switch hasn't put the port in any zone yet.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The port specified by the event was connected to a switch, however, there was indication that this port is not placed in any software zone. Please verify: 1. if a wrong cable was attached to this port 2. if the switch zoning is not complete or not correct 3. some switch need to enable the zoning configuration one more time to make the just-changed zoning configuration applied.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: A IO port came online, but is unzoned.
details.internalDescription: An IO port is connected to a switch and link is up. However, the IO port is not in any configured switch zone.
details.formatString: io port: %d (%s): Possible unzoned port

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A IO port is continuously toggling between linkup and linkdown. There might be faulty hardware at the port.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A IO port is continuously toggling between linkup and linkdown. There might be faulty hardware at the port.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it connected to (or target device); 2. Clean and re-seat the cable; 3. Re-seat the SFP on both ends; 4. Replace the SFP on both ends; 5. try to use a different switch port if available; 6. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC if other remedies have failed to solve the problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Repeated transitions between link-up and link-down detected on an IO port.
details.internalDescription: A IO port is continuously toggling between linkup and linkdown.
details.formatString: io port: %d (%s): In the past %u seconds, the port has toggled (linkup/linkdown) %d times.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A IO port that was previously toggling between linkup and linkdown has been fixed and is no longer toggling.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A IO port that was previously toggling between linkup and linkdown has been fixed and is no longer toggling.

details.customerDescription: A IO port that was previously toggling between linkup and linkdown has been fixed.
details.internalDescription: An IO port is no longer toggling.
details.formatString: io port: %d (%s): Port toggling for this port has been cleared.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The RX Power level on a IO port is below the low limit and IO timeouts have occurred.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The RX Power level on a IO port is below the low limit and IO timeouts have occurred.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it connected to (or target device); 2. Clean and re-seat the cable; 3. Re-seat the SFP on both ends; 4. Replace the SFP on both ends; 5. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC if other remedies have failed to solve the problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it connected to (or target device); 2. Clean and re-seat the cable; 3. Re-seat the SFP on both ends; 4. Replace the SFP on both ends; 5. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC if other remedies have failed ot solve the problem.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The EMC part number of the SFP was not recognized. It is required to use EMC approved SFPs with the EMC products.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Name Server request has timed out, port discovery has failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Name Server request has timed out, port discovery has failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Indentify the port specified in the event, disable it and re-enable it; 2. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it is connected to. On the IO switch, check the status of Name Server (this varies depending on the type of switch). If the Name Server is down, take the necessary steps to restart it (in most cases, the switch will need a reboot); 3. If the problem persists, contact EMC Customer Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: The Name Server on the IO switch connected to the port is not responding.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An SFP is missing, inserted incorrectly, or faulty.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An SFP is missing, inserted incorrectly, or faulty.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event; 2. If the SFP is missing, insert a new SFP and attach the appropriate cable; 3. Re-seat the SFP; 4. Replace the SFP; 5. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC if other remedies have failed to solve the problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An IO chip detected persistent PCI error.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if the indicated SLIC is healthy and has full connectivity. If the SLIC is unhealthy, or the errors persist, replace it. If SLIC replacement doesn't solve the issue, consider director replacement.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An IO port is being turned off because RX power low and IO timeout.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An IO port is being turned off because RX power low and IO timeout.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The IO port was turned off because the RX power level is too low, and higher than 5% of IO timeout had been observed. Turning off this port to avoid performance issues. The hardware attached to this port need to be carefully invetigated. The SFP, cable needs to be re-seated, cleaned, swapped. The port will be turned back on by firmware when the RX power resumed to normal level.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The hardware attached to this port needs to be carefully investigated. The switch port SFP and cable need to be re-seated, cleaned, swapped. Contact EMC Customer Support if problem persists.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Failed to start an IO port chip. The root cause can be due to any number of issues within the Emulex chip. Analysis of the Emulex chip dump is needed to determine the root cause.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Failed to start an IO port.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Please run collect-diagnostics on the system before taking any action in order to capture the logs needed for RCA and raise a case with VPLEX Engineering. For the recovery, do the following. Try toggling the port by disabling it and re-enabling it within VPLEXCLI. If that does not allow the port to come up engage the CS Recovery Team to reboot the director OS by following the procedure in KBA 174350. If the issue is still not resolved, go for the SLIC replacement.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Failed to start an IO port.
details.internalDescription: Failed to start an IO port with status portStatus and register errors error1 and error2.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Failed to start an IO port.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Please run collect-diagnostics on the system before taking any action in order to capture the logs needed for RCA and raise a case with VPLEX Engineering. For the recovery, do the following. Try toggling the port by disabling it and re-enabling it within VPLEXCLI. If that does not allow the port to come up engage the CS Recovery Team to reboot the director OS by following the procedure in KBA 174350. If the issue is still not resolved, go for the SLIC replacement.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An iSCSI Interface creation failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the status of the interface under port context in vplexcli by executing the command \"ll /engines/*/directors/*/hardware/ports\". If the port status is not 'up', try disabling and then enabling the port again. If re-enabling the port fails, replace the vDirector, which has the problemetic interface/port. If vDirector replacement also fails, the setup need to be either re-installed/upgraded.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the status of the interface under port context in vplexcli by executing the command \"ll /engines/*/directors/*/hardware/ports\". If the port status is not 'up', try disabling and then enabling the port again. If re-enabling the port fails, replace the vDirector, which has the problemetic interface/port. If vDirector replacement also fails, the setup need to be either re-installed/upgraded.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An iSCSI connection could not be established from an initiator to a target, since the underlying TCP/IP connection fails to connect to the storage array target port from the particular iSCSI backend port. This event is applicable only for the iSCSI backend.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An iSCSI connection could not be established from an initiator to a target, since the underlying TCP/IP connection fails to connect to the storage array target port from the particular iSCSI backend port. This event is applicable only for the iSCSI backend.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Verify the connectivity in the back-end using the following two commands \"connectivity validate-be\" and \"iscsi check-febe-connectivity\". (a) If these commands report errorneous connectivity to storage volume or iSCSI backend port, take corrective action to restore the network configuration as reported by these commands. (b) If these commands report no error, check the IP address belongs to the target array. Sometimes target array may be configured to report IP address in SendTargets, which are not hosting iSCSI servers. In this case, check with array vendor for proper configuration to eliminate such case. If the IP address belongs to a proper target array port, verify the underlying network connectivity.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The login associated with the iSCSI session is unusable and the process of tearing down the IT nexus corresponds to this login in SCSI layer will be initiated.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The login associated with the iSCSI session is unusable and the process of tearing down the IT nexus corresponds to this login in SCSI layer will be initiated.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the state of the session reported in the event. If the session's state is FAILED, either the network could be slow (reponse is greater that NOP-In/NOP-Out timeout ~7 sec) or the remote end dropped the session. Hence check the network connectivity using the command \"iscsi check-febe-connectivity\" and take corrective action or check the remote end of the session for any failures. If the session's state is LOGGEDIN, the session is torn down under normal circumstances and hence no further action needed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the state of the session reported in the event. If the session's state is LOGGEDIN, the session is torn down under normal circumstances and hence no further action needed. If the session's state is FAILED, then contact EMC Customer Support

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The login process on a front-end iSCSI connection received an initiator IQN that collides with one of the existing IQN in iSCSI port registry. The collision of incoming initiator IQN results in failure of login process from this initiator.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The login process on a front-end iSCSI connection received an initiator IQN that collides with one of the existing IQN in iSCSI port registry. The collision of incoming initiator IQN results in failure of login process from this initiator.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Try assigning different IQN, to either new initiator IQN or the exisitng one which collides with the new initiator IQN and then attempt to re-login.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Try assigning different IQN, to either new initiator IQN or the exisitng one which collides with the new initiator IQN and then attempt to re-login.

details.arguments: Initiator IQN name, Colliding Node IQN Name
details.customerDescription: The initiator IQN collision detected at front-end.
details.internalDescription: The initiator IQN collision detected at front-end.
details.formatString: Initiator IQN %s collides in port registry with %s. Failing login.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The login process on a back-end iSCSI connection received a target IQN that collides with one of the existing IQN in iSCSI port registry. The collision of target IQN prevents the login process to the corresponding target port.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The login process on a back-end iSCSI connection received a target IQN that collides with one of the existing IQN in iSCSI port registry. The collision of target IQN prevents the login process to the corresponding target port.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Try assigning different IQN, to either new target IQN or the exisitng one which colloides with the new targets IQN and then issue the command \"iscsi sendtargets rediscover\" to re-establish the login process again.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Try assigning different IQN, to either new target IQN or the exisitng one which colloides with the new targets IQN and then issue the command \"iscsi sendtargets rediscover\" to re-establish the login process again.

details.formatString: Target IQN %s collides in port registry with %s. Not logging in.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: I/O-Forwarding is being started/activated on this first-upgrader director. It means this director is communicating with its peer second-upgrader director(s) picked when I/O-Forwarding was enabled to make sure that they are ready for I/O-Forwarding.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: I/O-Forwarding is being started/activated on this first-upgrader director. It means this director is communicating with its peer second-upgrader director(s) picked when I/O-Forwarding was enabled to make sure that they are ready for I/O-Forwarding.

details.customerDescription: I/O-Forwarding is being started/activated on this first-upgrader director.
details.internalDescription: I/O-Forwarding is being started/activated on this first-upgrader director.
details.formatString: IO Forwarding is being started

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: I/O-Forwarding is now activated on this first-upgrader director. It means this director has started forwarding incoming host I/Os to the selected peer second-upgrader director(s) for processing.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: I/O-Forwarding is now activated on this first-upgrader director. It means this director has started forwarding incoming host I/Os to the selected peer second-upgrader director(s) for processing.

details.customerDescription: I/O-Forwarding is now activated on this first-upgrader director.
details.internalDescription: I/O-Forwarding is now activated on this first-upgrader director.
details.formatString: IO Forwarding is now running

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: I/O-Forwarding is being stopped on this first-upgrader director. Note that stop procedure is carried out system-wide. As soon as I/O-Forwarding stop procedure is requested, all directors suspend any new I/Os and drain all outstanding I/Os. Once no on-going I/Os left in the system, first-upgraders first pull the current front-end state from second-upgraders and then they switch into pass-through (normal) mode from I/O-Forwarding mode.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: I/O-Forwarding is being stopped on this first-upgrader director. Note that stop procedure is carried out system-wide. As soon as I/O-Forwarding stop procedure is requested, all directors suspend any new I/Os and drain all outstanding I/Os. Once no on-going I/Os left in the system, first-upgraders first pull the current front-end state from second-upgraders and then they switch into pass-through (normal) mode from I/O-Forwarding mode.

details.customerDescription: I/O-Forwarding is being stopped on this director.
details.internalDescription: I/O-Forwarding is being stopped on this director.
details.formatString: IO Forwarding is being stopped

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: I/O-Forwarding has stopped on this first upgrader director. It means host I/Os received at this director will not be forwarded to other directors anymore.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: I/O-Forwarding has stopped on this first upgrader director. It means host I/Os received at this director will not be forwarded to other directors anymore.

details.customerDescription: I/O-Forwarding has stopped on this first upgrader director.
details.internalDescription: I/O-Forwarding has stopped on this first upgrader director.
details.formatString: IO Forwarding is now stopped

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: While stopping I/O-Forwarding, until all first-upgraders switch to pass-through (normal) mode, I/O must be suspended on all directors. A director emits this event if it sees that I/O is not suspended right before it is about to carry out the mode-switch. This event should not be observed during NDU I/O-Forwarding.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: While stopping I/O-Forwarding, until all first-upgraders switch to pass-through (normal) mode, I/O must be suspended on all directors. A director emits this event if it sees that I/O is not suspended right before it is about to carry out the mode-switch. This event should not be observed during NDU I/O-Forwarding.

details.customerDescription: A director notices that I/O is not suspended before it is about to switch from I/O-Forwarding mode to pass-through (normal) mode. This event should not be observed during NDU I/O-Forwarding.
details.internalDescription: A director notices that I/O is not suspended before it is about to switch from I/O-Forwarding mode to pass-through (normal) mode. This event should not be observed during NDU I/O-Forwarding.
details.formatString: I/O is not suspended at this node while other nodes are now stopping iofwd.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: While I/O-Forwarding is activated on this first-upgrader director, an initiator port has logged into a front-end target port. Upon receiving a login, the director notifies its peer second-upgrader directors about the login so that it can start relaying (forwarding) I/Os (originated from this login) to them. The director emits this event in case it fails to notify a second-upgrader director about the new login. Most probably, this event means there is a communication problem between first-upgraders and second-upgraders on the cross-version channel.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: While I/O-Forwarding is activated on this first-upgrader director, an initiator port has logged into a front-end target port. Upon receiving a login, the director notifies its peer second-upgrader directors about the login so that it can start relaying (forwarding) I/Os (originated from this login) to them. The director emits this event in case it fails to notify a second-upgrader director about the new login. Most probably, this event means there is a communication problem between first-upgraders and second-upgraders on the cross-version channel.

details.customerDescription: Failed to create virtual IT nexus.
details.internalDescription: Failed to create virtual IT nexus.
details.formatString: Failed to create virtual IT nexus: sit 0x%llx init 0x%llx tgt 0x%llx on uuid 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: While I/O-Forwarding is activated on this first-upgrader director, an initiator port has logged out from a front-end target port. Upon receiving a logout, the director notifies its peer second-upgrader directors about the logout so that they can clean up the references to the closing login. The director emits this event in case it fails to notify a second-upgrader director about the logout. Most probably, this event means there is a communication problem between first-upgraders and second-upgraders on the cross-version channel.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: While I/O-Forwarding is activated on this first-upgrader director, an initiator port has logged out from a front-end target port. Upon receiving a logout, the director notifies its peer second-upgrader directors about the logout so that they can clean up the references to the closing login. The director emits this event in case it fails to notify a second-upgrader director about the logout. Most probably, this event means there is a communication problem between first-upgraders and second-upgraders on the cross-version channel.

details.customerDescription: Failed to destroy virtual IT nexus.
details.internalDescription: Failed to destroy virtual IT nexus.
details.formatString: Failed to destroy virtual IT nexus: sit 0x%llx init 0x%llx tgt 0x%llx on uuid 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This first-upgrader (forwarding) director failed to remove I/O suspension on its peer second-upgrader directors. This could happen if there is a communication failure between this director and its peer second upgrader director(s).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This first-upgrader (forwarding) director failed to remove I/O suspension on its peer second-upgrader directors. This could happen if there is a communication failure between this director and its peer second upgrader director(s).

details.customerDescription: Failed to unsuspend IO on peers.
details.internalDescription: Failed to unsuspend IO on peers.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is a catch-all event. It basically means a message exchanged between a first-upgrader (forwarding) director and one of its peer second-upgrader director(s) is not valid and thus discarded. This event is emitted on the receiver end of the message and for the following conditions: the COM message has invalid 'check-sequence-counter', the target UUID of the message does not match the UUID of the receiver, the message is for an I/O transaction but receiver cannot locate the target I/O, the message is for an I/O transaction but it is not expected based on the receiver's knowledge on the transaction (e.g., it is waiting for command response completion but received some other message), etc. The event body explains why the message is invalid. This event should not be observed during NDU I/O-Forwarding.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This is a catch-all event. It basically means a message exchanged between a first-upgrader (forwarding) director and one of its peer second-upgrader director(s) is not valid and thus discarded. This event is emitted on the receiver end of the message and for the following conditions: the COM message has invalid 'check-sequence-counter', the target UUID of the message does not match the UUID of the receiver, the message is for an I/O transaction but receiver cannot locate the target I/O, the message is for an I/O transaction but it is not expected based on the receiver's knowledge on the transaction (e.g., it is waiting for command response completion but received some other message), etc. The event body explains why the message is invalid. This event should not be observed during NDU I/O-Forwarding.

details.customerDescription: A message exchanged between a first-upgrader (forwarding) director and one of its peer second-upgrader director(s) is not valid.
details.internalDescription: A message exchanged between a first-upgrader (forwarding) director and one of its peer second-upgrader director(s) is not valid.
details.formatString: Invalid com message: [wrong delivery target | nil iofwd indication | iofwdInd is not in use! | iofwdInd has aborted! | ...]

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: I/O-Forwarding failed to allocate a send buffer for a read or write I/O. In this case, the I/O is failed internally and BUSY response is sent to host for retry.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: I/O-Forwarding failed to allocate a send buffer for a read or write I/O. In this case, the I/O is failed internally and BUSY response is sent to host for retry.

details.customerDescription: Memory allocation failed.
details.internalDescription: Memory allocation failed.
details.formatString: Memory allocation failed: Couldn't allocate send buffer for ind 0x%llx xfer 0x%llx %s io.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: NDU I/O-Forwarding failed to kill this second-upgrader director. It means, in the end of the I/O transfer phase, this second upgrader director has found itself still alive and thus automatically removed I/O suspension. Normally, in the end of I/O transfer, all second-upgraders must be dead (i.e., firmware would not be running). Most probably, a communication problem between first and second upgraders caused kill signal (sent from first upgraders to second upgraders) to fail.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: NDU I/O-Forwarding failed to kill this second-upgrader director. It means, in the end of the I/O transfer phase, this second upgrader director has found itself still alive and thus automatically removed I/O suspension. Normally, in the end of I/O transfer, all second-upgraders must be dead (i.e., firmware would not be running). Most probably, a communication problem between first and second upgraders caused kill signal (sent from first upgraders to second upgraders) to fail.

details.customerDescription: NDU I/O-Forwarding failed to kill this second-upgrader director.
details.internalDescription: NDU I/O-Forwarding failed to kill this second-upgrader director.
details.formatString: Ndu failed to kill 2Us in time. Unsuspending stpl layer on this node: (suspended: %u)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: I/O-Forwarding provides feedback on the start and end of global I/O suspension that takes place in the very beginning of I/O-Forwarding stop procedure. All I/O must be suspended before first-upgraders can switch from I/O-Forwarding mode to pass-through (normal) mode.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: I/O-Forwarding provides feedback on the start and end of global I/O suspension that takes place in the very beginning of I/O-Forwarding stop procedure. All I/O must be suspended before first-upgraders can switch from I/O-Forwarding mode to pass-through (normal) mode.

After first-upgrader (forwarding) directors stopped I/O-Forwarding, all directors release I/O (remove the blockage on new I/Os).

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: I/O-Forwarding component on this director received a message for an on-going I/O transaction but the director does not recognize the targeted I/O (indication). Most probably, the indication has been already freed and failed pre-maturely (e.g., because the owner initiator port has already logged out, etc.) so this is not necessarily an error condition but only an informative event. Normally, this event should not be seen but stpl/23 (unknown Stpl IT Nexus) event must be present in the firmware log.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: I/O-Forwarding component on this director received a message for an on-going I/O transaction but the director does not recognize the targeted I/O (indication). Most probably, the indication has been already freed and failed pre-maturely (e.g., because the owner initiator port has already logged out, etc.) so this is not necessarily an error condition but only an informative event. Normally, this event should not be seen but stpl/23 (unknown Stpl IT Nexus) event must be present in the firmware log.

details.internalDescription: The targeted I/O (indication) is unknown.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: I/O-Forwarding component on this director has aborted some I/Os internally to help I/O drainage. When stopping I/O-Forwarding, all directors wait for 2 seconds (by default) for natural I/O drainage. If there is still outstanding I/Os, I/O-Forwarding layer injects internal abort on those I/Os to speed up drainage. VPLEX expects hosts to retry those I/Os.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: I/O-Forwarding component on this director has aborted some I/Os internally to help I/O drainage. When stopping I/O-Forwarding, all directors wait for 2 seconds (by default) for natural I/O drainage. If there is still outstanding I/Os, I/O-Forwarding layer injects internal abort on those I/Os to speed up drainage. VPLEX expects hosts to retry those I/Os.

details.customerDescription: On this director some host I/Os have been aborted internally.
details.internalDescription: On this director some host I/Os have been aborted internally.
details.formatString: IOFWD I/O internal abort: at (receiver | forwarding) node aborting an I/O in state %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: I/O-Forwarding component on this director received a message for an I/O transaction but the director does not recognize the targeted STPL I(nitiator)T(arget) nexus. It means while I/O transaction(s) has been going on, initiator port has logged out and VPLEX is waiting for outstanding I/Os (for the closing IT nexus) to complete to clean up all the references to the IT. This is normally not an error condition.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: I/O-Forwarding component on this director received a message for an I/O transaction but the director does not recognize the targeted STPL I(nitiator)T(arget) nexus. It means while I/O transaction(s) has been going on, initiator port has logged out and VPLEX is waiting for outstanding I/Os (for the closing IT nexus) to complete to clean up all the references to the IT. This is normally not an error condition.

details.customerDescription: The targeted STPL IT Nexus is unknown.
details.internalDescription: The targeted STPL IT Nexus is unknown.
details.formatString: Received unknown sit: %s from 0x%llx sit 0x%llx ind 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: In the end of NDU I/O-Forwarding, this first-upgrader director gets the up-to-date logical-unit state (e.g., reservation state, SCSI-3 registrations, etc.) from a second-upgrader node and applies the received state. When applying the state, it may not recognize some of the logical units and emit this event for each of them. This is not necessarily an error condition. Note that first-upgraders have restarted recently and learned the list of available logical-units directly from metadata. However, second-upgraders, running for a long while, may have some stale information. Therefore, the discrepancy between two lists of logical-units would lead to this event.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: In the end of NDU I/O-Forwarding, this first-upgrader director gets the up-to-date logical-unit state (e.g., reservation state, SCSI-3 registrations, etc.) from a second-upgrader node and applies the received state. When applying the state, it may not recognize some of the logical units and emit this event for each of them. This is not necessarily an error condition. Note that first-upgraders have restarted recently and learned the list of available logical-units directly from metadata. However, second-upgraders, running for a long while, may have some stale information. Therefore, the discrepancy between two lists of logical-units would lead to this event.

details.customerDescription: Logical-Unit received from a second-upgrader is unknown to this first-upgrader.
details.internalDescription: Logical-Unit received from a second-upgrader is unknown to this first-upgrader.
details.formatString: %s: couldn't find lu %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: I/O-Forwarding component on this director asked front-end component (STDF) to abort outstanding I/Os. When stopping I/O-Forwarding, all directors wait for 2 seconds (by default) for natural I/O drainage. If there is still outstanding I/Os, I/O-Forwarding layer injects internal abort on those I/Os to speed up drainage. VPLEX expects hosts to retry those I/Os.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An IO failed to complete or be properly aborted and cleaned up. This IO is currently stuck in VPLEX and will need intervention to resolve.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An IO failed to complete or be properly aborted and cleaned up.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: There are several layers in the IO stack that could have caused the actual problem. Refer to the Knowledgebase article for this event for directions on how to locate where the IO is stuck, and steps to resolve the issue.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer support.

details.arguments: ioid, deathrowQTimeOut, userName, iport, name, tport, lun, volumeName
details.customerDescription: An IO failed to complete or be properly aborted and cleaned up.
details.internalDescription: An IO failed to complete or be properly aborted and cleaned up.
details.formatString: IO 0x%"FS64x" is stuck for more than %d seconds on ITL: [%s(%s) %s (%s) 0x%"FS64x"] vol %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Scsi Unmap command processing is rejected by VPLEX because the volume is not thin capable or thin enabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Scsi Unmap command processing is rejected by VPLEX because the volume is not thin capable or thin enabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Discuss with the customer the impact of not processing the Unmap command. Check if the virtual volume was not created with the \"--thin\" option. Use "ll /clusters/cluster-n/virtual-volumes" on the Cluster exporting the volume and verify the \"--thin-enabled\" property. If it is not set to 'true' set it to 'true' with the VPlexcli command 'virtual-volume set-thin-enabled true -v volume_name'.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Use the CLI command "virtual-volume set-thin-enabled true -v volume_name" to enable the thin-enabled property for the virtual volume.

details.customerDescription: Scsi Unmap command processing is rejected by VPLEX because the volume is not thin capable or thin enabled.
details.internalDescription: Scsi Unmap command processing is rejected by VPLEX because the volume is not thin capable or thin enabled.
details.formatString: Rejecting Unmap command as volume is not thin enabled, ITL %s: (%s)(%s)(0x%016"FS64x", %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: VPLEX will not process the Scsi Unmap command having the Anchor bit set in the CDB.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: VPLEX will not process the Scsi Unmap command having the Anchor bit set in the CDB.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: This is a known limitation with the Scsi Unmap command support in VPLEX.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If problem persists, collect host side version, patch, etc. information and contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: The host has sent a Scsi Unmap command with the Anchor bit set.
details.internalDescription: The host has sent a Scsi Unmap command with the Anchor bit set.
details.formatString: Rejecting Unmap command having anchor bit set, ITL %s: (%s)(%s)(0x%016"FS64x", %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: VPLEX has received a Scsi Unmap command with an invalid value in the CDB for parameter list length.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: VPLEX has received a Scsi Unmap command with an invalid value in the CDB for parameter list length. This is not processed by VPLEX.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If problem persists, collect host side version, patch, etc. information and send to engineering.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If problem persists, collect host side version, patch, etc. information and contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: VPLEX has received a malformed scsi Unmap command.
details.internalDescription: VPLEX has received a malformed scsi Unmap command.
details.formatString: Rejecting Unmap command having Invalid Parameter List length, ITL %s: (%s)(%s)(0x%016"FS64x", %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A Scsi Unmap command could not be processed because of a slab memory allocation failure.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A Scsi Unmap command could not be processed because of an internal firmware memory allocation failure.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Run the collect-diagnostics utility to collect system information to determine why preallocated slab ran out of memory. This issue has to be escalated to engineering to determine the root cause.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Run the collect-diagnostics utility to collect system information to determine why an internal firmware memory allocation failure occurred. Please contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: A Scsi Unmap command could not be processed because of an internal firmware memory allocation failure.
details.internalDescription: A Scsi Unmap command could not be processed because of a slab memory allocation failure.
details.formatString: Rejecting Unmap due to failure in allocating resources, ITL %s: (%s)(%s)(0x%016"FS64x", %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: VPLEX has received a Scsi Unmap command with more than the supported limit for the number of block descriptors.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: VPLEX has received a Scsi Unmap command with more than the supported limit for the number of block descriptors. This is not processed by VPLEX.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If problem persists, collect host side version, patch, etc. information and send to engineering.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If problem persists, collect host side version, patch, etc. information and contact EMC Technical Support.

details.arguments: numOfDescriptors maxUnmapBlockDescriptorCountSupported protocol initiatorPortWWN targetPortWWN LUN luId
details.customerDescription: A Scsi Unmap command could not be processed because the number of block descriptors are more than the limit supported by VPLEX.
details.internalDescription: A Scsi Unmap command could not be processed because the number of block descriptors are more than the limit supported by VPLEX.
details.formatString: Rejecting Unmap command as num of descriptors %u, above maximum of %u supported, ITL %s: (%s)(%s)(0x%016"FS64x", %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: VPLEX has received a Scsi Unmap command with more than the supported limit for the number of blocks.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: VPLEX has received a Scsi Unmap command with more than the supported limit for the number of blocks. This is not processed by VPLEX.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If problem persists, collect host side version, patch, etc. information and send to engineering.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If problem persists, collect host side version, patch, etc. information and contact EMC Technical Support.

details.arguments: numOfBlocks maxUnmapBlockCountSupported protocol initiatorPortWWN targetPortWWN LUN luId
details.customerDescription: A Scsi Unmap command could not be processed because the number of blocks specified are more than the limit supported by VPLEX.
details.internalDescription: A Scsi Unmap command could not be processed because the number of blocks specified are more than the limit supported by VPLEX.
details.formatString: Rejecting Unmap command as num of blocks %u, above maximum lba count %u supported, ITL %s: (%s)(%s)(0x%016"FS64x", %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: VPLEX has received a Scsi Unmap command with an out of range LBA
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: VPLEX has received a Scsi Unmap command with an out of range LBA.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Investigate why the host was not respecting the size of the volume advertised by the VPLEX. Verify the host-issued LBA and VPLEX reported max LBA.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Investigate why the host was not respecting the size of the volume advertised by the VPLEX. If problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.arguments: volume_LBA max_LBA protocol initiatorPortWWN targetPortWWN LUN luId
details.customerDescription: The host has sent a Scsi Unmap command having an LBA beyond the end of the volume.
details.internalDescription: The host has sent a Scsi Unmap command having an LBA beyond the end of the volume.
details.formatString: Rejecting Unmap command for end LBA 0x%"FS64x", above maximum of 0x%"FS64x", ITL %s: (%s)(%s)(0x%016"FS64x", %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: ZPEM does not know how to monitor the SSD because it has an unsupported model number.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An unsupported model number has been detected for the SSD.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Replace the unsupported SSD with a model that is supported for this VPLEX platform.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Service to have the SSD replaced with a supported part.

details.customerDescription: SSD is not supported by VPlex.
details.internalDescription: SSD is not supported by VPLEX and must be replaced.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s: SSD drive is %s because it's not a model supported by VPlex.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: SSD had a silent data loss failure, which means the device has lost data and the device itself doesn't know when this failure happened or what data was lost, ie what block(s). The device failed to retain data or had a data corruption itself. Unable to determine what data was lost and it's unkown how this may affect VPLEX.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: SSD experienced an internal data loss fault.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Drive must be replaced if this event was ever observed. Note, a zpem restart will hide this failure but drive is not healthy to be used in VPLEX even if ZPEM is not reporting the fault anymore.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Service to have the SSD replaced.

details.customerDescription: SSD experienced an internal failure and is marked as faulted.
details.internalDescription: SSD experienced a data loss and is marked as faulted.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s: The SSD drive is %s due to an internal data loss fault.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: SSD is approaching its end of life triggered by a high erase counts and approaching a critical threshold.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: SSD is approaching its end of life.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Proactively replace the SSD.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Proactive replacement required, please contact EMC support.

details.customerDescription: SSD is reaching its end of life.
details.internalDescription: SSD is reaching its estimated 5 year life time.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s: The SSD drive is %s due to a high erase count.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: SSD has reached its end of life triggered by the erase counts hitting the critical threshold.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: SSD has reached its end of life.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Replace the SSD immediately.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Service to have the SSD replaced.

details.customerDescription: SSD has reached its end of life.
details.internalDescription: SSD has reached its estimated 5 year life time.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s: The SSD drive is %s due to a high erase count.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: SSD is approaching its end of life triggered by low spare blocks and approaching a critical threshold.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: SSD is approaching its end of life.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Proactively replace the SSD.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Proactive replacement required, please contact EMC support.

details.customerDescription: SSD is low on spare blocks indicating its near end of life.
details.internalDescription: SSD is low on spare blocks indicating its near end of life.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s: The SSD drive is %s due to a low spare block count.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: SSD spare block count is below the acceptable limit. Drive may go into a read-only or brick mode if it loses more.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: SSD is below the acceptable spare blocks threshold.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Replace the SSD immediately.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Customer Service to have the SSD replaced.

details.customerDescription: SSD is faulted due to lack of spare blocks.
details.internalDescription: SSD spare block count is below an acceptable threshold.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s: The SSD drive is %s due to a lack of spare blocks.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A path is indicted when too many heartbeat messages were lost to the remote director. This is due to (1) network connectivity issues to the remote director, or (2) the remote director became down or unresponsive.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This is due to (1) network connectivity issues to the remote director, or (2) the remote director became down or unresponsive.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the status of directors, WAN and/or local networks depending on which path is being indicted. Use "comu sh nodes" to see if (1) the average ping of an indicted local path is well below 1ms, (2) the average ping time of an indicted WAN path is on the same scale of the metro delay, (3) the number of drop and retransmitted messages is very small compared to the TX and RX messages.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check network connectivity and the status of directors and contact EMC support.

details.customerDescription: A communication path is being removed.
details.internalDescription: A communication path is being removed.
details.formatString: rtt prober indicting path %s to uuid "0x%016"FS64X

details.customerDescription: A communication path has been established to a director.
details.internalDescription: A communication path has connected to a director.
details.formatString: path %s connected to uuid 0x%016"FS64x"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A communication path is disconnected as a result of path indictment, which is caused by network connectivity issues.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A communication path being disconnected is caused by network connectivity issues.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the WAN and/or local network path on which indictment occurred. Verify that there are no connectivity issues along this path. Use "comu show nodes" to verify if paths have intermittent issues by looking for large number of drops or retransmits.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check network connectivity and contact EMC support.

details.customerDescription: A communication path has been disconnected.
details.internalDescription: A communication path has been disconnected.
details.formatString: path %s disconnected from uuid 0x%016"FS64X"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is caused by connectivity disruptions between directors.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This is caused by connectivity disruptions between directors.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if there are path indictments and director departure events and network connectivity. This event will not persist after solving network issues.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: A connected director is out of date.
details.internalDescription: A connected director is considered out of date because the received key does not match the transmit key.
details.formatString: domain \"%s\" on node 0x%016"FS64X" is out of date: local transmit key 0x%016X peer receive key 0x%016X

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Some component(s) in the commuication layer is taking abnormally long to complete on the receive end.

details.customerDescription: Receiving messages took longer than normal.
details.internalDescription: Abormally long poll cycles observed on the receiving end.
details.formatString: rx poller elapsed %"FS64u" us

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Some component(s) in the commuication layer is taking abnormally long to complete on the sending end.

details.customerDescription: Sending messages took longer than normal.
details.internalDescription: Abormally long poll cycles observed on the sending end.
details.formatString: tx poller elapsed %"FS64u" us

details.customerDescription: The specified protocol is used.
details.internalDescription: The specified UDCOM provider implementation is used.
details.formatString: using %s udcom implementation

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A trace file has been created because it did not exist.

details.customerDescription: A trace file problem has been corrected.
details.internalDescription: A nonexisting trace file has been created.
details.formatString: Corrective action taken on tracefile: 0x%x

details.customerDescription: The connectivity status of a director has transitioned to a new status.
details.internalDescription: The connectivity status of a director has transitioned from the old state to a new state under given event.
details.formatString: UDComDomain 0x%016"FS64X" \"%s\": %s -- %s -> %s

details.customerDescription: Link on an IO port has become up.
details.internalDescription: Link on a CMI port has become up.
details.formatString: %s: link up at %u x %u MT/s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Link on the CMI port has gone down. This event happens if the CMI port is disabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Link on an IO port has gone down.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if the CMI port is disabled on purpose.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC support.

details.customerDescription: Link on an IO port has gone down.
details.internalDescription: Link on a CMI port has gone down.
details.formatString: %s: link down
